loans.name: James

texts.en:
B. James is a hard-working and determined gentleman from Ntungamo. He is 48 years old and is married with 5 children, 3 of whom are still in school. 

James has a retail shop that deals in general merchandise in Park Yard, Ntungamo Municipality. In the shop, he works closely with his family and he is able to make genuine profits from his sales. In order to boost his income, James is also involved in the sale of matooke, milk and coffee. He needs a loan to be able to restock his 10-year-old shop with more merchandise so that he could increase his profitability. 

James says that he began his retail shop with proceeds from his agricultural sales business. His dreams and future plans are to be able to acquire a land title as well as expand the business so that he would be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To restock merchandise for resale

loans.name: Maria Annie

texts.en:
Maria Annie M. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Annie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods, and detergents in the local community. Maria Annie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maria Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Annie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Maria Annie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. This loan will be Maria Annie's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She enlarger her business

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es: Basilia Cruz C. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 48 años quien inicio con un pequeño caramanchel donde vendía arroz, aceite, chiverías etc. actualmente tiene una pequeña venta y realiza buñuelos (postre a base de yuca, queso y miel) negocios en los que invertirá el préstamo.
texts.en: Basilia Cruz C., age 48, is a hardworking, industrious, and entrepreneurial woman who has started her business by putting up a tiny awning where she sold rice, cooking oil, yogurts, etc. Currently, Basilia has a small shop and also sells buñuelos (a type of deep-fried dessert made of cassava, cheese, and honey). She plans to invest the loan into these businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of staple grains and ingredients for making deep-fried snacks (buñuelos)

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Bayaraa G. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvs Province in Mongolia.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His wife works as an engineer for the Gold company which is operated on seasonal. 

Bayaraa operates a trading business.  He travels through the countryside selling a variety of goods such as salt, silk, fabrics, tea etc, to the herders and in return he gets raw materials which he then sells to the local market for profit.  He started his business in 2005 and has gained much experience in his trade.  After years of operation, he managed to expand his business and his working capital has increased by 1,300,000 MNT.  Bayaraa is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items and other products for his trade.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing items and other products for his trade.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda F. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Amanda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Amanda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amanda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Amanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Meet some of the teachers from The SLC (Sierra Leone Church) Primary School, situated in Blama, near Kenema city. SLC Primary School, Blama.  It was built in 1902 by the Anglican Mission.  One of the oldest schools in the region, the school is staffed with five teachers and has an enrollment of 315 pupils.  This is the first loan that teachers of SLC primary school are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these teachers’ standard of living will certainly improve. 

Elizabeth C. is the leader of this group of teachers.  She is age forty-eight.  She was born in Blama, a village near Kenema city.  She is married to a police officer and the couple has five children – three are already grown-ups, one is in primary school and the other in secondary school.  Elizabeth has been a teacher for twenty-seven years now.  Elizabeth will use her share of this loan to buy house building materials such as bags of cement.

loans.use: To buy house building materials such as bags of cement.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a special loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. She lives in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one child. 

Maria is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her bakery by purchasing flour, sugar, eggs, cake molds, gas and other items. She makes good cakes and candies. She has had her business for 5 years, after she received her first loan of $50 US. She enjoys serving customers and taking care of her child. Her future plan is to become a successful businesswoman. She will use the profit to save. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cake molds, utensils, etc.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en:
Gaspar B. is from the village of La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 37 years old. Gaspar is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gaspar engaged in the agriculture sector, planting assorted crops to sell. Gaspar has been engaged in this activity for three years earning a monthly income of 4,000 PHP.

In 2006, Gaspar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gaspar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Gaspar is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Gaspar from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business for educational purposes.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Godofrido

texts.es: Godofrido, de 39 años, natural del distrito de Huanta departamento de Ayacucho; convive con  Sofía de 40 años de edad padres de 04 hijos, quienes conforman la felicidad de su hogar y viven en su propia casa situado en la  Av. el Aeropuerto del distrito de Kimbiri. Godofrido, tubo que dejar su ciudad natal para albergarse y buscar un buen porvenir en la ciudad de kimbiri; Godofrido es estibador trabaja con las empresas y ferreterías descargando y cargando diferentes materiales como sacos de cacao, café y materiales de construcción; viene realizando este trabajo como 15 años aprovechando su buena masa muscular, goza de su trabajo y de la buena remuneración que le otorgan a diario y acumulando un aproximado de 80 soles de ingresos diarios. Cuenta que las precipitaciones de lluvia propias de la naturaleza no son de su agrado por ser impedimento  para su trabajo, así imposibilitándose con las cargas y descargas de los materiales. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de útiles escolares como: uniformes, libros y cuadernos ya que sus hijos vienen cursando el año escolar y con el resto del dinero incrementará de víveres su tienda de abarrotes. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es implementar su puesto de ventas ya que con ello obtendrá mas ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente agradecido con la Institución. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará útiles escolares para sus hijos y con el resto del dinero comprara víveres para su pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Godofrido is 39 years old.  He comes from Huanta district, in Ayacucho department.  Godofrido lives together with 40 year-old Sofia and they have 4 children together who bring happiness to their household.  They live in their own home in Av. el Aeropuerto, in Kimbiri district.  Godofrido had to leave his home town in order to seek a better future in the town of Kimbiri.  He is a stevedore and works for companies loading and unloading materials such as sacks of cacao and coffee, and building supplies.  He has been in this job for 15 years, taking advantage of his muscular build.  He enjoys his work and the good wages that he receives every day.  He makes, on average, 80 Peruvian soles a day.  He tells us that he doesn't much like the rain that nature sends because it is an obstacle to his work and makes unloading and loading materials impossible.

Godofrido has requested this loan to buy school supplies such as uniforms, books and exercise books because his children are starting their school year.  He will use the rest of the money to increase the stock of food products in his grocery store.  His main priority right now is to stock his sales location because it will allow him to make more income.

This is Godofrido's second loan through MFP and he pledges to continue making his repayments on time.  He feels grateful to our institution.  Godofrido will use the 1,000 soles he has requested to buy school supplies for his children and will use the rest of the money to buy food products for his small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his children and to buy products with which to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36-year-old man, married and father of three, who works in the clothing business. He lives in Bint Jbeil and has eight years of experience. His sells clothes by traveling with his van between villages. Ali is committed to his work and loyal to his clients. 

This Ali's third loan. He reports that the previous loans helped him increase his income. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his capital. In the future, he wishes to expand his business and start selling wholesale.

loans.use: To buy new spring and summer collection in good prices

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar es padre de familia de 2 pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Hace tiempo el señor adquirió una vivienda de interés social que por lo regular son muy pequeñas y la fachada que tienen son muy sencillas, este crédito será el tercero que tramita en esta institución donde ha demostrado una buen historial de crediticio y agradece el apoyo brindado por que con estos créditos ha podido realizar sus proyectos. 
Omar ahora en este préstamo desea remodelar la parte de enfrente de su casa y para esto necesita comprar material de construcción y pintura para darle hacerle una bonita fachada y diferente al que su hogar
texts.en:
Omar is the father of two young children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Some time ago, Omar acquired a house through a government-subsidized housing program.  These houses are generally very small and the exteriors are very simple.  This loan will be the third that Omar has had from this institution.  He has a good credit history and he is grateful for the support that he has been given through these loans which have enabled him to carry out his projects.

Omar would like to use this loan to remodel the front of his house.  He needs to buy building supplies and paint so that he can make the front of his home look nice.

loans.use: to remodel the front of his home

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn A. is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Pantaon, a part of Ozamiz City. Madelyn is a farmer who plants and harvests cassava for sale. She has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Madelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Madelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, her first from GDMPC, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo es un hombre muy querido en el municipio de La Paz, vive con su esposa y tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Con pocas cosas es que Wilfredo ha realizado obtener el negocio que tiene actualmente el ofrece jabones, desinfectantes, papel higiénico, fósforos, sopas, pan, y granos básicos así  poco a poco amplió el surtido hasta lograr adicionarle lo que le soliciten. Su sueño es tener la pulpería bien surtida que atraiga a sus clientes, esta es la razón por la cual solicito su crédito comprara víveres, grano básicos en mayor volumen y estantería.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a very well liked man in the La Paz municipality.  He lives with his wife and one minor child.

Starting out with just a few items, Wilfredo has managed to grow his business to what he has today.  He sells soaps, disinfectants, toilet paper, matches, soups, bread, and other basic products.  Little by little, he expanded his inventory until he could have the items that his customers were requesting.

His dream is to have a well-supplied general store that attracts customers.  This is the reason he is requesting the loan, with which he will buy provisions in greater quantities as well as shelving.

loans.use: buy provisions in greater quantities, as well as some shelving.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru:
Тамара родилась в городе Нарын (Нарынская область, Кыргызская Республика). 
Замужем,  имеет трех взрослых детей, проживает с мужем и является опекуном  двух внучек - школьниц. Тамара была старшей дочерью в простой семье фермера и большую часть времени посвящала домашним хлопотам: присматривала за младшей сестрой, занималась домашней работой и небольшим хозяйством. По окончании школы Тамара поступила в Пржевальское училище г. Каракол (Иссыкульская область, Кыргызская Республика) по специальности продавец. Там же она познакомилась со своим будущим мужем и в возрасте 18 лет, Тамара вышла замуж. В 1968 году, у них родился сын. В этом же году они с мужем решают переехать в село Жайылма (Чуйская область, Кыргызская Республика),  где устраиваются в местном колхозе на работу - она в качестве доярки, он в качестве тракториста. Колхоз выделил им участок в селе на строительство дома. В 1970 и 1972 году Тамара родила еще двух дочерей. 
Хозяйством семья Тамары обзавелась не сразу. На выделенном им государством участке земли она выстроили дом и начали развивать собственное хозяйство за счет приплода скота. Со временем две старшие дочери вышли замуж и отделились от родителей,  и  в качестве поддержки для них,  Тамаре пришлось продать часть скота. В данное время Тамара с мужем получают пенсию и дополнительно  работают в колхозе в качестве сторожей.
Сейчас в хозяйстве у Тамары имеются 2 быка и 10 овец. В планах у Тамары увеличение поголовья скота, и для этой цели, она запрашивает кредит в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS). 
Тамара  мечтает о дальнейшем расширении своего хозяйства, чтобы создать условия для достойной жизни ее семьи.

ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Tamara was born in the city of Naryn  (in the Naryn region of the Kirghiz Republic).
She is married with three grown children.  She lives with her husband and is the guardian of two school-aged granddaughters.  Tamara was the eldest daughter of a simple farm family.  She spent most of her time doing household chores: looking after her younger sister, doing homework, and doing housework.  When Tamara graduated from school she started studying sales at the Przhevalsky Vocational College (in the Issykulsky region of the Kirghiz Republic). There she met her husband, and she married when she was eighteen.   In 1968, she had a son. That year they decided to move to Zhajylma village (in the Chujsky region of the Kirghiz Republic) where they got jobs as a milkmaid and as a tractor operator. The collective farm allocated them some land in the village to build a house.  In 1970 and 1972 Tamara gave birth to two more daughters.
Tamara's family did not immediately have a farm.  On the land allocated to them by the state, they built a house and started the farm with cattle they had bred. In time, the two oldest daughters married and left home.  Tamara had to sell part of their cattle to help support them.  Presently, Tamara and her husband receive pensions and also work on the collective farm as watchmen.
Now on her farm, Tamara has two bulls and ten sheep.  Tamara plans to increase her cattle, and therefore is asking for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS).
Tamara dreams of further expanding the farm to create living conditions worthy of her family.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs. Min is a 59-year-old married mother who currently lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. She is a local rice farmer. She has always worked on the farm since she was single. Crop planting is the main source of Mrs. Min’s income. She is making about US$3 per day. She is a widow woman who lives with her three children. One child is married and two are single. Two of her kids are a sewing worker and a foreman construction worker. Mrs. Min would like a loan of $700 in order to plant a lotus crop and buy a new boat to start a fishing business.

loans.use: to plant a lotus crop and buy a new boat to start a fishing business.

loans.name: Pierre Angulaire Plus Group

texts.en:
Pierre Angulaire Plus is a group of 12 owners of small businesses chaired by Lili. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Lili is 47 years old, married and a mother of seven children between the ages of 15 and 34. Three of them attend school. The rest of the children are independent. 

Lili sells smoked fish. She has been in business since 1974. She has acquired solid experience selling smoked fish. Since she joined one of Hope’s groups called “Pierre Plus,” her business has been significantly reinforced through 12 loans she received from the MFI HOPE DRC. She repaid them all properly. 

Through her sales, Lili makes about $70 per week. She plans to use the next loan to purchase some more bags of smoked fish and resell them at a profit in order to increase her income. She dreams one day to open a boutique. 

Lili likes selling because it gives her the opportunity to make contacts with many different people, and once they become permanent clients, she is able to offer them quality products at a better price.

loans.use: to purchase some more bags of smoked fish to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Resplandecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RESPLANDECER” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Irene. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de chalinas, producción, iniciación de negocio y servicio.
 
La señora Irene,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora que visito su casa. En la actualidad ella pretende hincar un negocio de costura de ropa, ya que aprendió corte y confección hace una año atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de una máquina de coser que adquirirá de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto)  y posteriormente elaborado los productos los venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y el cuidado de nuestra salud.

En la fotografia las acompañan las dos hijas de la Señora Justa, ellas son las dos muchachas que se encuentra adelante
texts.en:
The “Resplandecer” (To Outshine) communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Center.  It has six members and is led by a governing board headed by Irene.  The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of businesses, among which are: sweater sales, production, starting a business and service.

Irene tells us that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer and that she did so thanks to an invitation from a promoter that visited her at home.  Currently, she intends to start a dressmaking business since she learned sewing and dressmaking a year ago.

The loan she’ll take out is to buy a sewing machine that she’ll get in La Ceja (commercial place in the city of El Alto) and once she starts making items she will sell them based on orders.  This way of working will allow her to generate resources to support her future family since she’s currently single.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit training and the health services.

In the photograph two of Justa’s daughters appear; they are the two young girls in front.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Mama. She is a widow and has three children, aged 30, 32 and 38 years. Mama has one additional dependent who lives with her because she assists her with her schooling.  

In 2001, Mama established her palm oil and African costumes business. She began her business after gaining enough experience from her late husband.  They were doing business together until he died. Then she started her own business to help her support her children.  

Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,100,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mama has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase 20 40-gallon containers of palm oil at SLL 100,000 and 20 suits of cotton textiles at SLL 40,000. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 250,000. 

In the future, Mama plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for palm oil and textiles.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha de 55 años, es soltera, vive en casa de unos familiares, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Monsefú que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona de alta actividad comercial, turismo y en los sitios aledaños agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace varios años Martha se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar telas para seguir elaborando sus prendas de vestir y vender a su clientela y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Martha es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre trata que su salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que a veces se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 55 years old, single, and lives at the home of some relatives. They receive all of the basic services. Martha resides in an urban area in the District of Monsefú, which is part of Chiclayo Province. This area has a high amount of activity in the retail and tourism sectors. There are areas nearby for farming and livestock breeding.

Martha has been sewing and selling garments for several years. She operates her business at home and has her own customer base. With the income she earns, Martha is able to cover her daily personal needs.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 PEN in order to buy fabrics so that she can continue producing clothes to sell to her customers. As a result, she will be able to generate more income for improving her quality of life. Martha is a hardworking and earnest woman who always tries to press forward despite the difficulties that sometimes occur in life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for producing clothes.

loans.name: Saleri

texts.en:
Saleri is a forty year old married man who has four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

The responsibility to look after the family rests on Saleri. He has been operating a retail shop for six years. He got his start up capital from farming. His hardships are price fluctuations and theft during the transportation of goods. His vision for the future is to have a wholesale shop plus, to educate his children.

Saleri needs the loan facility to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to resell.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is a focused businessman aged 32. He is single. For the last two years, he has been operating a m-pesa (mobile-phone money transfer business), photocopying and a printing business to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to open another outlet of his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy printing paper. Thanks to Faulu Kenya,he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy printing paper.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheng, 46, resides in the Prey Chor district. She is a married woman who has six children. One of her children has already married and lives independently. 

Currently, Mrs. Chheng raises some pigs behind her house. From this business, she can earn approximately $1 each day. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a carpenter. He can generate a little income with Mrs. Chheng for using for the daily expenses. 

In order to make more revenue, Mrs. Chheng has decided with her family to request some funds from HKL and Kiva in order to buy additional pig feed and piglets. She hopes these funds will make her family meet happiness and prosperity, and gain more benefit.

loans.use: to buy additional pig feed and piglets.

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: Petrona De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de quesillos, hace más de 6 años que tiene este medio de vida pues siempre le ha gustado este tipo de actividad ya que todos los días se relaciona con sus clientes sale a vender sus productos todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde pues además tiene que atender a sus 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de bolsas, cremas, tortillas, servilletas, sal, entre otros.
texts.en: Petrona De Los Ángeles sells 'quesillos' (tortillas filled with soft cheese and pickled onion and a sour cream sauce).  She has been in this line of work for more than six years and has always enjoyed this type of activity as she gets to mix with her customers every day.  She goes out every day to sell her products, from 7 o'clock in the morning until 6 o'clock in the evening.  She also has to look after her two dependent children who are still in her care.  Petrona will use this loan to buy bags, creams, tortillas, napkins, salt, etc.

loans.use: to buy bags, creams, tortillas, napkins, salt, etc.

loans.name: Argin

texts.en:
Argin, 28, is married and lives in the Philippines. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

Argin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nojood

texts.en: Nojood is a 32-year-old young woman. She is a tailor and her father is a worker with a decent salary. Nojood wants to improve her work by tailoring clothes of a high quality, so she wants to purchase a new sewing machine. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $1,200 from FATEN. When Nojood gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase a new sewing machine and improve the quality of her work so she will produce more and increase her sales. This will lead to an increase in her income. Nojood is a conservative woman, so her brother is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Tuichi

texts.ru: Туйчи женат и имеет 3 детей. Он занимается откормом скота и выращиванием пшеницы более 7 лет. Он опытный и профессионал в своем деле. Ему помогает сын и жена, они сеют пшеницу и получают хороший доход каждый год. Прибыль, который получает от продажи пшеницы он хочет построит хлев для скота. Туйчи хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян картошки и пшеницы, а также ядохимикатов.
texts.en: Tuichi is married and has three children.  He has been involved in fattening up livestock and growing wheat for over seven years.  He is an experienced professional in his business.  His son and wife help him by growing wheat, and together they earn a good income every income.  Tuichi wants to use he profit that he gets from the sales of wheat to build a barn for his livestock.  Tuichi wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of potato and wheat seeds and also pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old man; who recently got married. He helps his mother making pickles like olives and cucumber pickles and different types of spices and seasonings such as thyme and sumac, then packs them for sale.

Mohammad is now applying for a loan to buy more ingredients that are need to make more types of pickles and spices, so they can distribute to other food markets and shops.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients that are need to make pickles and spices.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz de 27 años es madre soltera de 2 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia, ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Viene dedicándose en la venta de productos de primera necesidad desde hace 4 años atrás, con el mismo entusiasmo  de siempre y con las ansias de obtener mejores ingresos para así darles a sus hijos una mejor alimentación, educación y vestido. Ella vio una rentabilidad muy buena en este negocio, por que no le es muy trabajoso, pero tiene un inconveniente, no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poder surtir con productos que sus clientes requieren, razón  por la que ella recurre a MFP, a solicitar un crédito para abastecer su bodega. Liz esta contenta con este negocio por que si le genera buenas ganancias, generalmente trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones sus dis hijos la ayudan. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que está agradecida y comprometida en cumplir con el pago de sus  cuotas. Liz agradece a los de su banco comunal y MFP por permitirle ser parte del banco comunal.
Con los 1.000 nuevos soles Liz adquirirá más productos de primera necesidad para su bodega
texts.en:
Liz is a 27 year old single mother with two children.  She lives in her own home, which is located in the Pichari district.  She has been selling basic necessities for four years and still has the same enthusiasm as ever.  She longs to earn higher income so that she can better feed, clothe, and educate her children.  

Her business is very profitable and it is not very difficult to manage.  However, she has one obstacle: she does not have sufficient working capital to stock up on products that her customers request.  So, she is turning to MFP to request a loan to supply her general store.  Liz is happy with this business because it generates good income.  Usually, she works alone but her two sons sometimes help her.  

This will be her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.  Liz is grateful to the members of her communal bank and to MFP for allowing her to be part of the communal bank. With the 1,000 nuevos soles, Liz will purchase more products for her general store.

loans.use: to purchase more products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren is a 62-year-old mother, widowed and has two children.  One of her children is a barber and the other one is a factory worker.  Ren has been farming for 30 years and is her main source of income. With her current business, she earns around 10 U.S. dollars per day. 

This is Ren's first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and will use some of the loan to rent a farm to grow more rice. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and extend her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Alonso

texts.es: Alonso de 48 años, convive con Elizabeth de 45 años, fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Alonso es un hombre dedicado a los negocios, pues se dedica al reciclaje de botellas descartables papeles y cartones, esta actividad lo realiza en todos los distritos y comunidades del VRAE, recorre gracias a que cuenta con una movilidad que pueda facilitar el transporte. Al ver que en éstos últimos años esta actividad estaba dando buenos frutos se empeño en insertarse en este negocio que viene proporcionándole buenas ganancias. El único problema que tiene es no contar con suficiente cappital para invertir, y comprar buena cantidad de productos ya que a más volumen es mayor su rentabilidad. En un futuro desea él mismo procesar los productos reciclados. Este será su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Él está contento con el buen desempeño que tienen sus integrantes de su banco comunal. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles incrementará su capital de compra de más productos reciclables.
texts.en:
Alonso is 48 years old, and lives with Elizabeth who is 45. The couple has one child and lives in their own house located in the Pichari district. 

Alonso is dedicated to his business; he makes his living by recycling bottles, disposable items, paper, and cardboard throughout all the districts in the Apurímac River and Ene River Valley. He is able to travel to all of these places because he has a vehicle, which simplifies his transportation.

Seeing that in recent years, this line of work had been yielding good results, Alonso strove to get involved in recycling. So far, it has provided him with good profits. The only problem he has is that he does not have sufficient capital to invest and purchase a large quantity of products. It is more profitable to deal with greater volumes of recyclables. 

In the future, he wishes to process the recycled products himself. This will be his first loan with MFP, and he commits to punctually making his repayments. He is pleased with the good performance of the members of his communal bank. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, he will increase his capital to purchase more recyclable products.

loans.use: to purchase more products to recycle.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia vende zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, pepinos y papas, ella vende en el mercado desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como tomates, zanahorias, tomates y lechugas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Gloria, 33, belongs to the “Tinka” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.  She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling vegetables.  She sells carrots, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers and potatoes in the market from 9am until 5pm and is able to support her children with this small business.  She wants to expand and improve the vegetable selling business and is asking for a loan to buy vegetables like tomatoes, carrots, tomatoes and lettuce at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district, Chy, 21, is the mother of a young child. 

She grows crops on rented farmland to generate income for her livelihood. Her husband always assists her in the business. Together, they are able to earn approximately $5 each day to cover their daily expenses.

Chy would like to take out a loan from HKL to pay the rented farmland, on which she will plant potatoes and some types of vegetable crops in a new cycle. This loan will enable her to sustain her farming business. In the future, Chy intends to buy and own a few pieces of farmland herself to increase in her income.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland fees.

loans.name: Gina Maria

texts.es: Gina María, a sus 27 años de edad ya es madre de dos hijos de 5 y 7 años, por los que trabaja todos los días fuertemente con el ánimo de sacarlos adelante, y poderles brindar todo lo que necesitan. Gina María se caracteriza por ser una persona que siempre quiere dar lo mejor de si, y siempre quiere impactar positivamente la vida de las demás personas. A Gina María sus clientes le reconocen que siempre los atiende de la mejor manera, y es por esto que siempre la buscan para comprar sus productos. Gina María se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 5 años a la venta de mercancía como zapatos, jeans, tenis, entre otros productos de uso personal, y gracias a esto se genera los ingresos necesarios para poder cubrirles las necesidades básicas a sus 2 hijos. Gina María tiene un gran sueño y es el de que su negocio crezca y pueda abrir un local comercial en su municipio, de modo que esto le genere mayores ingresos y pueda mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus dos hijos. Gina María actualmente tiene pedidos de sus clientes que debe satisfacer, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar la mercancía, pues los clientes nunca le pagan por adelantado. Es por esto que Gina María tiene el anhelo de que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de esta mercancía y pueda así responder a los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes. Gina María aspira a que sus ventas crezcan, y en los últimos meses se ha visto como se han incrementado, es por esto que Gina María esta en la espera de que los ingresos extras que esta generando, le permitan ahorrar para poderles brindar a sus hijos la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Gina María, 27, is a mother of two kids aged 5 and 7 years old. She works for their future every day with the hope of getting her family ahead and providing for their needs. Gina María is known for being the type of person that always wants to give the best of herself, and she always wants to have a positive impact in other people's lives. Her clients recognize that she always assists them in the best possible way, so they continue to buy her products.

Gina María has 5 years of experience selling merchandise such as shoes, jeans, sneakers, and other personal use products. Thanks to her business, she has been able to earn an income to cover the basic needs of her two children. Gina María has a dream to grow her business and open a local business in her municipality. This will allow her to earn a higher income and improve her family's quality of life. Gina María has many orders from her clients, but she's been unable to buy them because she does not have the capital and her clients do not pay in advance. 

Gina María will use the loan to buy the merchandise ordered by her clients. She hopes that her sales will increase, which she has seen in the last few months. The additional income will allow her to save money for providing her children with the best possible education.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sneakers, and jeans to fulfill orders made by her clients.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 22 years old. She is married to Joseph and together they have been blessed with two children of 9 and 4 years respectively.

Esther runs diverse businesses.She sells vegetables and fruits as well as charcoal. She has done this business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of about KES. 12,000.Esther also sells phone accessories.

She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, of KES. 30,000, to purchase buy a motorcycle.

She will use the anticipated profits earned to educate her children, as well as to improve the living standards of her family. Esther's hopes and dreams are to have improved standards of living, as well as to bring her business to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase buy another motorcycle to serve more customers as well as make more income to help her educate her children and provide for her family's needs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 61 years old, widow with one child. 

Edna has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Edna has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, sugar, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
This business is a member of Queen Esther Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Phyllis M. is a very hardworking. She is married and has five children. She is the assistant secretary of the group.

Phyllis operates three businesses jointly with the husband that is selling water, paraffin and welding. While the husband is mostly based at the paraffin pump which is far from the home stead, she manages both the welding and water supply which are at their area of residence. Her businesses are performing well as she is the only person doing the welding and sale of water business in the area.

loans.use: With the money that Phyllis has requested, she plans to improve her welding business and the paraffin one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HIS FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Afi Dede

texts.en: Afi K. lives in Nkurankan, Ghana. She works with agricultural produce such as yams, cassava, plantain and smoked fish. She has four children in her care. To raise enough income to enable her to take care of them, she is seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva, through Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nurjahan

texts.en:
Nurjahan B. of 42 years of age, wife of 48 years, is a member of Achal Mohila Somity. She has one daughter and three sons. She and her husband set up factory in her won residence. She prepares 7 different types of biscuits and bread. Her husband and 2 sons assist her in purchasing raw materials and supplying finished biscuits bread to different food shops in Gazipur district. 

She is doing fine and wants to increase more production. She will purchase more raw materials and equipments for the factory. She requires US $ 1,175.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and equipments.

loans.name: Nicolasa Ambrosio

texts.en:
Nicolasa Ambrosio C. Velasco is 55 and has lived through some pretty rough times. During the violent years of the 1980’s civil war in Guatemala her house was burned to the ground and her father-in-law was tortured and killed. It still near enough that it brings tears to her eyes when she discusses the subject. But right now she’s making do with her several businesses: she raises chickens and pigs, weaves the traditional Mayan top called a huipil, and even has a little tiny store that carries sugar, soap, and other such daily necessities. She’ll use this loan to increase her animal production, adding 15 chickens and 3 pigs. The chickens will be half for laying eggs and half for later sale for meat. Nicolasa can make about US$4.00/week of profit on her eggs, a significant boost.

Nicolasa and her husband have 9 children, most grown, but with two daughters (13 and 16) still at home. Their 16-year-old is deaf, a significant challenge in a culture with no deaf-specific education. Most of the kids have received at least an elementary education. Nicolasa never did get much education, despite her dad’s best efforts. He would take her to school, but she would hide and not go in. She did get just enough to be able to read and sign her name.

Nicolasa’s husband commutes every day to Guatemala City, where he works in a flower company. The two of them do have some health problems at this time of their life; she has gastritis and he has high blood pressure. But they’re doing pretty well, and she can walk all the way up a a pretty remote road to her home far above the highway. Her dream is to develop the store into a much larger concern, with all of the items needed for daily living.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Nicolasa attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase 15 chickens, 2 pigs, and yarn for weaving

loans.name: Evelyn Patricia

texts.en:
Evelyn Patricia L. D. has been selling good quality clothes and shoes for 5 years. Her best customers are clerks, who need to dress nicely for work. The Christmas season has started, and sales will be very good during this season.

Evelyn Patricia is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase more shirts, trousers, skirts, blouses, dressing-gowns, and shoes to increase her sales. She is a single mother with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school, and she wants to increase her income to pay the school expenses.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli H. is 31 years old, married with two kids. She applied for this loan in order to buy supplies she needs to run her fast food  business. She sells at the local school every week and makes a profit of 160 Tala ($64 USD) per day which is a great financial help to her family. Kalameli hopes to use her next loan to build a special place to sell. She is very happy to be in the loan program and hopes to remain in it for a long time.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her fast food stall

loans.name: Alejandra Angela

texts.es:
Mrs. Alejandra´s main business is threefold : a bakery, wholesale and retail bread distibutor. She has a stall in the local market and a small general store in her home selling food and refreshments. This entrepeneur started her businesses with her own savings.

Her permanent stall in Leon´s market sells bread wholesale and retail. She is a single mom with a child currently studying in high school that she wants to provide for.

Ceprodel has been at her side financially with 19 loans in the last three and a half years. All the loans have been duly returned. We are glad to have been an instrument to help Mrs.Alejandra and her family better their living conditions through her bread sales.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Cathérine A. was born on 5 May 1973 in Adidogomé. She did not have the chance to socialize much - at a young age, she helped her parents in working in the fields and at home. Having become an adult, she has never had the chance to learn a trade. She obtained her first loan to sell earrings, and so now she is no longer entirely dependent on her husband. Moreover, she is able to contribute to the household expenses. Married and the mother of one (1) child, she has another child of her husband's in her care. Dynamic and honest, she was able to repay her first loan without problems, and is now asking for another one. This new request for $200 will allow her to go to the Cotonou market in Accra to sell jewelry, bracelets, and other goods. With this income, she hopes to do more for her family, especially the children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Cathérine est née le 05 mai 1973 à Adidogomé. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. A bas âge, elle aidait les parents dans les travaux champêtres et domestiques. Devenue majeure et n’ayant appris aucun métier. Elle sollicita un premier crédit pour la vente de boucles d’oreilles, et aujourd’hui elle ne dépend plus entièrement de son mari. D’ailleurs elle contribue plus aux charges de la famille. Mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant, elle a un autre enfant de son mari en charge. Dynamique et honnête, elle a pu rembourser normalement son crédit et sollicite un autre. Cette nouvelle demande de $200 va lui permettre à faire le marché de Cotonou et d’Accra pour la vente des bijoux, bracelets et autres. Avec les revenus, elle espère faire plus à la famille surtout aux enfants.

loans.use: To stock up on and sell earrings

loans.name: Kyebando Central B(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Deborah K.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and selling matooke. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Deborah is 38 years old and is married to her husband, who is a driver for work. She has 1 child of age 15, who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Deborah is joined in her small group by Alice Bulule, Betty N., Jalia N., and Sylvia N.. Alice Bulule has a business in poultry farming and wants to order more chicks and buy chicken feed. Betty N. is currently operating a beauty parlor business and wants a loan to add to the business. Jalia N. operates a business of selling clod drinks and wants to purchase a fridge. Sylvia N. is currently in the business of carpentry and is requesting a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To add to her business and stock more groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria, 46, studied to be an accountant. She has three children who still live with her. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She started her business selling "shambar" (a traditional dish of the city of Trujillo), an idea that was born because there were a lot of people in the area from Trujillo, and beer which she also sold. Later, she started selling beauty products. She's now added earrings, necklaces and other handmaD. items to the products she sells.

Maria belongs to the Rey D. Reyes ("King of Kings") community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. With the first loan, she bought supplies to make shambar along with beauty products for resale. With this loan of S/.1000, to be repaid in four months, she will buy 10 cases of beer along with perlitas, ribbons, buttons and lace to make the products she makes by hand. Her greatest wish is to aircondition her house and set up a space for selling fruit, yogurt and the beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Esther Martínez S. D. García tiene 46 años D. edad, estudio la carrera D. contabilidad. Tiene en total tres hijos que aun dependen D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. Moche en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Su negocio se inicia con la venta D. shambar (plato típico D. la ciudad D. Trujillo), la idea nace porque en la zona llegaron personas que realizaban trabajos urbanos, además tenia algunas cajas D. cerveza, el cual también ofrecía. Posteriormente ingreso a la línea D. productos D. belleza. Actualmente la señora Maria Esther se dedica también a la elaboración D. aretes y collares y otros productos manuales.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Rey D. Reyes” lugar donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todo tipo D. menestras para la elaboración del shambar además algunos productos D. belleza para tener en stock. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 el que cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 10 cajas D. cerveza así también perlitas, cintas, botones y blondas para elaborar algunas manualidades. Su mayor sueño es acondicionar e implementar su casa para vender ensalada D. fruta, yogurt y los productos D. belleza.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Mr. T. B. lives in the Santa Ana of Juigalpa neighborhood in Chontales, Nicaragua with his family composed of 4 children and his wife. Nowadays all his children go to school, because of his own efforts he has been able to start a bakery that allows him to support his family, his desire is to make progress in his business and with this loan he plans to buy raw material (flour, baking powder, butter, etc.) that will allow him to develop his business and answer the demands of his local customers in the urban area of Juigalpa; historically his relatives have worked in this field, this has enabled him to have an established clientele and continue developing his family environment.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. T. Bermúdez, habita en el Barrio Santa Ana de Juigalpa, Chontales junto a su familia compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposa; actualmente todos sus hijos van al colegio, por esfuerzo propio ha logrado establecer un taller de panadería que le brinda el sostén familiar, su deseo es de progresar y a través de esta solicitud de financiamiento pretende comprar materia prima (harina, polvo de hornear, mantequilla, etc.) que le permita desarrollarse y dar respuesta a su demanda localizada en el casco urbano de Juigalpa; históricamente su descendencia familiar ha laborado en este trabajo, lo que le ha permitido tener la clientela establecida y seguir desarrollando su entorno familiar.

loans.use: To buy raw material for his bakery.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is looking for a loan to invest in improvements for his house, such as plastering walls and adding a floor. For the past sixteen years, he has worked as a security guard at the Jacinto Hernández Hospital. He also dedicates himself to farming on a small lot, an activity he conducts on the weekends and on his days off. Despite not having the opportunity to attend school, he has been a hardworking and responsible man who has worked in the country to obtain basic food necessities to augment the small income he earns. He has five daughters and one son, all of whom are in school. His wife works at a packing plant and helps with the household expenses. His dreams are to have a dignified dwelling and that his children finish their educations so they can become professionals and find stable employment.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco está solictando el crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es repellar y poner piso a su casa de habitación. Trabaja para el hospital Jacinto Hernández como guarda de seguridad desde hace 16 años, tambien se dedica a cultivar diversos cultivos en una pequeña parcela los fines de semana y los dias libres que tiene. A pesar que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ha sido un hombre trabajador y responsable que ha trabajado en el campo para así obtener los alimentos básicos como apoyo a los ingresos que él obtiene, tiene 5 hijas mujeres y 1 hijo varón, actualmente todos están estudiando. Su esposa trabaja en una empresa empacadora de quequisque y aporta con los gastos del hogar. Su sueño es tener una vivienda digna que la familia amerita, y que sus hijos estudien para que en el futuro lleguen a ser profesionales de bien y tengan estabilidad laboral.

loans.use: Plaster the walls and install a floor in his house.

loans.name: Bibijamilya

texts.ru:
Jamilya R. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 30 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her parents and is the sole breadwinner of her family. She works at the Bahor market in Vahdat. She has a vending lot where she sells fruit and vegetables. She buys goods wholesale and sells them retail. Se has already been in this business for ten years. To increase sales, she would like to get a loan. She plans to repay the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Рашидова Джамиля жительница города Вахдат. Джамиле 30 лет . Она не замужем и детей не имеет. Живет с родителями и сама полностью обеспечивает свою семью. Работает на рынке «Бахор» города Вахдат.Имеет торговую точку где продает овощи и фрукты. Скупает товар у оптовых торговцев и продает в розницу. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. В данный момент хочет увеличить товарооборот , поэтому решила обратиться к нам за получением кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase sales

loans.name: Gbassivi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Gbassivi B. (née Ego), born in 1972 in Egocopé, is a storekeeper who currently lives in Logodomé in the Vo prefecture. She is married and has three children. In view of her increasing business, she is requesting financing in order to sell food products. She plans to use this funding to develop her business, and she will then be able to improve the living conditions of her family and most particularly ensure that her children can go to school, since their father’s meager income falls short of meeting all the household expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Gbassivi née EGO en 1972 à Egocopé, est une commerçante qui vit actuellement à Logodomé précisément dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Vu l’évolution de son activité, elle sollicite un financement pour vendre des produits alimentaires. Par ce financement, elle compte progresser dans son commerce et sera capable d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et surtout assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants car leur papa par son maigre revenu n’arrive pas à couvrir toutes les charges de la maison.

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Adita

texts.es:
Mrs. Adita belongs to the “Las Azucenas II” Communal Bank located at AA.HH Fernando Belaunde Street Lino Velázquez Mzc. Lt.2, in the Yarina Cocha District, Department of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and has 4 children. She decided to invest in food sales with the first loan of 300 soles ($125) that she received from Manuela Ramos. Adita goes out to sell her food every night on the patio of her house and her customers are very happy to be able to savor the exquisite flavor that only she knows how to make. With this loan of 1,500 soles ($525), which she will repay over 5 months, she will buy two dozen chickens, condiments, and ingredients to prepare her food. Adita is a very enterprising woman who knows how to get ahead. She has succeeded in educating her children and feels very grateful because an organization like Manuela Ramos has trusted her and given her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adita, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el AA.HH Fernando Belaunde Jr. Lino Velásquez Mzc Lt.3, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años es madre de 4 hijos. Adita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de comida. Adita sale a vender su comida todas las noches en el patio de su casa, sus clientes se siente muy contentos con ellos de saborear ese exquisito sazón que solo ella sabe hacerlo. Con este préstamo de S/ 1.500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 doc. Pollos (aves), condimentos y víveres para que pueda preparar su comida. Adita es una mujer muy emprendedora que ha sabido salir adelante, ha logrado la educación de sus hijos y se siente agradecida porque una institución como Manuela Ramos haya confiado en darle un crédito.

loans.use: Buy ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Mr. Khen Y., 52, lives in Orchar Commune in the Battambang Province with his wife, Mrs. Kimchhean Chhun, 48. He has been working as a chief construction worker since 1998 and currently earns around US $7.00 per day. His wife stays home to care for children and cook food for the family. They have four children, one of whom is married. The others live in the family home and help support the family. One sells groceries and another one is a car repairer who earns around US $1.50 per day.

In order to increase the family's income, Khen wants his wife to be able to have a business selling porridge from their house. Khen would like to request a loan to purchase ingredients for making porridge and to decorate his house for selling porridge.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making porridge and to decorate his house for selling porridge

loans.name: Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculo Group 4

texts.en:
"Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculo" is a group of 20 women, of whom 5 are applying for their first loan. Crucita S. is the group representative. She is an older woman with two older children. When you look at her you can tell she has been through a lot in her life. She has lived in the same community for many years, and for her entire life she has been living day to day without a steady income. She is excited to do something different with her life and is ready to make a change and start to better her life. She hopes to help her children out of their poverty some day as well. 

Crucita plans on opening a small cafe and dreams of having a big coffee shop some day. She and the rest of the group are all ready for the first step towards bettering their lives! On behalf of Crucita, the rest of the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Open a small cafe

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. F. is a 28-year-old married woman. She and her husband have one child who is currently in school. She is a petty trader, and she has been in the trading business for the past 4 years. More specifically, she trades in spices such as peppers and onions at a table in the local market. Judith proudly states that her business has enabled her to support her child's school expenses.

Even so, she is seeking a loan to expand and improve her business by increasing her inventory. In particular, she would like to buy more bags of peppers and onions. Accordingly, she hopes to double her savings to continue to take care of her child in school and to cover other family expenses.

Judith is a member of the community group known as the Knowledge Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of her group's meetings.

loans.use: To expand and improve her trading business by purchasing additional bags of peppers and onions.

loans.name: Mr. Boy Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people from Tuol Tbaeng village in Takeo Province have grouped themselves for a village bank loan and Mr. Boy U. is the village bank president. He is a bicycle repairman. His wife, Mrs. Heng Sothea, is a fish breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and Mr. Boy U. decided to ask for a loan for his wife to buy fish for her  breeding business. He hopes that her business will increase their income and provide a better life for their family. He is 25 years old and a father of a child who is still too young to work or study. Mr. Boy U. did not come to take the loan, so his wife appears in the group picture in his stead.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product. This loan is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor because it allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fish for his wife's fish breeding business.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
La señora Lucina A. tiene 42 años, vive con sus dos hijos, quienes le ayudan en el negocio familiar, que es la venta de ropas usadas, este negocio es vital para la familia, ya que es su sustento diario. 
Ellos comenzaron el negocio aproximadamente hace 10 años, ella es madre y padre para sus hijos.
Los dos estudian gracias a su trabajo. Ella necesita de este crédito para seguir creciendo en capital económico y social, ya que indirectamente también ayuda a otras familias, pues da trabajo a otras señoras de la zona. En el futuro desea construir su propio salón, y así ampliar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Lucina A. is 42 years old. She lives with her two children, who help her in the family business, which is the sale of used clothes. This business is vital for the family, since it provides their daily living. They began the business approximately 10 years ago. She is both mother and father for her children. The two children study thanks to her work. She needs this loan to continue growing in social and economic capital, since she also helps other families indirectly by giving work to other ladies of the area. In the future she wants to build her own salon, and thus expand her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing such as T-shirts, shirts, bermuda shorts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en: Theresia S. is an entrepreneurial Tanzanian woman. She is a poultry keeper at Makangarawe Ward in Dar es Salaam. She raises poultry for both cooking and for laying eggs. Her poultry produces ten trails of eggs per day. She sells eggs to retailers for domestic use and to cafes and restaurants. She requests a loan of Tshs 800,000. ($600) to construct more poultry cages.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is a mother of four. She is 35 years old and married. She lives in Ipaja, Lagos state, Nigeria. Joke sells cooked foods and her restaurant is very popular within her community. She also sells drinks and bottled water. She has been in this business for the past five years. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
D. Shuhrat is married and the father of 2 children. An electrician by training, he left this trade in favor of truck farming,  a very profitable business that requires significant financial means. Today he needs to expand his cultivatable land and increase his revenues. Shuhrat seeks a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. This will allow him to increase his production and better satisfy his clientele. 

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of Alexander the Great's rule.  It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes,  is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and to a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriela B. is a resident of Biasong, Misamis, Occidental and has been a member of Paglaum MPC under its microfinance program at Golden Pot Center since 2004. Mrs. B. is a member in good standing and has experienced more than ten loan cycles.

Mrs. B.’s business started with PHP 3,000 capital for a sari-sari store. She managed her business well. Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional sacks of rice for her store because as she is a licensed NFA rice retailer. She dreams of renovating her store into a concrete one.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en: Mrs. Mary Cris F. is 40 years old, married and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She has three children. In light of the global crisis, her husband sought work, and eventually he was employed but far from his family. At first she experienced difficulty and had to make a big adjustment. In order to help her husband, she began to buy and sell fashion jewelry (silver). It was a good decision because she earns additional income. She got her capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Most of her sales come from orders, so 98% is sold already. Aside from fashion jewelry, she is also a dealer of Natasha, MSE & Avon Products. Today, she is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of fashion jewelry such as silver. Someday, she aims to have a store for fashion jewelry.

loans.use: Buy fashion jewelry

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel vive con su esposa y dos hijos en un terreno construido en la ciudad de Nava Coahuila que su mama la señora Xochitl G. les regalo.
El trabaja en una empresa en el área de chofer de maquinaria con una antigüedad de 2 años.
Son una familia establecida en su casita, pero la familia esta creciendo y cada día requieren de mas espacio; por esta razón es que están solicitando este crédito para la construcción de un cuarto y así ir dándole a la familia una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel lives with his wife and two children on land his mother, Xochitl G., gave them in the city of Nava Coahuila. He has worked for a local company as a machine operator for two years. As a family, they are very vested in their home, but the family is growing and every day they need more space. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to build a new room and give his family more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room at the rear of home

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es: Don Bismarck  labora como guarda de seguridad en la escuela Francisco Aaron Joce desde hace 6 años  este cliente tiene dos hijos  el mayor de 11  años estudia su tercer grado y la niña menor de 7 añitos estudia 2 do grado de educación primaria, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4to crédito para invertirlo en la construcción de una habitación y asi tener mejor comodidad en su casa,  en los dias libre  trabaja como agricultor cultivando la tierra para asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, tiene munchos deseos de superación personal se caracteriza por se muy humilde, trabajador, honesto  bien responsable con sus deberes, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos economicos son una familia  muy unida,  Su sueño es  tener una casa con mejores condiciones como todo cuidadano aspira, tener salud,trabajo y que su hijos estudien para que lleguen hacer personas de bien.
texts.en:
Don Bismarck has been working as a security guard for the school Francisco Aaron Joce for 6 years. He has two children, the oldest, 11, is in third grade and the girl, 7 years-old, is in second grade. He is requesting refinancing of his 4th loan to be invested in building a room and thus improve the comfort of home. On his free time he works as a farmer to improve his family's living conditions. His wife is responsible for the chores. He wishes to achieve personal improvement, he is humble, hard-working, honest, and very responsible with his duties. In spite of being a family of restricted economic resources, it is a very united family. His dream to to have a house with better conditions, which every citizen wants, have health, work, and that his children study to become good individuals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room.

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
"B. Ngô Thị (20203050089) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. B. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 16 (16).

B. is married and has 5 school-aged children. To making a living, B. works in someone else's business venture in the arts sector operating a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. B. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $84) a month from these activities.

B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. B. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 dong which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. The loan will be the 1st loan she has taken out from SEDA. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Trương Thị

loans.use: To repair a vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Palapala

texts.en:
Palapala F., 64, is married with five children. She is in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala.

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Palapala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, knives, chemicals, seeds, a spade, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is 32 years old and a married mother of three beautiful children. She lives with her husband and children in a single room apartment. She is a forceful achiever and is very committed to her work. She trades in assorted soaps and detergent, and she also sells sachet water in bulk. Eva takes delivery of soap from the nearby city of Kumasi. Mostly she sells her goods by hawking them at market centers and from house to house.
