Due to the nature of her business she has become very popular in her community. However, lack of adequate funds means that she is not able to buy more stock, making it difficult to make enough profit. Eva desires to save more for her children's education, and with her two years of selling experience she is sure that she can repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted soaps, detergents and sachet water

loans.name: Aufaatasi

texts.en:
Aufaatasi J. is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Saleilua. She is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Aufaatasi operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale. Aufaatasi has been engaged in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Aufaatasi  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aufaatasi  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Aufaatasi  is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Aufaatasi from SPBD. Aufaatasi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria sells clothes, sarongs and bags. She is 35 years old and married with four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan amount of 50000 NGN to purchase more clothes and sarongs. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Lafia sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles  vivent dans des  familles monogames à Kamalen Sirakoro I’ un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur onzième  prêt solidaire, tous les passés ont été bien remboursés.  Elles font la vente de tasses, de pomme de terre, de  condiments alimentaires, de pommes  et de tissus.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 colis de tasses, 15 sacs de pomme de terre, 20 cartons de pomme, des condiments alimentaires et 20 pièces de pagne wax.
Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako et dans le grand marché de Sikasso ville et  vendent à domicile, dans  les différents marchés de Sikasso au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, d’hommes et de quelques  forains.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles ambitionnent d’aider leur mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et d’autres pour acheter une moto pour leur déplacement.
texts.en:
The women of the Lafia group are all married and have an average age of 33 and on average, 3 children. They live in monogamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro I, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, and they are on the 11th solidarity loan, all past loans having been reimbursed correctly. They sell basins, potatoes, condiments, apples and fabrics.

With their new loan, they intend to buy 10 packs of basins, 15 sacks of potatoes, 20 cartons of apples, some condiments, and 20 lengths of African “wax cloth”.

They do their buying in Bamako and in the big market of Sikasso town and they sell out of their homes and in the various marketplaces of Sikasso, for cash, retail, and for credit to a clientele composed of women, men, and some itinerant merchants. They expect to make a monthly average profit of 35,000 F CFA, of which a part will be used for savings and family needs and the rest invested back into their businesses.

Some of them aspire to help their husbands in supporting the children; others hope to buy a motorbike to use as transport.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Humura Kisomoro Kajumba Gertrude Group

texts.en: K. Gertrude is a single woman of fifty years old. She is in a business of selling smoked meat to people and she has been in this business for over ten years. She has five children and of which two are school going and she has one dependent schooling too. She wants to add capital in her business that is she wants to purchase animals herself so that she can sell Smoked meat on large scale to expand her business. She is so encouraging and active business woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To add capital in her business that is she wants to purchase animals herself so that she can sell smoked meat on large scale to expand her business.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Mrs. Suy S. is a local chef. She is also hired by people who need her to cook food for their parties. She is 59 and a widowed mother who has given birth to two daughters. One of the daughters is married and one is single. Suy S. also depends on other income from her both daughters who are garment workers for industry at Phnom Penh. Because Suy S. doesn’t have her own motorcycle, she always needs to pay much money for a taxi. To help facilitate transportation, Suy S. requested a loan of US$300 to buy an old motorcycle, which she will use to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle

loans.name: Zesenjargal

texts.en: Zesenjargal E. and his wife operate a consumer goods trading business out of a shipping container at a local market. They sell a variety of common household goods to their customers. They purchase most of their goods from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, transporting them back to their market to sell. E. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and 4-year-old son in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son is in kindergarten and his wife, Munkhsaikhan, helps out with the family business. E. started his business in 2007 and has quickly established himself in the local business community. He hopes to soon expand his business and increase his earnings. He is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug loan to purchase more household goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more household goods to sell

loans.name: Feisal

texts.en:
Feisal, 34, is married to Ann Mukumbu and they have a 2-year-old child.  He has run his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend who is also a client. This will be his first loan with the organization, and he plans to use the loan to add more goat and chicken meat to sell to customers.

In the future, Feisal plans to open a restaurant to run alongside his butcher shop. He hopes the extra profits he will earn as a result of this loan will contribute to this goal.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun M. is 23 years old and lives with her young child and her husband in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker who is able to make about $3 of profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, has a business as a motor-taxi driver. He typically makes $7 per day. Khun M. is asking for a $700 loan for her husband, who needs to purchase a new trailer.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer

loans.name: Faith Njeri

texts.en:
Faith is a 29 year old single mother, with a daughter aged 4. She was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. She has no loan history with other MFI's. Faith has been operating a retail shop for the past 5 years and also does dairy farming as her other source of income. Faith plans to utilize the loan to purchase more stock for her shop to satisfy her customers' demand.

Faith's hopes and dreams are to own a farm and dig a bore-hole to be used as a source of extra income by selling water to the local community. She describes herself as a business-minded lady, visionary and hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock (maize, rice, detergent) to her general retail shop

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a fishing community, in the central region of Ghana. Christiana works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She runs a chop bar in her community. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Christiana has been in business for two years and desires to improve upon her business. She desires to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy food items for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy hair extensions

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Good Luck group from the small-town of Waterloo, about 26 miles away from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. The leader of the group is Abibatu K. on the right of the photo. Born in a village call Mile 91 in northern Sierra Leone, the 28-year-old has been a businesswoman for 4 years now. She sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) in Waterloo. Abibatu is married to a businessman and they have 2 children. Abibatu will use this loan to further expand her business; she will use the loan to buy gallons of palm-oil and retail it in Waterloo. 

Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where Shine on Sierra Leone partnered with SMT to start a branch.  This loan will be this group's first loan from SMT. With the help of this loan, this group will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and improve on their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm-oil

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita manages a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice farm. She is 50 years old, is married and has six children. She looks for other ways to earn extra income so she can provide for the growing needs in her household.

Amelita also works hard to maintain her farm and hopefully expand it if she has the resources. She is requesting to loan PHp 6,000 from CEVI, which she will use to fund her farm. She said she would buy farm inputs with it like seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: 06.02.01Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Yên L. T. (1) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa Thanh Hoa. Yên is the group leader for a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06.02.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa (06.02.01).

Yên is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Yên owns and operates a fishing business. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling lake-caught fish in the local community. Yên has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, Yên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to expanding her business. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be invested in expanding her business. This loan will be her eighth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. C. T. Chieu (040) is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. N. T. N. Mai (036) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. C. T. Hoa (042) is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. L. T. Gai (002) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

Yên L. T. (1) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở Hoang Hoa Thanh Hoa. Yên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.02.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa (06.02.01).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở hồ trong cộng đồng địa phương. Yên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Yên kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND. Vào 2003, Yên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Yên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. C. T. Chieu (040) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. N. T. N. Mai (036) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. C. T. Hoa (042) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. L. T. Gai (002) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El señor Javier tiene 38 años está casado con la señora Cecilia y tienen 4 hijos de 12, 9, 7,1, actualmente están pasando muy mal ya que su hijo menor  tiene una enfermedad en los dos ojos (cataratas congénita) lastimosamente la operación no pueden hacerle por que los médicos le dijeron que es muy caro (1000 $us), actualmente ellos no cuentan con esa cantidad apenas les alcanza para comer y para que los hijos puedan ir a la escuela.

Don Javier y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de viloma grande, su principal actividad es el servicio de la construcción y la esposa se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda para su posterior elaboración de queso. Tienen una pequeña casa que solo tiene 2 habitaciones.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, de esta manera incrementara la cantidad de queso para su venta y mejorara el nivel de ingresos.Entre sus metas y sueños lo más importante esta reunir dinero para la operación de su hijo menor que está sufriendo mucho con esa enfermedad , también don Javier quiera construir una casa más grande que tanga una habitación para cada uno de sus hijos ya que la que tienen es muy pequeña.
texts.en:
Javier is 38 years old. He is married to Cecilia and has 4 kids aged 12, 9, 7, and 1. They are going through rough times right now because his youngest child has a disease in both eyes; (congenital cataracts). Sadly, they cant't have the surgery because the doctors told them it is very expensive; ($1,000). At the moment they don't have that kind of money; they only have enough for food and to send the kids to school. Javier and his family live in Cochabamba city in the Viloma Grande area. His main activity is construction and his wife works in the production of raw milk for making cheese. They have a small house with only 2 rooms. The loan will be used to buy a head of dairy cattle. This way, the amount of cheese for sale will increase and so will their income. Among his dreams and goals the most important thing is to save money for his youngest son's surgery who is suffering very much with the disease. Also, Mr. Javier wants to build a bigger house with a room for each of the kids, because the one they have is too small.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a head of dairy cattle

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Cette dame est une femme mariée avec 4 enfants, son mari est un chauffeur. En 2001, elle a commencé le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son dynamisme et son expérience dans ce travail fait qu’elle en a une parfaite maîtrise. Elle fait face en ce moment à une baisse constante de son stock de marchandises et ce à cause de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir. Elle veut augmenter son stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 5 cartons de spaghetti, 4 sacs de riz, 3 boîtes de conserve et divers autres produits d’alimentation générale
texts.en:
This woman is married and has four children; her husband is a driver. In 2001, she began selling basic grocery items. She gets her supplies in Lomé. Her enthusiasm and experience makes her an expert in this business. She is currently facing the continual reduction of her merchandise stock, because her clientele never ceases to grow. She wants to increase her stock; this is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES, in order to buy five cartons of spaghetti, four bags of rice, three boxes of canned goods, and various other grocery items.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items

loans.name: Mariana Del Jesus

texts.es:
La señora mariana es casada, su esposo es maestro constructor y sus seis hijos ya son mayores de edad,  se dedica a la  venta de  tarjetas de celulares, el negocio lo tiene en su  propia casa.

Mariana antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, le gustaba mucho ese negocio, pero lo dejo porque  la gente le quedaba mal,  ella confiadamente les dejaba la mercadería y muchos no pagaban, eso le hizo desistir,  Mariana afirma  que le va muy bien en su nuevo negocio de ventas de tarjetas, tiene una producción de ventas considerables, y  eso también hace que sus ganancias sean buenas , vende tarjetas de 3, 6, y  10 dólares al mes gana 100 o 80 dólares, dependen lo que haya vendido ella compra sus tarjetas al contado a una hija que vende tarjetas su sueño es seguir con su negocio y seguir adelante, está orgullosa de su familia, y de ella misma, ella dice que se vale por ella, y que lucha por vivir, le encanta tener una vida tranquila, y saber que sus hijos también son felices.
texts.en:
Mariana is married, and her husband is a construction worker. Their six children are now grown. She sells cell phone cards, and she has this business in her house. Mariana previously sold clothes. She really liked this business, but she left it because the people did not behave well. She would confidently leave the merchandise, and many did not pay. This made her stop selling clothes. Mariana says that the new business of selling cards is going very well for her. Her sales are considerable. This, in turn, makes her earnings good. She sells cards for $3, $6, and $10. She earns between $80 and $100 a month, depending on how much she has sold. She buys her cards for cash from one of her daughters who sells cards. Her dream is to continue with her business and to get ahead. She is proud of her family and of herself. She manages, and she fights for a living. She loves having a peaceful life and knowing that her children are also happy.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy prepaid cell cards

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 52 años de edad, ella vive sola en su casa propia, ya que sus hijos son ya independientes. Hace mas de 3 años tiene un negocio de venta de artículos religiosos, como: música en CD, Biblias, afiches y Póster. Ya que ella proviene de una familia muy fiel a la religión, es así que sus ventas lo realiza por pedidos, pues la zona en la que ella vive no existe un lugar donde comprar todo ese material, es así que Rosa debe viajar por casi 2 horas hasta el centro de su ciudad en donde pueda comprar toda la mercadería necesario para luego ofrecerlos a los integrantes de su hermandad. Ella se siente contenta con su trabajo pues además de mantenerse ocupada, se siente feliz al predicar su religión. Por lo pronto desea abastecerse de mayor cantidad de mercadería y así aumentar sus ventas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, además considera que el trabajo con su grupo fue muy bueno es por ello que se compromete nuevamente a cumplir con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más CD musicales, pero de otra distribuidora donde su precio es menos y la calidad es mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old and lives alone in her own house since her children are now independent. For more than three years, she has engaged in selling religious articles such as music CDs, Bibles, prints, and posters. Rosa comes from a very religious family. Her sales are made by taking orders. Since there is not a place in her area that offers this type of merchandise, Rosa must travel nearly two hours to the central part of the city where she can acquire all the items that she can sell to members of her congregation. Rosa is pleased with her work and enjoys keeping busy, as well as sharing her faith. In the meantime, she wants to buy more merchandise so that she can increase her sales.

This is her second loan with MFP. Rosa believes that working with her group has been very good for her and renews her commitment to complete her payments. With the loan she requested, Rosa will buy more music CDs, but this time she will purchase them from another distributor who offers lower prices and better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase religious music CDs

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga M.  is 42 years old, lives with his daughter, son and mother in a traditional housing tent called a ger. His health condition is good. After graduation from the driving course, his son will help him to run a taxi. Gantulga has been working as a taxi driver since 2005 with his own car. His daily revenue is approximately 30-40 thousand tugrugs. Half of the revenue is used to fill the car with petrol. Last year, the plot of land on where they live suffered from flood and he repaired the basement of his house with the loan he had received. He is now expanding his house. Gantulga is a hardworking and modest person. He says, “What I want most is to complete our house building.” He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan for house expansion and purchasing some construction materials such as an iron roof, sand, gravel, door, window and timber.

loans.use: To expand his house.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda E. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 62 years old. Cresilda is married and has 2 school-aged children. Cresilda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily use products. Cresilda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cresilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cresilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cresilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Benkadi  6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  6 est constitué de femmes mariées du village de SESSO dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 29  ans,  5 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année et  sont à leur  premier prêt  de campagne.
BACO T. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de TENE. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de TENE, MOPTI et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 15000 à 38000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 6 consists of married women from the village of Sesso in the prefecture of San, Segou region (Mali's Fourth Administrative District). They live in traditional families. On average, each is 29 and has five children. They are peanut farmers. Hoping to make more profit from farming, the group decided to sign up with Soro Yiriwaso this year, and are receiving their first operational loan. Baco D. plans to use her loan to buy seed peanuts, small tools, and fertilizer at the big market in Tene. After the rains end, the harvest is stored long enough to increase in value and be sold in the big markets of Tene, Mopti and other nearby markets at retail (often, wholesale) to customers who mostly come from large towns. Each member of the group is counting on making a profit of between 15,000 and 38,000 CFA after their produce is sold. They will use the money to pay loan interest and day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seed and small tools

loans.name: Zambonini Group

texts.es:
En la Compañía Zambonini distante de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el objetivo de  aumentar sus ingresos   y superarse cada día más, con el dinero que recibieron se les esta brindando la oportunidad de que ellas mismas crezcan y se dan cuenta que ellas pueden superarse y de esta forma poseer su propio capital de trabajo  para emprender alguna actividad productiva, 
El comité lleva por nombre C.M.R de Zambonini una de las integrantes es la señora Gladys quien se dedica a la confección de ropas para damas y caballeros.
Sus trabajos son muy apreciados pos los clientes y el ella tiene trabajo constantemente ya que recibe muchos pedidos.
Actualmente se encuentra con muchos pedidos de ropas para invierno, y necesita comprar algunos materiales para le trabajo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de tela, hilos, accesorios de botonería para confección de ropas.
texts.en:
In the Zambonini company, far from the Office of Paraguarí, some women met with the purpose of increasing thier income and getting ahead day to day. With the money they received they are being offered the opportunity to grow and they realize that they can get ahead and own their own working capital to start a productive activity. The committee is named C.M.R de Zambonini. One of the members is Gladys, who makes clothes for men and women. Her work is appreciated by the customers and she constantly has work since she receives a lot of orders. Presently she has a lot of orders for winter clothing and she needs some materials for the work. She is asking for the loan to buy fabric, thread, and button accessories to make clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, and button accessories to make clothing

loans.name: Mirna Edith

texts.es:
Mirna Edith V. N., tiene la edad de 42 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar una vaca para la producción de leche para el consumo de su familia y si es posible para la venta. Además, su finca es de 3 hectáreas con pasto de buena calidad y también cuenta con más terneros en desarrollo y engorde. La propiedad de Mirna cuenta con un clima más fresco y con una cantidad de agua potable que fluye naturalmente desde la zona protegida del Cerro Chirripó. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de que sea una finca que se le aproveche mejor sus condiciones productivas. También, ella no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales o entidades financieras, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sea en el futuro una persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Mirna Edith V. N. is 42 years old, married and has two children who are her highest priority. She would like to purchase a cow to provide milk for her family and, if possible, to sell the milk as well. She has 3 hectares of farmland with good grass and more calves that she is fattening up. Her property enjoys a cool climate and has a large quantity of drinkable water that flows from the protected area of Cerro Chirripó. She has worked the farm for many years and wants it to grow. This is the first loan that Mirna has received from FUDECOSUR. She has no problems with her property, but wants to take better advantage of the opportunities for production. She has not taken out loans with other state banks or financial organizations, as FUDECOSUR offers her better credit facilities and much lower interest rates. She would also like to provide her children with the necessary education so that in the future they can be more prepared to deal with what life brings them. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow to produce milk

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
The middle aged woman in the photograph is Man R., age 35. She lives in a rural area of province of Phnom Penh, which is the best territory for farming. Man R. is a married mother who is devoted to her three teenage children. One of her sons is no longer in school and currently works in the construction field.

Man R. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. She also relies on the income from her husband, who owns a motorcycle to provide a taxi service. Man R. can’t earn as much income as before because his motor-taxi is getting too old and often breaks down. To help solve the problem, Man R. needs a loan for her husband to use to replace his old motor-taxi.

loans.use: To replace an old motor-taxi.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en: Lucel P. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 27 years old. Lucel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucel provides transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Lucel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lucel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lucel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hot

texts.en: Hot Y., 40, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. Y. provides services of protecting vehicles for an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is in the military, earning an income of about USD 4 per day. The family has to spend USD 60 on food, USD 10 on public transportation, and USD 40 on children’s education every month. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Katima Chantal

texts.fr: chantal est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'agoè logopé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2002. la pluie  a rendu inutilisable une grande partie de son stock de marchandises. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 40 sacs de charbons de bois. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays, dans la ville d'anié.
texts.en: Chantal is a 33-year old woman, married and the mother of three. She lives with her family in  Agoè Logopé, one of the peripheral districts of the city of Lomé. She makes al living by selling charcoal. She has been in this business since 2002.  A large part of her stock has been spoiled by rain. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 40 bags of charcoal. She stocks up in the interior part of the country, in Anié.

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is 37 years-old and married with three children.  To earn a living, he hires construction equipment. He was previously employed in an insurance firm as an insurance agent before he went into business.  As a member of Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to invest more in his business.  He hopes that he will own a big construction firm in the future.  He has requested for 20,000 Kes to buy a puller machine for hire.

loans.use: To buy a puller machine for hire.

loans.name: Gueripine

texts.en: Gueripine is 44 years old. She is married and has seven children aged between 7 months and 25 years old. All her children go to school except the youngest. Her husband works as a businessman. Gueripine has been selling cattle for nine years. She is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to sell. With the profits, Gueripine is planning to build a business structure where she would temporarily keep her cows before she sells them. She says that her business is successful and as a result she has been able to purchase a taxi motorcycle which also serves as another source of income. In the future, she would like to have larger loans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur B. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Gantumur operates a  retail dairy business in his town, together with his wife. 

Gantumur purchases his dairy products from Zuunbayanulaan and Batulzii sub-provinces and sells them at the central market in main town of the province or in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He sells a variety of dairy products wholesale to the dairy products traders in his local town and through his sibling who owns a stall in the market in Ulaanbaatar. 

Since beginning his business, he has been able not only to provide for his family, but he has also been able to purchase a plot of land and a fence where he has built a house. Gantumur hopes to continue to grow his business so that he can provide for his family in the future. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more dairy products at wholesale prices and preserve them in order to sell them when prices for such products rise.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira  J. is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married. Gulmira is a resident of Tashkomur, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband works in construction. Together they are bringing up three sons.  All three sons study at school. In order to earn money Gulmira breeds livestock animals and then sells them after fattening, at a higher price. She started this activity ten years ago with the initial investment of 1600 soms. Now in this way she earns 6000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Gulmira wants to purchase five goats in order to increase the number of livestock she owns. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock animals

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
Luis es padre de familia de dos hijos,  casado, tiene la edad de 57 años ha sido muy esforzado para apoyar a su familia.
El se desempeña como director de una ong, desde hace varios años en donde ha logrado mantener su empleo.
Este es su segundo crédito en donde ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago, siendo su primer crédito  para mejoras  a su vivienda, a si como este nuevo que será para la reparación y amplitud de dos closet. En donde comprara materiales necesarios para comenzar. Logrando mejores condiciones personales.
texts.en:
Luis has two children.  He is 57 years old, married and has worked hard to support his family.

He has worked as a manager of an NGO for several years and he has managed to keep his job there.

This is Luis' second loan.  He has shown himself to be good at making his repayments.  His first loan was used to make improvements to his home.  This new loan will be used to repair and expand two built-in closets.  He will buy the materials he needs to start the job which will help him to achieve better personal living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair and expand two built-in closets which will improve his personal living conditions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. sells cloth, provisions, cassava, plantain and other items in Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has four children. Esi has been in this business for ten years. She helps her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her income to increase the sale of foodstuffs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To increase the sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Mujeres Independientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Independientes es de la zona de San Lorenzo.
Ya son reconocidas en la zona por su trabajo en pos del bienestar de la comunidad.
Varias señoras son trabajadoras de sus propias huertas, como por ejemplo la sra Fifelina L., que también ella misma vende sus productos agrícolas una vez cultivados y cosechados, tiene todas las verduras más consumidas.
Es el primer crédito de sus vidas y lo están pagando puntualmente, ya que de lunes a viernes cultivan y fines de semana se van al mercado para las ventas de sus Hortalizas.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Independientes” (Independent Women) committee is from the San Lorenzo zone.  They are already well known because of the work they do for their community’s wellbeing.

Several of the women work their own orchards like, for example, Mrs. Fifelina L., who also sells her farm products, once they are grown and harvested, herself.  She has all the most frequently consumed vegetables.

This is the first loan of their lives and they are repaying punctually.  From Monday through Friday they farm and on weekends they go to the market to sell their vegetables.

loans.use: To buy seed, insecticide, half shades, sprinklers, hoses, etc.

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
Sixta mujer trabajadora, madre soltera con sus propios esfuerzo le brinda  a sus hijos el sustentó diario, también sus hijos le ayudan ya que venden galletita,  planes para su familia mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos se superen.
Tiene su propio negocio su puesto de venta de tortillas, se le presenta dificultades cuando se enferma ya que abandona su trabajo reiniciando al momento que se mejora. El puesta localizado en su casa.
El préstamo que solicitad es para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, leña. Agradeciéndole a la financiera por su apoyo para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sixta is a hardworking woman and single mother.  Through her own efforts she supports her children day to day.  Her children also help her, selling cookies.  Her plans for her family are to improve their house and for her children to better themselves. 

She has her own business, a stand selling tortillas.  It presents difficulties when she gets sick, since she has to stop working, starting again when she gets better.  The stand is located in her house.

The loan she is asking for is to buy corn and firewood.  She thanks the organization for its support for the development of her business.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make tortillas

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia B. is from the village of New Look. She is 48 years old. Cecelia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Cecelia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Cecelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Alicia es viuda, tiene 4 hijos; ellos ya son independientes y mayores de edad. 
Ella tiene una pequeña lavandería familiar en donde trabaja con una de sus hijas, también realiza entrega de las ropas limpias y planchadas. Ellas tienen clientes de grandes empresas; cobran en forma mensual por los servicios realizados.
Alicia comenta que está muy contenta con la ayuda que le ofrece Fundación Paraguaya con el crédito ya que es la única manera de conseguir dinero para poder conseguir superar la crisis económica, y de esa manera ayudar a los integrantes de su familia, ya que su empresa es familiar.
Ella desea el préstamo para reparación y mantenimiento de su lavarropas.
Ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Alicia is a widow.  She has four children who are all adults and independent.

She has a small family laundry where she works with one of her daughters.  She also delivers the clothes clean and ironed.  They have large firms as customers that they charge monthly for their services.

Alicia comments that she’s very happy with the help that Fundación Paraguaya provides through the loan because this is the only way to get money to overcome the economic crisis and help her family since it’s a family business.

She wants the loan to repair and service her washing machines.

She has shown herself to be a very hard working person who’s responsible with her commitments.

loans.use: to repair and service washing machines

loans.name: Nansaljav

texts.en:
Nansaljav N. is 44 years old and lives by himself in a ger, a Mongolian traditional housing tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. 

He manages a Mongolian traditional shoe-making business with the help of his relative. 

He started his business in 2005. He makes four or five pairs of shoes per day and sells them at a local market. Customers are very satisfied with the quality and design of his goods. 

His business is quite profitable during the fall, winter and spring period. Now his working capital exceeds 500,000 MNT. He is planning to expand his business in the future. 

Besides his shoe-making business he works as a plumber during summer and gets paid 300,000 to 500,000 MNT of monthly salary. 

He is a hardworking man who says, "I would like to get married in near future." 

He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase fabrics and materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Éctor

texts.es:
Don Ector, es originario de la comarca Santa Teresa, ubicada en el municipio de Condega- Estelí, esta casado, es padre de familia de 4 hijos, de oficio productor de granos básicos , lleva 37 años dedicándose a esta actividad. Inicio a temprana edad tenia diez años de edad, ayudaba a su papa a sembrar, solo llego hasta quinto grado de primaria, por su situación de pobreza se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para poder llevar alimentos a su hogar, no pudo seguir estudiando. Su papa le dejo de herencia 2 metros de tierra la cuales ha venido cultivando y ha sido sustento de su familia hoy en día. También dentro de su propia el  tiene una pulpería donde vende granos básicos que el mismo siembra su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio. 
Solicito el crédito para siembra de maíz y frijoles. Con este crédito espera poder sacar una buena producción, con granos de calidad, obtener buenas ganancias que le ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos. Le gustaría poder comprar una moto para trabajo, tiene como planes futuros aumentar sus terrenos de siembra, pues desea ampliar su venta y poder convertirlo es una distribuidora de granos básicos para abastecer de sus productos a su comunidad, y asegurarles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Éctor lives in Santa Teresa, located in the municipality of Condega-Estelí. He is married and the father of four children. He has been a farmer for 37 years and grows basic grains. He began this activity at the young age of 10, helping his father with planting. He studied only until fifth grade in elementary school. Poverty forced him to work and get food on the table, and he could not continue studying. He inherited two plots of land from his father, which he has cultivated since that time to support his family. In addition, he owns a store where he sells home-grown basic grains. His wife helps him attend the store.

Éctor applies for a loan to grow corn and beans. With this loan, he hopes to harvest a great amount of high-quality grains and get a good profit, enabling him to increase his income. He would like to buy a motorcycle for his work. For the future, he plans to expand his farm land and increase his sales, becoming a distributor of basic grains to his community. He wants to ensure a good future to his children.

loans.use: to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun S. is a 36-year-old who sews both traditional clothes and modern clothes for her neighbors and other villagers in and around her community in Kompong Cham province. She is able to earn a daily income from this tailoring business, an average of $2 a day, to support  her family. 

Chhoeun S. is married to Gnorb Him, 39, a cow seller, and they have two single children. In addition, she has been planting different kinds of crops as an annual activity. Chhoeun S. will be using her loan to pay for plowing as well as purchasing potato seed and bean seed for planting.

loans.use: to pay for plowing as well as purchasing potato seed and bean seed for planting.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Jeune femme dynamique de 33 ans, Afi est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Revendeuse de céréales et de condiment depuis 10ans  chez elle à domicile, elle s’approvisionne sur un marché de la place.elle aimerait voir son étalage s’agrandir d’où ce premier crédit.
texts.en: A young energetic woman, 33 years old, Afi is married and the mother of three. She has been selling cereals and condiments  by her home for 10 years. She stocks up at the local market. She would like to expand her stall, which is the reason for this first loan.

loans.use: to buy basic need products

loans.name: Marcial Leopoldo

texts.es:
Marcial Leopoldo tiene 52 años de edad, vive en Union  Libre vive con la compañera y con 6 hijos de 24, 22, 20, 18 11 y 8 años, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Marcial se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz en pocas cantidades papas, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y papas, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es construir la casa y comprar terrenos para seguir trabanjo.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del carnaval, salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Marcial Leopoldo is 52 years old and lives with his common-law wife.  They have 6 children aged 24, 22, 20, 18, 11 and 8, and live in San Pablo parish, in San MIguel canton.

The "Unión y Esperanza" (Unity and Hope) community bank is located in San Pablo parish, 30 minutes from our San Miguel office.  The members of this group are farmers who grow corn and potatoes.  They also sell vegetables and other products.

Marcial is a farmer who grows corn in small quantities and also potatoes.  He has been in this line of work for a long time.  He makes his purchases in San Miguel and sells his products in the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

Marcial is requesting this loan to buy corn seeds and potatoes.  This loan will help him to increase his income and production.  He faces challenges in his work such as a lack of workers and changes in the weather which sometimes damage his crops.  His dream is to build a house and buy land so that he can continue working.

Marcial enjoys celebrating carnival festivities and going out with his family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and potatoes

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, age 43, is married and resides with her five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of weaving traditional silk products, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Chenda is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more raw silk to produce more silk products to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce more silk products.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 33 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area; she’s married with five children aged between 7 and 20, all of whom live at home. Her husband is a security guard.  For the past six years she has been involved in the sale of charcoal and other goods. Her main challenge is price increases. She started this business with money from her husband. She will use the money to purchase more charcoal. She will use the extra profit to help pay for school fees and one day, she would like to own her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 24 años, es una mujer  trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pareja Rubén de 31 años y sus 02 queridos hijos, Yosu de 05 y Ruana de 01año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Luz es una madre joven, quien lucha ante las dificultades que aqueja su hogar, pero ante ello no se amilana al contrario es una mujer hábil y trabaja para sacar adelante a sus queridos hijos. Nos comenta, que se esfuerza por llevar algo que comer para sus hijos. Pues su trabajo consiste en vender ropa, ofreciéndolo en la calle, lleva  02 años en este negocio y lo poco que gana  lo alcanza para alimentar y educar a sus queridos hijos. El crédito le servirá como capital financiero para poder comprar variedad de prendas de vestir. Luz, piensa en grande y esta segura que mas adelante alquilará un puesto en los centros comerciales donde pueda exhibir con mayor tranquilidad su mercadería por lo cual se esmera a diario por ahorrar lo poco de sus ganancias. Este será su segundo crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal, trabaja conjuntamente con el resto de las socias. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en: Luz is 24. She is a hard-working woman who lives in a rented home with her partner, Ruben, age 31, and their two beloved children: Yosu, age 5, and Ruana, age 1. Her children are the motivation for all of her hard work. Luz is a young mother who works hard in the face of the difficulties that afflict her home, and does not shrink back in spite of them. She is a competent women who works to get her children ahead. She tells us that she works hard to provide her children with food to eat. She sells clothing in the streets and has been doing this for two years. Bit by bit she saves up her earnings to feed and educate her beloved children. She will use this loan as capital to purchase a variety of clothing articles. Luz thinks big and is certain that in the future she will have a spot in the shopping centers to display her merchandise with greater ease. Thus, she goes to great pains every day to save even a little of her earnings. This will be her second loan and she is very happy to know that she will have the support of lenders to continue growing. In her communal bank, she works together with the rest of the members. With the requested loan, she will invest in a variety of clothing articles.

loans.use: to purchase more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron is 31 years old and his wife is 28 years old. They have been married since 2001 and have two children--one son and one daughter. One is in school and another in still young. They live along National Road Number Six, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saron is a fisherman and assists his wife in their farming business. His wife is a lotus farmer. He is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a boat and boat motor.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and boat motor.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 61 years old and is married.  She has 6 grown children. She is living in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.  Marcelina is a charcoal seller and has proved her business ability for 30 years. For some, it is hard, tiring and dirty work.  But for Marcelina, it is work to value since she was nurtured with that kind of activity from an early age. Every month, she receives PHP 6,200.

Marcelina was an official GDMPC member in 2007. With this 4th loan, worth PHP 10,000, she plans to purchase materials for producing charcoal for sale. She is hoping to make more income from the additional investment.

loans.use: To purchase materials in producing charcoals for sale.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is 38 years old and married with seven children. All of them are studying except the second one who works as a tailor and specializes in sewing gents clothes. Her husband is a driver by profession and she supports him by selling clothes to her community clients. Due to her good variety of clothes, she receives a good number of orders every month and makes good sales. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity. That will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers and will also minimize the cost of traveling. She has been operating her business for the past 10 years and she hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and increase her income. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application with Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shaheen.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Irma Emely

texts.es: Irma Emely de veintiocho años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija menor de edad. Vive en casa de su suegra. Ella posee en la misma casa y también de forma ambulante una venta de ropa de todo tipo y estilo para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues Irma siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de muy buena calidad y a un precio realmente accesible además el servicio es excelente, ella siempre recibe a las personas con el mejor de los gustos; Irma es una mujer de propósitos llena de energía y constancia en el trabajo para ella la mejor forma de llegar al éxito y tener felicidad es dedicándose al trabajo con amor y alegría es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisetas, trajes entre otros. Irma Emely tiene la confianza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena
texts.en:
Irma Emely, 28, lives with her life partner and minor daughter.  She lives in her mother-in-law’s house.  She sells clothes at home and also as a street vendor.  She sells all types of clothes for women, men, boys and girls.  Lately she’s acquired quite a number of customers because Irma always meets their needs with very good quality products and a really affordable price.  Besides, service is excellent; she always welcomes her customers with a good disposition.

Irma is a woman full of goals, energy and perseverance at work.  For her, the best way to be successful and to be happy is to dedicate herself to work with love and joy.  This is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to purchase blouses, dresses, pants, t-shirts and outfits, among others.  Irma Emely trusts that she will be able to provide economic security and a full life to her family this way.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Letecia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Letecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina, de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 04 hijos, por quienes desea continuar trabajando muy duro para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Los verdes campos del poblado de su distrito, han sido en la vida de Faustina un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor. Actualmente posee tierras, propiedades que comprase ella y su esposo en vida, sin embargo ella sigue trabajando 12 años sobre esas tierras sembrando cacao, café y árboles. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar ya que así ve la recopemsa luego de tanto trabajo, por otro lado le resulta difícil transportar los frutos cosechados hasta los centro de acopio, situados a una hora de distancia. Por ello Faustina si logra beneficiarse con el crédito comprará animales de carga como el burro que es muy útil para el trasporte. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras. Este será su 17avo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar trabajando en la agricultura. Con el dinero solicitado comprará un burro.
texts.en:
Faustina, 46, is a hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her four children, for whom she wants to continue working very hard to give them a better quality of life.

In Faustina's life, the green fields of the town in her district have been a very pleasant place to work.  Her parents taught her this work since she was very little.  She currently has land, properties that she and her husband bought.  Nevertheless, she continues working these lands, 12 years growing cacao, coffee, and trees.

What she likes most is the harvest, since in this way she sees the reward after so much work.  On the other hand, it's difficult for her to transport the harvested products to the storage centers, located an hour away.

Because of this, if she manages to get the loan she will buy pack animals like a donkey, which is very useful for transportation.  In time, she wants to get enough money to buy new land.

This will be her seventeenth loan with MFP.  She hopes for the support of every one of you to continue working in agriculture.  With the requested money she will buy a donkey.

loans.use: to buy a donkey.

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
As a single mother of 4 children, Leni works hard to support her family.

Leni has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Leni requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Leni has been in this business for 8 years.  In the future, Leni would like to save enough to expand her business and send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es: El cliente Aquilino trabaja hace muchos años como agricultor, como el es propietario en el recae la responsabilidad donde se encuentra ubicado el lote agrícola en el Sindicato Estaño Palmito donde tiene la producción de papaya, plátano y cítricos para la producción y sustento de su familia. Entonces el cliente recurre a solicitar un préstamo el cual le ayudara en la plantación de papaya; comprara plantitas de papaya para poder hacerlas producir. El cliente es de sociedad media y persona del lugar con ganas de trabajar y empeñoso. Por lo que el credito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su familia y desarrollar mas la producción y su forma de vida ya que tiene 2 hijos dependientes a quienes tiene que mantener.
texts.en: Aquilino has worked as a farmer for many years. Since he’s an owner the responsibility falls on him.  He has a field located in the Sindicato Estaño Palmito where he grows papaya, bananas and citrus fruit to produce and for his family’s sustenance.  He has come by to request a loan to help with his papaya crops.  He will buy papaya seedlings to make them grow.  The client is a member of the middle class and a person from the place who very much wants to work and who is very dedicated.  The loan will be very helpful for his family’s progress and to develop more production and help his way of life since he has two dependent children to support.

loans.use: to buy papaya plants.

loans.name: Raihonoi

texts.ru: Райхоной более 30 лет занимается откормом скота, и она имеет богатый опыт в данном бизнесе. Все эти годы она изучила все слабые стороны бизнеса и сейчас без всяких трудностей продолжает свой бизнес. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Её муж агроном и помогает жене в бизнесе. Её любящие внучки всегда помогает ей, и она очень любит их. Ради них она усердно работает и хочет улучшить свое жилищные условия, чтобы они жили в хороших условиях. С этой целью Райхоной запрашивает займ. Займ она планирует использовать для стройки дома. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу поддержку и поощрения.
texts.en: Raihonoi has been feeding cattle for more than thirty years and she has a rich experience in this business. All these years she learned all the weak spots of the business and now she continues it without any difficulties. She is married and is a loving mother of three children. Her husband is an agronomist and helps her with the business. Her loving granddaughters always help her and she loves them very much. She works diligently for their sake and wants to improve her living conditions so they can live in better environment. With this purpose Raihonoi is asking for a loan. She plans to use the loan to build a house. She is thanking everyone in advance for the support and encouragement.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kitale, Western Kenya with her husband and four children, all of whom are in school. She has been a farmer for the last eight years,  producing milk and maize for sale in a local market. She is applying for a loan for 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a motorcycle, which she plans to use to go into the transportation business. This motorcycle will also allow her to get her own goods to market more quickly and efficiently. Her biggest challenge is diseases which occasionally affect her animals.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Etbel Jeannette

texts.es: Etbel Jeannette D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. producto D. primera necesidad y además tiene una pequeña venta D. ropa siempre en el lugar donD. resiD., ya tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues siempre tiene productos D. muy buena calidad, a precios bajos  con una atención excelente; Etbel es una mujer siempre dispuesta a trabajar le gusta mantenerse delante D. la competencia,  para ella todos los días son una lucha constante para llegar al éxito,  es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, aceites, granos básicos, bebidas, jabones, ropa etc., así podrá siempre seguir complaciendo las necesidades D. sus clientes. Etbel Jeannette tiene la esperanza que con su esfuerzo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Etbel Jeannette, 42, lives with her life partner and their children.  She has a store where she sells basic staple items and she also has a small clothing sales business, both at home.  She’s been in business many years now and she’s acquired a large clientele because she always stocks very good quality items, her prices are low and her service is excellent.  

Etbel is a woman who is always ready to work; she likes to stay ahead of the competition.  For her, every day is a struggle to attain success.  This is why she asks INTEGRAL for a loan to buy snacks, oil, basic grains, beverages, soap, clothes, etc. to always continue to meet customer demand.  Etbel Jeannette hopes that with her effort she will manage to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Kananachi A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kananachi A Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Kananachi A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a good maize yield, harvesting 24 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kananachi A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise is 51 years of age and is married, with five children.

Lise owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business.  Lise needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2008, Lise  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Lise 's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Perfecto Alberto

texts.es:
Perfecto Alberto  tiene 65 años es soltero vive con la hija. Vive en el Recinto Las Blancas en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Ventanilla 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Perfecto Alberto  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul realiza las compras de sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos como urea, insecticidas entre los más usados  para el cuidado de los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia y para invertir en la siembra en semillas e insumos.  Su sueño es ayudar a la familia para que tengan la comida diaria.

Le gusta descansar y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Perfecto Aberto is 65 years old, single and lives with his daughter. They live in Recinto Las Blancas in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank 26 de Noviembre is located in Recinto Las Blancas, belonging to the canton of Ventanas, and in this area they plant short-cycle crops of corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Perfecto Alberto is a farmer growing corn, rice, pigeon peas and he buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his crops at the Ventanas market.

He will use the money from this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost such as urea, and the widely used insecticides for the care of crops. The loan helps him to increase the family income and to buy seed and supplies. 

His dream is to help the family to have food every day. He likes to rest and to spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, compost such as urea, and insecticides

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en: Noeurn, 51, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a rice trader. Her husband is a palm sugar producer. Three of her children are employed, two are garment workers and another one helps her husband produce palm sugar to generate income to support the family. Noeurn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to raise capital in her business to buy more rice to sell. In the future, she would like to invest more money in her rice trading to make more profit, build a new house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Motivadas Por Un Sueño 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Delia is the coordinator of her group "Motivadas por un Sueño". Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seybo, an agricultural area. Before Esperanza came to her community, Delia started her business with a first loan that she took from someone in her community. A month later, Esperanza gave her a loan with which she expanded her business. This group is composed of 15 members running different businesses like shoes, clothing, cosmetics, and many other small businesses.

Delia plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing jeans, blouses, t-shirts, shoes and cosmetics. She operates a miscellaneous sales business, selling products like these and many others, such as jewels, underwear, etc.  She has had her business for almost two years. She is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She will save her profits to reinvest in her business.

She makes her home here in a simple house with her long-time partner and their three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children and to give them all they need. She is dreaming of having her own house and of having a successful business.

Two pictures were taken, one with 10 and another with five, to complete a whole picture with the 15 entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses, t-shirts, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Den

texts.en:
Den works hard to support her family. Den is married and has a buy and sell sea foods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of sea foods to sell.

Den has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Den would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of sea foods to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
