Florence is married with four children. She has been in the group for 4 years. Currently she is the group treasurer. She is a treasurer of Revelations women group and another self help group. They buy household utensils for members and distribute amongst themselves.

Florence keeps dairy cows and sells milk at Landless and Thika town. She has also a retail shop in Gatundu-Makongeni area. Due to high demand of milk, she would like to increase supply by buying more milk from vendors as well as buying another dairy cow.

loans.use: She would like to buy another dairy cow and increase stock of her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy a high breed dairy cow.

loans.name: Zachar

texts.en:
Zachar and his wife Ludmila are a husband and wife business team. Together they successfully manage a little grocery kiosk at one of the local markets in Nikopol. Both Zachar and Ludmila have higher educations but instead of directly applying their schooling, they decided to become business owners. Their family also consists of a little boy whom they love and nurture.

It has been Zachar and Ludmila’s desire to operate their business profitably and see it fully sustain their family. Today, they are seeing stability in their work and good returns. They would like to expend their grocery line in order to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. While both of them devote most of their time to their grocery kiosk, Ludmila has begun an additional business selling water filters. The couple is hopeful to see this venture take off in the future.

Through several years of partnering with “Nadiya Ukraine”, Zachar and Ludmila have proven themselves to be responsible, goal-oriented and hard-working entrepreneurs. Today, they are asking for a $1,000 loan to assist them in expanding the food items they have available in their busy grocery kiosk.

Захар з дружиною разом займаються бізнесом. В них є невеличкий кіоск з продажу харчів на одному з місцевих ринків м. Нікополь. В Захара та Людмили є вища освіта, але їм більше до душі власний бізнес. Вони виховують маленького сина. Захар та Людмила довго намагалися досягти прибутковості бізнесу, хотіли, щоб бізнес забезпечував усі потреби родини. Зараз їм вдалося досягти стабільності в торгівлі та підвищити власні доходи. На цьому етапі Захар і Людмила намагаються розширити асортимент товарів харчування, щоб задовольнити попит з боку покупців та отримати додатковий прибуток. Обидва наполегливо працюють для того, щоб досягти поставленої мети. До того ж Людмила почала займатися ще одним видом бізнесу, а саме продажем фільтрів для води. Подружжя сподівається, що цей бізнес буде не менш успішним ніж попередній. Захар та Людмила співпрацюють з „Надією України” вже декілька останніх років. За цей час вони проявили себе як відповідальні, цілеспрямовані та працьовиті підприємці. Зараз вони просять про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів харчування в своєму кіоску.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs Rosa R. has over 14 years of experience running a grocery store. "This business supports my whole family. My parents and two daughters live with me. Business is falling off because I don't have enough inventory in the store. The reason for this is that I don't have enough shelf space to display it. I'm asking for a loan of $1,200 to expand the grocery store."

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Rosa R. tiene ya más de 14 años en el negocio de abarrotes. "Este negocio es el ingreso familiar, con migo viven mis papas y dos hijas que tengo, el negocio esta reducido no tengo la mercancio en bodega, porque no tengo suficiente espacio donde exhibirla. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 DLLS. Para ampliar el negocio.

loans.use: Grocery store expansion

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. E. Esther is 35 years old and happily married with 5 children. She has been an LAPO member for 4 years. She sells local rice and river fish to those living in her community. People living in her community love local rice, and hence they like buying from her. She hopes to buy more local rice to sell with the loan she has requested.

loans.use: To buy more local rice & river fish for sale

loans.name: Felipa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Felipa has a small general store at the Leon market. She has been in business for 22 years. The early days were quite difficult. She started out selling candy and cigarettes. Later, she got a loan from Banco Popular and expanded into cosmetics, then added cheap shoes, clothing and jewelry. Felipa was widowed nine years ago and since then she has cared for her children alone. She has four children. One still lives with her, two others have set up their own businesses in Leon and the fourth has lived in Costa Rica for two years. As you can see, Felipa has had a difficult life.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora es propietaria de un pequeño negocio de mercadería en general ubicado en el mercado de la terminal de León. El negocio tiene más de 22 años de existencia, aunque en condiciones mucho más precarias. El negocio se origina a partir de la venta de cigarrillos y golosinas, más tarde la señora M. introduce la línea de algunos cosméticos mediante un crédito obtenido del extinto Banco Popular, agregando luego otros productos como ropa, zapatos baratos, bisutería en general, etc.

La señora M. es viuda desde hace más de 9 años y desde que falleció su esposo ella ha asumido el 100% de los gastos del hogar. De sus cuatro hijos actualmente uno vive con ella, dos pusieron su pequeño negocio en otros mercados de León y una vive en Costa Rica desde hace dos años. Como puede observarse la lucha de esta señora ha sido dura.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a general store.

loans.name: Khanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Khanthy A. married in 1979 and has four children, three sons and one daughter. She began her farming after she got married. In addition, she is also weaving silk at home since 1980. Her husband plants vegetables and food crops in their farm. Her daughter is working in a garment factory. One of her sons is an air conditioner repairman and the youngest son is studying at university in Phnom Penh. Khanthy’s family live on an island called Koh Uk Nhatey along the Mekong River. This location provides a lot of opportunity to the people who live in this commune, including Khanthy’s family, for doing farming and also fishing.

Khanthy has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice; she is presently asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase seeds for about $250 and the other $250 will be used to rent more land for expanding their vegetable garden.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and renting land for expanding vegetable garden

loans.name: Susana Deysi

texts.es:
Señora Susana is 28-years-old, and she finished high school. She has one small son who still depends on her. She lives in Poblado Menor Palermo in the district of Chao in the province of Virú in La Libertad. Since she was very young, her mother taught her to be responsible for taking care of animals, and this is how she learned to raise them. When she got married, she decided to make a living by raising animals like turkeys, pigs, ducks, and chickens to have her own income and not to depend only on her husband since he did temporary jobs.

Susana is a founding member of the interim group "Las Luchadoras" (The Fighters). She received her first credit of 200 soles from this group, which she used to buy food for her animals. With this credit of 700 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy young pigs to fatten and to sell later.

Susana is the secretary of the María Jesús Mothers Club, which provides breakfast and lunch to 52 senior citizens and 300 children in their community. She is also a promoter of health and is in charge of providing first aid and some medication to people in her town because the health center is far away, but she helps to transport sick people who need specialized care.

Susana's dream is to increase the quantity of animals she raises every year so she can have savings to give her son what he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Susana tiene 28 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 1 niño pequeño que depende de ella. Vive en el Poblado Menor Palermo del Distrito de Chao de la Provincia de Virú del Departamento de La Libertad. Desde muy pequeña su mamá le enseñó a ser responsable de la crianza de unos cuantos animalitos y ahí aprendió como criarlos. Cuando se casó decidió dedicarse a la cría y venta de animales como: pavos, cerdos, patos y gallinas para tener un ingreso propio y no depender solo de su esposo ya que él tiene trabajos eventuales.

La señora Susana es socia fundadora del Grupo Mientas Tanto “Las Luchadoras”, en este grupo obtuvo su primer crédito de S/.200.00 soles con los cuales compró alimento para sus animales. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 soles, que cancelará en cuatro cuotas, comprará cerditos (cerdos pequeños) para engordarlos y venderlos posteriormente.

La señora Susana es secretaria del Club de Madres “María Jesús” el cual beneficia con desayunos y almuerzos a 52 ancianos y 300 niños de su comunidad, además es promotora de salud encargada de brindar primeros auxilios y algunos medicamentos a los pobladores ya que el centro de salud está alejado, pero debe trasladar también a los enfermos que requieren atención especializada.

Su sueño es incrementar año a año la cantidad de animales que cría y tener ahorros para que pueda darle a su niño lo que necesita.

loans.use: Purchase of young pigs

loans.name: Pancha Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Pancha Maiya M. is 45 years old and lives in Thecho village with her husband and two sons. Her husband Mr. Astaman M. is unemployed. Her elder son makes traditional idols and her younger son is studying in grade7.
Mrs. Pancha Maiya M. sells goats directly to dealers. She started this business 4-5 years ago. She is happy and satisfied with her income and is seeking her third loan of Rs20,000 to buy 20 goats for raising. She started her business because she wants to be independent and she also wants to help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase goats for raising and resale

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas O. is a mother of 7, married and is 45 years old. She lives in Isashi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells kitchen supplies and has been in business for over 5 years. She needs a loan of $450 to enable her to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Mr. Ran L. and his wife, Chea Sophal, have been married since 1991. They have two children; one son and one daughter. Both of their children are in school. The family lives in Mekong River’s island, which is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Ran has been selling cows since 1991. He bought cows from other villages to resell in his village and in nearby villages. He uses the profits to grow rice and for food. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man on the island.

Mr. Run is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $400 to buy more cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Grace G.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 22.

In 2004, Grace established her liquor store. Grace has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase more beer and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purcase beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita P., 56, is married with 7 children. Her husband is a very experienced fisherman. She has 5 years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to village members at the Fugalei market (main market in Apia) 3 days per week.

She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Cover business overhead costs.

loans.name: Epi

texts.fr:
Epi A., 29, a bachelor with no children, sells gasoline in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Epi hopes with this loan to be able to buy more gasoline for re-sale so as to satisfy the demand of his clientele. This will allow him to earn more profit to support his parents and siblings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Epi A. est âgé de 29 ans célibataire sans enfant il est revendeur d’essence à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètre de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Epi désire avec ce crédit, payer plus d’essence pour la revente afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle. Ce qui lui permettra de gagner plus de profits pour supporter sa famille maternelle.

loans.use:
Purchase gasoline for re-sale

Payer plus d’essence pour la revente

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a thirty-five year old mother with two children. She lives in the community of Huayllapampa, situated thirty minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Marina and her husband make hand-crafted bricks (unbaked) that they sell to people who finish the process. Additionally, Marina has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat.

Marina is a member of the Violeta Village Bank.

Marina needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($375 US Dollars) to invest in rice, sugar, oil, and noodles to expand her business.

Marina’s dream is to expand her business and see her children finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in rice, sugar, oil, and noodles to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria Ysabel started buying clothes 6 years ago in Belice as well as shoe sales by catalogue and up until a few months ago she conducted sales from her home. But recently she saw that there were regional fairs and government sponsored activities in the neighbouring regions and clients increased dramatically in those areas. She started attending these areas to tap in to a new market and since then her sales have increased, and her family's financial situation has improved. Now she needs to acquire a greater volume of merchandise to satisfy the demand she has seen.

She needs a loan in the amount of $1000 US that will be repaid in a term of 6 months. She will use these funds to acquire a greater volume of merchandise to provide a better selection to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Ysabel hace 6 años que empezó a comprar ropa en Belice y a vender zapatos por catálogo, hasta hace algunos meses vendía en su casa , pero recientemente observo que habían diversos pagos de apoyos de gobierno y fiestas en poblaciones cercanas durante las cuales los clientes aumentaban de esta manera empezó a acudir a esos sitios iniciando así un mercado potencial diferente que le ha incrementado sus ventas y con ello mejorado su situación económica y la de sus hijos, ahora requiere adquirir mayor cantidad de mercancía para satisfacer la demanda que tiene .

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1000 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercancía para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina baji T. D. is married with one daughter and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its spicy fish, a sweet dish called Andrassay, and for decorative embroidery. Sakina baji owns the two-room brick house where she and her family have lived for the last 10 years. Sakina baji's husband has been selling buffalo milk for 20 years. Sakina baji prefers to do house work and take care of her family at home. She is applying for a loan of $525 to buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Mme  A.  Akoua est   née à Kpete  menpeassen au GHANA. Mariée, elle a pour activité l'alimentation générale. Les revenus qu’elle en tire, ne suffisent pas pour la prise en charge de son foyer, son mari étant sans emploi. Etant pratiquement la seule dans son quartier à faire ce commerce les demandes deviennent de plus en plus fortes. 

Elle nécessite alors un crédit pour appuyer et renforcer son commerce d'alimentation générale. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akoua A. was born in Kpete menpeassen in GHANA. She is married and she runs a general food store. The income she derives from it is not enough to cover her family's expenses because her husband is unemployed. Being practically the only one in her neighborhood to run this kind of business, the requests are becoming ever stronger.

Thus, she needs a loan to support and strengthen her general food store. This way, she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General food store

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Despertar ("Awaken") Communal Bank. Maria is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her four children. She has a store in the Sarita Colonia Gallery, on a street near the central market in Ayacucho. She and her husband sell a variety of clothing. Maria also sells mazmorra (a tradition Peruvian dessert made from purple corn gelatin, pineapple and other fruits) at night in front of her store.

Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy pants, jackets, sweaters and women's shirts.

Maria dreams of opening additional locations and of building another level onto her home.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar. Maria es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en la galería Sarita Colonia, que se ubica en una calle cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su esposo. Además Maria por las noches vende mazamorras en la puerta de su tienda. Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas, chompas, blusas. Maria sueña con tener otras sucursales, construir otro piso mas en su casa.

loans.use: Buy pants, sweaters, jackets and shirts

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Ten people in Kroay Wat village in Kampong Chhnang Province have formed a village bank loan group.

Mrs. Oeurn S. is the village bank president. She is a Khmer noodle maker and she sells her noodles in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Phart Sak, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice and breeds cows. Since his breeding business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Oeurn S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a calf for her husband's business. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a firewood collector; the others attend the local school. 

This is a group loan that includes end-of-term (EoT) loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly-payment loans. The members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a calf for her husband's business

loans.name: Siv

texts.en: Siv T., age 43, lives in Pursat Province. He is a local policeman and is currently earning a salary of $60 a month. His wife, Long Dina, aged 36, makes a living sewing clothes as a local tailor. She has a lot of customers and they recognize the good service she provides.  She has been earning approximately $2 per day, since 1998. The couple has no children. Siv hopes to launch a new business to provide additional income for the family’s needs. He would like to request a loan to buy fermenting equipment to produce wine for sale and purchase piglets to raise. This profits generated by this loan will improve their family’s living conditions. (siv T. was not available, so his wife is pictured instead)

loans.use: to purchase equipment to ferment wine for sale and purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy F. is 45 years old. She is married with 5 children.

Dorothy sells provisions and foodstuffs like rice, beans, plantains, and yams. She has been in this business for a long time. The demand for her foodstuffs is high in her community; she hopes to be able to meet the demands of her customers.

Dorothy is an LAPO client. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is grateful to all kiva lenders and to LAPO microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Som

texts.en: C., age 55, is a local fisherman and has been fishing for four years. He normally depends on fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake, which is the main place for fish to live. Everyday, he gives his fish to his wife to sell at the market. For other income, his wife usually raises pigs at home. The couple has been married for a long time, but has no child. They family's living conditions are not so good because some part of their house has broken; thus, C. needs to borrow a loan in order to repair their old house. The loan will allow them to have a suitable standard of living.

loans.use: To repair their old house.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị  Nguyễn Thị Nhàn  năm nay 44 tuổi, gia đình chị cps hai con đã trưởng thành và đều có công việc làm ổn định.  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2009 và đang  chăn nuôi lợn tại nhà. Anh Tứ  chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây cho thu nhập 70.000đ/ ngày. Hnàg tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và lương làm thợ xây của chồng gia đình chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. is 44 years old. Her family has two grown children with stable jobs. She joined TYM Fund in 2009 to invest in raising pigs at home. Her husband Tu works as a construction worker with an income of 70,000 VND per month. Each month, the combined income of her husband's salary, her business and her children's financial help is at 4,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 5,000,000 VND to buy more pigs for raising.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Hadbaatar

texts.en:
In 2000, Hadbaatar M., 46, started a small retail business selling organs with his wife. With the business profit, Hadbaatar's family was able to afford his two children’s weddings. Last year, they began to produce a type of oil made by boiling organs. This oil is commonly used to cook food.

The family also has a small farm with chickens. In addition, Hadbaatar fixes broken cars during his free time. Hadbaatar is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial man. In the spring, the demand for oil products usually increases.

Hadbaatar's family has four children. The oldest two children are married and live independently from their parents. Today, Hadbaatar lives with his wife and two young children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their 21-year old daughter is a student at the local university. Their youngest son is a high-school student.

Hadbaatar requests a loan to buy more organs before the season comes when oil is most in demand. Seen in the photograph is Hadbaatar's wife, Tsetsegmaa, at their organ stall.

loans.use: to buy organs to make oil.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Paglaum MPC was created to run programs and offer services to those who need financial assistance and to provide business training. Jovita B. became a member of Paglaum on April 2008.

Jovita lacks financial capital for her sari-sari store. (The word sari-sari is Tagalog for "various kinds"). Jovita only had enough money to build the sari-sari. She is requesting PHP 14,900 to buy additional goods for sale. She is thankful that she can earn additional income for her family aside from her husband.

Jovita hopes to expand her sari-sari to a mini grocery store and to have a house of their own for the family.

loans.use: Buy additonal goods for sari-sari store

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Since 1994, Regina M. has worked as a fishmonger and trader, selling fish and minerals in Elmina. She is married and has nine dependents. She has received an education through junior high school.

While Regina works as a trader, her husband is employed as a fisherman. She is responsible for paying for her family’s various expenses, including school fees and bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and minerals to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business and to build a home for her family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio S. esta preocupado por el bienestar de su familia su esposa esta embarazada y el quiere construir una habitación para cuando el bebe crezca tenga un lugar donde dormir. La casa que el tiene es de interés social por lo que es muy pequeña y quiere que este mas amplia para darle confort a sus hijos. El señor es trabajador de maquiladora, la esposa es ama de casa  se queda al cuidado de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonio S. is concerned for the well-being of his family. His wife is pregnant, and he wants to build a room, so that when the baby grows, it can have a place to sleep. The house that he has is public housing, so it is very small. He wants it to be bigger to provide comfort for her children. He is a machine worker, and his wife is a housewife, who takes care of the children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom S. lives in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Yun Yoeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow vegetables and fruits. In the field, they want to grow some vegetables to earn more money. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom S. decided to request a loan to buy vegetable seed and fertilizer to support the field to make it more productive. Additionally, she would use the loan to buy mangos to resell to earn more income for her family. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tumua

texts.en:
Tumua S., 49, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in her plantation and vegetable garden business. She sells to the public and villagers three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). She has three previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Tumua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is happy to support the program because she believes it gives her much help in her financial need.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, tools and pesticides for improving her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and poultry food

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Nguon S., 42, is a flower vendor who sells different kinds of flower in the centre of Phnom Penh city. She started her business in early 2000 and currently makes around $2.50 USD of income per day. She uses her profits to buy food for her family and ensure that both her children attain the highest level of education. Her husband also supplies a source of family income through his work in construction. Since Nguon S.’s income is only enough to meet her family’s needs, she has a big problem with transport because she doesn’t own a vehicle. She is therefore looking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle. This new motorbike will allow her to reduce her transport costs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a member of the Udugu borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 23 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 1 year.she also cares for 1 other dependent.

Khadija started her own clothing business selling clothes 2 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Khadija`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the  loan amount 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Khadija hopes to save money,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Luisa Argentina

texts.es: Luisa Agustina Martínez B. tiene 46 años. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos y todos son mayores de edad. La señora tiene 9 años de dedicarse de tener su negocio de mercadería en general, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella empezó  hace 9 años con la venta de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos, y con el tiempo fue que ella adquirió el capital necesario para establecer su negocio, a la que le ha estado invirtiendo todos los créditos solicitados. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercadearía. El sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una distribuidora en la cual emplee a otras personas y sea un ingreso fuerte para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Luisa Agustina Martínez B., 46, is married and has two grown children. For nine years she has had a business, which is located in her house, selling general merchandise. Nine years ago she started selling clothes, cosmetics, and shoes. With time, she got the necessary capital to establish her business. She has been investing all of the loans she has asked for in the business. The loan is to buy merchandise. Her dream has always been to have a distributorship in which she employs other people. That would be a strong income to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ebb Mae

texts.en: Ebb Mae A. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Ebb Mae owns and operates a specialized retail shop selling video compact discs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Ebb Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Kunggeibai

texts.en:
Kunggeibai T. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and his 7-year-old daughter in Bayan-Olgii province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His daughter is a 2nd grader in a local high school. Kunggeibai has a small shop that offers welding service for locals. He has been in the welding business since 2005 and his business has been the main source of his family income since then. With his business profits, he has been able to finance building a small house in a small plot of land that his family owns. As there is no company that offers various welding related services in his town, he is usually busy with local customers’ orders. His short-term goal is to finish building his house with his business profits. He further says that he would like to open a savings account for his daughter. 
He requests a loan to purchase raw materials for his welding business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his welding business

loans.name: Clinic Group

texts.en:
This is Clinic Group. This group has three members, Ajmal, Razia and Rakia. who all live in district 8 of Kabul Afghanistan.

Ajmal is the group leader. He is 25 and single. He lives in a family of six members. He has a shop where he sells vegetables. He is a hard-working man and supports his family through his shop’s income.

Razia, the second member of this group, has a shared business with her husband. She cleans fruits and packages them, and her husband sells them in his cart in the market. This is the only business through which they support a family of 6 members.

Rakia’s brother has a business selling mobile cards. He works in order to pay for all the expenses of his family.

They have requested a group loan of 42,000 Afghani to expand their businesses and complete the requirements. They would like to say "lots of thanks!" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his vegetable business

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey Y. was born in 1979 and is married with four single children who are employed as garment workers. Her husband works in construction to help cover the family’s expenses. Chey Y. sells Khmer cake and buys recycling for resale to raise income. She has also cultivated rice during the coming farming season for years. From those investments, she can make around $5 each day. Chey Y. is applying for a loan to sustain/improve her recycling sales business.

loans.use: To improve the business

loans.name: Griselda Concepción

texts.es: Griselda Concepción A. D. S. resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad. Griselda junto a su esposo poseen una venta D. accesorios para vehículos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio y comprar más accesorios. Griselda junto a su esposo son dos personas las cuales son muy apreciadas por sus vecinos los cuales los describen como personas D. excelente comportamiento y muy responsables.
texts.en:
Griselda Concepción A. D. S. lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband and three young children. Along with her husband, Griselda has a store that sells accessories for cars. She applied for the loan to invest in her business and buy more accessories. Griselda and her husband are well respected by their neighbors who describe them as having excellent behavior and being responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vehicle accessories for business

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Forty-five years old, Fatmata J. sells clothes, dishes, and suitcases in Makeni city. She has been in this business for more than twenty years now. Fatmata is requesting her second SMT/Kiva loan in order to further strengthen her business. Her first SMT/Kiva loan allowed her to make great improvements in her business and personal life. With the profit she made out of it, she was able to look after herself and two children. 

Having completed repaying her previous loan successfully, she is again requesting a loan of SLL 3,000,000. With this loan, she will buy two bales of lace clothes. A bale usually costs her SLL 3,500,000. Thus Fatmata has to add to this loan amount to enable her to buy two bales of lace clothes.

loans.use: Buy two bales of lace cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand and improve their business by purchasing quality fishing equipment

loans.name: Meripa

texts.en:
Meripa F. is 40 and married with 3 children (ages 2 - 12 years).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Meripa has many years of experience in this business.  Meripa needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 tala or US $63 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Meripa joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Meripa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Meripa F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.89 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.45 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.55 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Florida's Group

texts.en:
Florida D. G. lives in the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 34 years old, and leads a 17-member loan group through ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Florida is married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by running a general store where she sells shampoo, soap and toothpaste to people in her local community. Florida has been engaged in business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, she joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. Florida has applied for her third, for 7,000 PHP, to expand her small store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines and has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand several small businesses

loans.name: Enoque Manuel

texts.pt:
Enoque Manuel M. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Provincia de Gaza, sul deMoçambique tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 17, 15, 13 e 11 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. fez somente 7ª classe naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta ainda seus pais enviando dinheiro e bens alimenticios.
 Nunca saiu de Boane, apenas saiu da casa dos pais para a casa propria depois de casar, ainda no mesmo Distrito. Ė proprietario de uma alfataria e alfaiate de profissaõ, trabalha com sua esposa que tambem desenvove a mesma actividade, faz em media 12 horas de tempo por dia. Por vezes tem feito trabalhos de electrecidade auto na empresa de camiões LALGY. Neste negocio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000mt por  més, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum com amigos atraves de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa ).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos. conheceu  a Hluvuku através de seus colegas que também saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de corte e custura (tecidos, linha de cozer e outros) para produzir uniformes escolares e roupa diversa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para o seu negocio, para tal compromete se a pagar devidamente o emprestimo para poder aceder a mais no futuro.
texts.en:
Enoque Manuel was born in the District of Chibuto, in the Gaza Province, in the South of Mozambique. He is 36 years old, married and the father of 4 children, 17, 15, 13 and 11-years old. The children are all in school. He only went to school until the 7th grade due to his parents' lack of financial resources. He owns the house he lives in with his family. He supports his parents by sending them money and food. He has never left Boane. He has only moved from his parents' home to his own, in the same District, after getting married. He owns a tailor shop and is a tailor by trade. He works with his wife who is also in the same trade. He normally works 12 hours a day. Sometimes he works doing electrical work in vehicles for the LALGY trucking company. His business brings and income of 10.000mt per month which goes towards house expenses and a traditional rotational savings system he participates in with his friends (Xitique). He has never had loans from other banks. He came to know about Hluvuku through his colleagues who are members. This is fourth loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt. He intends to purchase sewing supplies (fabric, thread and others) to sew school uniforms and various clothing items. The previous loans were for 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt and 15.000.00mt, all for the same activity. In the future, he would like to request more loans for his business. He makes a commitment to pay when due so that he will have access to more loans in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of fabric to sew school uniforms

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es: Cesar tiene 26 años es soltero no tiene carga familiar cuenta con buenas referencias personales, vive en casa de sus padres tiene amplia experiencia en el transporte ya que uno de sus sueños es adquirir su propia movilidad, trabaja como chofer alquilando una movilidad hace mas de 6 años , a Cesar le gusta mantener en buen estado su herramienta de trabajo , tiene experiencia crediticia con montos pequeños,solicita dicho credito para invertir en el mejoramiento de su dormitorio, se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 26, is single and does not have family responsibilities. He has good personal references. He lives in his parents’ house. He has vast experience in transportation. One of his dreams is to acquire his own vehicle. For over six years he has rented a vehicle and worked as a driver. He has credit history with small loans. He is asking for the loan to improve his bedroom. He is able and willing to pay his loan back.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Impove his bedroom

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila E. is from the village of Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 37 years old. Laila is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Laila owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling some food for snacks, candies, etc. in the local community. Laila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Laila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Laila is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Laila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells underwear and cosmetics by moving from one place to another in and around the Jukwa market. Ekua A. is married and has two beautiful children. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a commercial driver. Ekua uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save enough money to eventually buy her own shop and to further educate her growing children.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Vincent Nguma

texts.en:
Vincent is 35 years old and married to Dama; together they have six children. 

Vincent is a farmer in Kibaoni, Malindi, and he has been farming for the past three years. He normally gets a monthly profit of Kshs 5,700. 

Vincent was introduced to Kadet by an existing member of his current group. He has applied for a loan which he will use Kshs 5,000 for land preparation, Kshs 4,000 to buy seedlings for cassava, Kale (locally known as sukuma wiki) and tomatoes, Kshs 10,000 to buy fertilizers and Kshs 1,000 on miscellaneous expenses. With the extra earnings from this loan he will buy a plot and pay school fees for his children. 

Vincent is a  hardworking man who hopes to venture into the hotel business in the future.

loans.use: Land preparation and to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Juan Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Eduardo H. V. de  25 años de edad, es soltero sin hijos. Vive en el caserío San Matías.Tiene casa propia. Trabaja como obrero de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para contruir su terreno. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Eduardo is 25 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in the San Matías community in his own house, and works in the countryside for agro-industrial enterprises. Juan is an enterprising person who, thanks to considerable efforts, came to acquire his property. Juan needs the loan to develop this property. His dream is to be able to finish his house, with the goal of achieving a better quality of life. He is very grateful for the help that we are able to provide by means of this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IMPROVING HIS HOUSE

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio P. G., tiene la edad de 33 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y una hija de 7 años ellas son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José Antonio también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José Antonio P. G. is 33 years old and married. He lives with his wife and 7-year-old daughter, who are his highest priority in life. He is requesting a loan to use on his farm, specifically for the cultivation of coffee. The idea is to buy compost and fertilizer. He would like to provide proper maintenance for his coffee plantation in order to achieve better quality and obtain the highest returns possible at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the conditions they are offering him. José Antonio has been working for many years in agriculture. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and he also hopes to continue growing as a person and as an agricultural producer.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving his coffee crop

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Janeth E. dreams of her two children (10 and 12 years old) graduating from college. For her, good quality and a higher level of education is the only wealth she can leave to her children once her life is over. This could not be stolen away from them by anyone and would lead them towards a brighter future. Their diploma from college would give them employment that will provide them with a stable and sound compensation to support their needs. With this dream, Janeth and her husband work hard to earn money.

Janeth joined ASHI in 2008 and has received several loans since then. With those loans, she has been able to have a source of financial capital to support the growth of her husband’s fishing business as well as providing herself with the livelihood activity of fish selling. The proceeds they get out of their business go to the needs of her children and the entire family. Since then, their life has eventually changed a little. With the loan she is requesting now, Janeth is optimistic that someday she will finally bring her family out of poverty by making her business stable and profitable.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing gear to improve the quality of her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis A. is from the village of Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she sells ready-to-wear items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Lotis joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lotis is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her business locale and buy snacks.

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es:
Porfiria tiene 40 años; vive en casa propia, es casada, vive con su esposo, de 45 años de edad es vendedor ambulante  quien le ayuda para el ingreso familiar.
Tienen un hijo, de 14 años quien es estudiante esta en el octavo grado en la escuela.
Porfiria emprendió su  actividad   por iniciativa propia, viendo la necesidad de los pobladores de su   barrio que   no tenían  una despensa de donde comprar los  productos  básicos  para  la canasta familiar.

Actualmente su despensa es una de las más surtidas y cuenta con muchos clientes, precisa del crédito para la compra de un congelador.
texts.en:
Porfiria, 40, is married and lives in her own home with her husband, 45, who is an itinerant merchant and helps her meet household expenses. They have a 14-year-old son who is in 8th grade. Porfiria started her business on her own initiative when she saw the need her neighbors had for a neighborhood grocery store. They did not have a store where they could get the basic things they needed for their families. Currently, her store is one of the better stocked ones and she has a lot of regular customers. She needs the loan to buy a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Various products for her business: rice, corn, beans, flour, etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. is from the village of Cabisera 8. She is 51 years old and is married with three adult children. Paulina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bottles in her junk shop. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Paulina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Paulina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en: Nurgul T. is the leader of this group. She is forty-three and married. Her husband is builder. Nurgul sews toshoki (national patchwork quilts), blankets and pillows and sells them at the local market. She started four years ago with the purchase of a sewing machine for 5,000 soms. Now, she has been able to pay for her son’s marriage and has increased her income to 4,000 soms monthly. Nurgul is applying for a loan in order to purchase fabrics and materials used in the sewing process and, in this way, increase her turnover and her profits. In the future, she wants to purchase a car and renew her furniture. The other group members are: Cholponai A. is treasurer of the group. She is thirty-nine and married with two children, both of them going to school. Her husband is a builder. Cholponai buys furniture wholesales and resells it at a higher price. She started this business one year ago with an initial investment of 5,000 soms following a suggestion of her husband. With the profits from her business, she has been able to educate her son and increase her income to 1,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to increase her turnover. In the near future, she wishes to expand her business, make capital repairs to her house, see her son married, and purchase a car. Damira K. is thirty-five and married with three children: two of them go to school and one of them is at home. Her husband is a builder. Damira is a masseuse at the orphanage. Now, she wants to start cattle breeding. She doesn’t have sufficient funds and therefore, she is applying for a loan. In the near future, she plans to purchase a house and cattle for breeding. Saltanat B. is twenty-seven and married with three children. Her husband is a builder. Saltanat works in a factory that produces leather. One year ago, she decided to start cattle breeding with an initial investment of 5,000 soms. Now, she has been able to purchase furniture for her house with the help of her business and increase her income to 6,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle and to make repairs to her kitchen. In the near future, she want to purchase household appliances in order to improve her living conditions. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. is a villager in Kdol village in Takeo province. She was born in 1956. She is a tailor at her home where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sam Chory, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So, to improve her own business, Mrs. Chea S. is applying for a loan to buy more sewing machines. With the rest of the loan she plans to buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a student, while the other is helping the parents’ businesses. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
After working at a canning company, Simon F. started Elsa Auto Body Shop in 1967 and has developed a loyal clientele. However, the summer months were slow, and he now needs a loan for working capital to help him get through this rough time. 

This is Simon’s second loan. In 2008, when Hurricane Dolly swept through Texas, the roof of his auto body shop went with it. Simon used his first loan to buy a new, solid roof that could endure the hurricane force winds and rain that annually threaten south Texas. The new roof allowed him to continue working and he successfully paid back the loan.

When business slows down, Simon does not stop working. He does other landscaping jobs in order to make the loan payments. 

As an avid rock collector, Simon hopes that one day he will be able to pursue his passion for rocks more actively.

loans.use: To keep inventory stocked during the low season

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca N. lives in the Lubya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her sister's daughter). Rebecca is in the business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over four years and works seven days a week. Rebecca sells her products at the market for retail. Rebecca has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenge(s) for Rebecca include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for charcoal and plan for her future. Rebecca owns the home she lives in; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario pertenece al banco comunal “El Progreso” de la comuna de Puente Alto. Él tiene una vidriería en su casa desde hace  8 años, en donde fabrica espejos, ventanas, ventanales y shower-doors, entre otras cosas. Tiene como cliente frecuente una mueblería y muchos clientes particulares. 
Con este préstamo comprará materiales. Su sueño es cambiar su vehiculo por uno mejor, lo que para él es muy difícil ya que tiene una deuda en otra institución. 
Vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos menores de 14 y 8 años. La esposa de Mario trabaja con Fondo Esperanza y su negocio es la venta y arriendo de disfraces.
Para Mario, Fondo Esperanza ha sido un apoyo, principalmente por la facilidad con la cual entregan los préstamos y por las enseñanzas sobre cómo administrar su dinero. Además ha aprendido algunos términos de negocios, lo que le da mayor seguridad. 
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Mario belongs to the communal bank "El Progreso" in the community of Puente Alto.  For 8 years he has had a glass workshop in his house, where he constructs mirrors, windows and shower doors, among other things.  A furniture workshop is a frequent customer, along with many individuals. With this loan he will buy materials.  His dream is to get a better vehicle, which is very hard for him since he already has a debt with another institution. 

He lives with his spouse and his 2 children, ages 14 and 8 years.  Mario's wife works with Fondo Esperanza and her business is selling and renting costumes.  

For Mario, Fondo Esperanza has been a source of support, primarily for the ease with which they give loans and for what they have taught him about managing his money.  He has also learned some business terms which gives him greater security.  

Puente Alto is a community located north of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  It was founded as a small, rural town at the end of the 19th century, but given its demographic growth, it is currently one of the largest towns in Chile with more than 600,000 inhabitants.  It is the port of entry to one of the Andean foothill sectors of the metropolitan region, known as el Cajón del Maipo, which has hiking, horseback riding and rafting, among other activities, as well as lodging and restaurants.

loans.use: Materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 50 years old. To make a living, Maria raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maria also makes bukayo, a dessert made from young coconut. She travels around her neighborhood selling bukayo.

Maria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Maria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and bukayo ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and bukayo ingredients

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista N. lives in the Katanga neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 9 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother).

Teopista has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Teopista sells her products from home on a wholesale basis. Teopista has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenges for Teopista include the rainy season and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages in Luwero for charcoal. Teopista lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida Luz A. de 56 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en yuca, papas, repollo, tomate, quequisque, ayote, chayote, pipianes, naranjas…etc. 
Ella tiene tres hijos ya mayores y desea seguir trabajando y superándose.
texts.en:
Aída Luz A., 56, is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who has sold fruit and vegetables for the last 8 years. 

She will use the loan to invest in manioc, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, quequisque (taro root), ayote (pumpkin-like squash), chayote, pumpkins, oranges, etc.

She has three adult children and she wants to continue working and improving.

loans.use: For fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Felicie

texts.en:
Felicie is 35 years old and is married with three children. She has owned her small general store for about four years. The hours of her business are from 6 am until 8 pm every day.

Felicie has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her shop by adding enough foodstuffs like sugar, rice, different types of flour and other goods, which seem to be in high demand in her area. Felicie plans to start saving, as well as improve her family's situation, with any profits that she earns.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor Marcelo C. S. es trabajador de una empresa de Acueducto y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Gestor Colector desde hace 9 años.

Es casado con 3 personas a su cargo, 3 de estas están en edad escolar, el habita en la ciudad de Managua, Municipio de Managua.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con CEPRODEL, lo solicita para compra de vehículo para poder ir a dejar a los niños a la escuela y desplazarse a su trabajo, ya que este está lejano de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcelo C. S. has worked in a water and waste management company as collection manager for 9 years.

He is married and has three dependents, all of which are of school age. He lives in the city of Managua in the municipality of Managua. 

This is the first loan that he is taking with CEPRODEL. He is requesting it to buy a vehicle with which to drop off his kids at school and get to work, since it is far from his home.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Las Reinas 1 Group

texts.es:
Josefina pertenece al grupo Las Reinas 1, un grupo formado por 5 miembros, cada uno D. ellos días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, ya sean con negocios establecidos en sus propias viviendas y/o locales,  o D. manera ambulante. Se dedican mayormente a L. venta D. Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.  

Josefina posee una familia conformada por su 2 hijos y su madre. En una vivienda construida en una estructura simple D. madera. Sus desafíos más difíciles han sido educar a sus hijos y proveer sus necesidades, tambien enfrentarse a diversas enfermedades sin tener el dinero ni servicios suficientes para salir adelante, antes cualquier dificultad. 

El negocio D. Josefina es L. ventas D. Casabe, alimento producido con yuca y otros condimentos, lleva alrededor D. 2 años, después D. haber tomado su primer préstamo con Esperanza Internacional, y nos cuenta que inicio gracias a que algunas D. sus vecinas conocieron el programa D. microcredito y L. invitaron a participar. Josefina ha tomado ya 4 prestamos con Esperanza Internacional, y se siente muy agradecida por que con los préstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. paquetes D. casabe al por mayor, para luego ser vendido como minorista. 

Su historia representa a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona D. pocos recursos D. L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, específicamente ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad.
texts.en:
Josefina belongs to the 'Las Reinas 1' (The Queens 1) group which has five members.  Each member works in their own business in the city of Santo Domingo.  Some of these are established businesses located in the member's own home and / or business premises, whilst others are street vendors with no fixed sales location.  They mainly sell clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food products and other miscellaneous products.

Josefina's family consists of herself, her two children and her mother.  They live in a simple home which is built from wood.  Josefina's biggest challenges have been educating her children and providing for their needs.  She has also had to face a number of illnesses without having enough  money or services to get ahead when faced with such difficulties.

Josefina's business is selling 'casabe' (cassava bread) which is produced with cassava and other seasonings.  She has been in this business for around 2 years and started after taking her first loan with Esperanza Internacional.  She tells us that she started out in her business because some of her neighbors were familiar with the micro-credit program and invited her to take part.  Josefina has already had 4 loans from Esperanza Internacional and she feels very grateful because the loans have enabled her to make progress and invest in her business.  She will invest this new loan in buying packets of cassava bread wholesale which she will then sell as a retailer.

Josefina's story is representative of the other members of her group and Esperanza's clients in general, both the Haitians (who have mostly emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and the Dominicans who generally live in very poor communities.  This area, like many poor areas in the Dominican Republic, lacks reliable drinking water and electricity.  This group is located in a poor area of the city of Santo Domingo, in the north of the city.

loans.use: To buy several packets of 'casabe' (cassava bread)

loans.name: Oscar Juvenal

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 78 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y viven en la ciudad de Calca provincia de Cusco, Perú. Oscar fue policía y nos cuenta que se retiro de la Policía Nacional del Perú hace varios años atras, él recibe un pequeño sueldo que el estado le da por haber brindado servircio a su país y con este dinero lo utiliza para el gasto familiar pero lamentablemente no le alcanza, pero en esta oportunidad  el requiere el préstamo para comprar más víveres como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más.     

Oscar pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Oscar is 78 years old and has two children. They live in the city of Calca in the Province of Cusco, Peru. Oscar was a policeman and he tells us that he retired from the Peruvian National Police several years back. He receives a small salary from the state for having served his country and he uses this money for family expenses. However, it is not enough. Right now, he needs the loan to buy more groceries like rice, sugar, pasta, and many other items.

Oscar belongs to the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank within Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by the loan and promises to make his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy more groceries like rice, sugar, pasta, and many other items

loans.name: Hallen

texts.en: J. is currently in business selling ice cream. She is 30 years old, married to a businessman, with five children and three of them go to school.  J. borrowed a loan to stock more ice cream to sell. She hopes to  build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 42 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara. Actualmente, Mario vive en la ciudad de donde nació, él tiene su pareja pero todavía no tinen hijos, él es un hombre luchador, trabajador que a pesar de las adversidades sale adelante, él es cocinero y trabaja en la empresa de agencia de viajes “S.A.S TRAVEL”. Ya son 10 años que trabaja en esta empresa y le va muy bien. Mario en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para uso personal específicamente para el mantenimiento de su casa. 

Mario pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varias años.
texts.en:
Mario is 42 years old; he was born in the community of Yanahuara. He currently lives with his partner in the city where he was born, and they do not yet have any children. In spite of facing adversity in his life, Mario is hardworking and always comes out ahead. He is a cook, and he works in a travel agency called S.A.S. Travel. He has worked for this company for 10 years, and the work is going well.  Mario hopes to use micro credit as an opportunity to do some maintenance on his home.

Mario belongs to the "Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen" community bank, part of the Arariwa Association; he has been working with his co-members at the community bank for several years.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his home.

loans.name: Kalbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalbubu E., 60, is the leader of this group. She resides in Uzgen and several years ago became a widow, left with three children. Her children are in their twenties, but the great tragedy for the whole family is the oldest daughter’s physical disability. She is 29, but still needs constant care and the attention of doctors. 

Kalbubu’s younger kids assist her financially. Her daughter is in Russia and the son runs a business in farming. For thirty-eight years now, Kalbubu has designed national clothing, souvenirs and national hats called “tumak”. The business was run successfully for more than three decades thanks to growing interest of local and foreign customers. 

Growing older Kalbubu keeps feeling less good and was forced to quit working so hard and to devote some time to herself. A few years ago she was lucky to have good medical treatment in the neighboring country of Turkmenistan. Unfortunately, it’s not a cheap procedure, so in order to get another medical treatment she is requesting a loan from Kiva. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 47 years old and has two children. The oldest child is 23 years old.

Judith is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 30 years. She sells her harvest at the market. Judith also manages a small eatery and videoke shop. Judith works hard to improve her businesses and to be able to sustain her family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Sarantuya is 55 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They have three children who are all grown up and live separately with their families. Mrs.Sarantuya works in Children’s Hospital as a cleaner and her husband runs a waste recycling business.
