Her husband Dagvadorj collects different recyclable materials and gives them to waste recycling factories for a small amount of money. The couple bought a house in 1988. The house is really run down and needs a proper refurbishment now. The loan Mrs.Sarantuya is asking for will be used to buy the necessary building materials such as cement, plaster, wood planks, paint and other materials to renovate the old house.

loans.use: to buy cement, plaster, wood planks, paint and other materials to refurbish her old house

loans.name: Nelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelis, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 15 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, en ocasiones contrata a mozos para que le ayuden a preparar el terreno, su horario es de 6:00am a 3:00pm, o dependiendo de la necesidad que tengan.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y tratamiento para plagas, estos insumos agrícolas no pueden faltar para realizar el cultivo, por lo que este préstamo será una gran ayuda para contar con los materiales necesarios.
Su objetivo es trabajar por su hijo, ayudándolo para que estudie y se supere.
texts.en:
Nelis lives with her husband and 15 year old son.  She and her husband are farmers, raising corn and beans.  Sometimes they hire help to prepare the land.  Their schedule is from 6am to 3pm, or as needed.  

Nelis is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.  These agricultural products are essential for a successful crop, so the loan will be a great help for them to have the materials they need.  

Her goal is to work to help her son be able to study and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticide.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Kyaterekera Development Group

texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old and married. She and her husband do not yet have children. Betty earns an income from two businesses – she sells pigs and coffee. She operates both businesses in Mukono. Betty also has a small poultry business that she oversees. Her businesses can be highly profitable provided one invests in them. Betty is trying her best to succeed in her business ventures. Over the last nine years, she has been investing time and money in her businesses and the impact has been showing in her increasing number of clients. Betty has built a reputation of nothing but hard work. She says she was inspired by her husband to get established and she makes a monthly profit of 300,000 UGX. 

With her Kiva loan, Betty will purchase more pigs and bags of coffee to sell.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and coffee to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food stall business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her food stall business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a single mother and has a 2-year-old daughter. She sells stones to private developers and construction workers and has been do this for the last 12 months. She also runs a salon business. Norah intends to use her loan to purchase more stock for her salon. 

Norah hopes to venture into building and construction of rental units. She describes herself as humble.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her salon.

loans.name: Conquistadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONQUISTADORAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Irene. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de mantas, venta de estuco, venta de bayetas y mantas, elaboración de mantas y chompas, venta de polleras faldas y mantillas, atención de pensión, tintorería y limpieza, fabricación de ladrillos

La señora Irene,  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de las socias. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de polleras y mantas que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás, cuando aprendió a tejer macramé en una capacitación. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de telas, y lana) que comprará de la 16 de julio y lo venderá en el departamento de Oruro. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre  y tiene tres hijos.  

En la fotografia nos acompaña la prima de una de las socias, ella se encuentra en la esquina "escondida"
texts.en:
The "Conquistadoras" Community Bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Senkata. It is made up of ten members and is governed by a board of directors headed by Mrs. Irene. The members' businesses are varied and include: making blankets; selling plaster; selling cloths and blankets; making blankets and jackets; selling skirts, dresses and baby clothing; a guesthouse; dry cleaning and cleaning; and brick-making.

Mrs. Irene says that this is her first cycle working with Pro Mujer, and she joined at the invitation of the members. She currently has a business making skirts and blankets, which she has done for three years after learning to weave macrame in a workshop.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her working capital, buying fabrics ans wool, which she will buy from the 16th of July area and sell in the department of Oruro. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family where possible. She lives with her partner and has three children.

The cousin of one of the members is also in the photo. She is "hiding" in the corner.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and wool

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Mrs. Lam is a seller in one market near her house. From one day to one day, Mrs. Lam can earn about $3 per day. Her husband always carves statues and earns perhaps $3 per day also. To improve the business, Mrs. Lam would like to borrow some funds to support her family better than before. She would like to borrow about $1100 to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Bonebe Ann

texts.en:
Bonebe Ann is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Bonebe Ann has a retail shop that sells fruits like watermelons. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy watermelons to sell.

Bonebe Ann is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Bonebe Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy watermelons to sell

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: 38 year old Mom is a housewife. Her husband sells pigs, and earns an income of $10 per day. She has four children; one is studying and the other three are working in the factory, with a combined income of $15. Every month, Mom has to spend $75 on food, $4 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her husband to transport baby pigs to sell in the village and nearby. In the future, she wants to buy a small car for her husband, so that he can sell more pigs and earn more money. She wants to send her last child to university so that he can get a good job in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to transport baby pigs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 38 years old, married, and has been blessed with three children. Her husband is a welder in the Philippines while Eden makes herself busy by selling balut (eggs with embryos sold boiled as a snack) to her customers in their village. She learned how to sell balut to her neighbors and she is glad that she has been in her business for four years.
Eden is applying for a loan of P10,000 to purchase eggs for making balut. This loan will help her in buying a sufficient volume of eggs to purchase at the wholesale price. Eden believes that she will earn a higher income after taking advantage of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase eggs for making balut.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 49-year-old man who is married to Magdalena, a 38-year-old lady. They have been blessed with six children: Yulinda, 18, who only graduated from Junior High School, helps her mother to weave; Imanuel, 17, is studying in the first grade of Senior High School; Brudel, 12, Sifrido, 11, and Aquarius, 8, are still in Primary School; and Novita, is just 6.

Julius has a farm that is located 3 km away from his residence. Currently, Julius cultivates “Kangkung” (water spinach) and corn. Actually, Julius also cultivated beans and string beans but they have been harvested and sold at the market. Julius was thinking of cultivating more corn, beans and ‘kangkung’ but he only has a small plot of land to farm. He believes that the more he can cultivate, the more he can harvest to be sold in the market. Thus, he can generate more income for his family.

Julius was offered a plot of land to hire, but he does not have money to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. He is expecting that TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: To rent a plot of land

loans.name: Ivona

texts.en: Ivona is a fifty-six-year-old single mother of one child, living in her own permanent house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the firewood business for ten years and with the income earned she has been able to provide the basics to her little family. Her hardship is high transport charges and her vision is to get tenders for supplying schools and prisons with firewood plus educating her child. Ivona wants to buy firewood for resale.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is 42 years old.  She is married and has four children aged between 11 and 20 years old. Consolee owns a business selling second-hand clothing. This is her first successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 5 pm every day except on Saturday. 

Consolee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her clothes business. With this profit, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years of age, married and mother to four children.  Her husband is a framer and she is engaged to the livestock business.  Lorna has been in business for almost 10 years.  She is thankful because by raising piglets, she is able to support her family's needs. 

Lorna would like to see her children attain a high level of education, but her income is not sufficient, due to household expenses.  She believes that she could make her goal come true by using her profits wisely.  

Lorna is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy feed to help raise her piglets.  She hopes that through her requested loan she could obtain her goal in life.

loans.use: to buy feed to help raise her piglets.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 36 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the Philippines. Rosalina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and  beverages, which she has had for five years. 

Rosalina is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages. Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura, una mujer muy alegre, tiene 31 años, convive con Wilmer en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos y uno que esta por venir, a quien le brinda mucho amor. Maura, por el momento no puede trabajar ya que su estado es delicado, pero con la ayuda de su pareja puede salir adelante, ya que él se dedica en el cultivo de cacao y café. Juntos trabajan hace 01 año en sus tierras y lo hacen con mucho esfuerzo; lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su familia. Sus planes a futuro es poder incrementar más plantas de cacao y café, ya que la venta de estos productos son beneficiosos. Este será su préstamo número 03 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así podrá seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Por tanto agradece a las personas de su banco comunal,  ya que con ellos comparten muchas experiencias. Con el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar más plantas de caco y café; así incrementará su producción.
texts.en: Maura, 31, and her partner, Wilmer, have 2 children and are expecting another child soon.  Because she's pregnant, Maura can't work just now, but she can depend on support from her partner.  They have a farm where they grow cacao and coffee.  They've worked the farm for a year.  It's hard work but they plow ahead because it's their means of supporting their family.  Now they want to plant more cacao and coffee because the greater their income, the greater their chance of getting ahead.  This is Maura's third MFP loan.  She likes this kind of borrowing because it's her means of continuing the business.  She says, too, that she is grateful to the other members of her community bank because they share their experiences with her.  Maura will use this loan to buy cacao and coffee plants so that she can increase her production.

loans.use: to buy coffee and cacao plants for farming business.

loans.name: Wechinia Group

texts.en:
Jane is the facilitator of the Wechinia group. Jane and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Jane takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on ½ acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Jane will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing and other business as savings for future use. In 2012, the members of Wechinia group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll is 47 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Cheryll has been buying and selling livestock for 12 years and also earns additional income from a networking business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El socio continua prestando servicio de tranporte en el rubro de turismo; pero adicionalmente a este trabjao el socio apoya a su conyugue con el negocio de ella de comprar y vender pollos y gallinas. el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de pollos y de gallinas al por mayor para que su esposa las venda a sus clientas, el socio también invertira parte del credito en el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular. El socio desea a futuro cercano que el negocio de sus esposa crezca para que tengan mayores ganacias.
texts.en: The member continues offering transportation service in the area of tourism.  In addition to this work he helps his spouse with her business buying and selling chickens and hens.  Now he wants to invest the loan in buying chickens and hens wholesale for his wife to sell to her customers.  He also wants to invest part of the loan to maintain his vehicle.  He hopes that in the near future his wife's business will grow so they have more profit.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle with part of the loan.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a mother of two children aged 15 and 11 and has been in farming for four years with her produce of vegetables and coffee sold to the local market. She also runs a retail  shop business dealing in household goods.

Pauline has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow for a venture into the dairy farming business.She says the acquisition of pure breed cows will help her have good production and better income from farming and improve her family's living standards.

Pauline laments of high cost of feeds in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is 31 years old a mother of 3 children. she lives in Al Karak, Jordan.
Eman is looking to have a loan of 500JDs thus she can expand her project in clothing sales.
Eman is a conservative woman she is unwilling to upload her photo on internet. the photo is for her husband.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lamb and beef.

loans.name: Sai Baba Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Gomati, standing right in the photo is a hardworking woman living in the state of Odisha. Her daily routine involves attending to the domestic chores, taking care of the needs of her husband and her child and running a profitable tea-selling business. Her monthly income of 4,000 INR has provided a breather to the family. With her husband being the main breadwinner of the family, the revenues from Gomati’s tea-selling business primarily helps in the educational costs of her children.

Gomati has formed a self help group called ‘Sai Baba Shg-C’ with Sitabati in the Koraput district. Gomati, along with her group member is seeking a loan of 36,000 INR for their business expansion. She will use her portion to buy furniture and raw materil in bulk for her tea stall.

loans.use: to buy furniture and raw materil in bulk for her tea stall

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en: Etris is a 21 year old woman. She has a small business of selling cakes at a school. She sells cakes such as fried banana, fried tempe (made from fermented soybean) and fried tofu. In order to increase the sales, Etris joined a group and requested a loan from TLM amounting of IDR 1,750,000 to pay for more snacks and beverages as requested by the students. Alike with Etris, the other member would spend the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: pay for more snacks and beverages as requested by the students

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Revelations Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Jane is married with six children. She joined the group in 2003. She is an active member of the group and the local self help group.

Jane started her business of selling cereals in 2003. She was given her first loan of USD.300 by WEEC and had trained in hair dressing. Therefore, she started her own salon in Thika town. The business has grown and handles mores than 10 people a day.

loans.use: Given a loan of USD.300, Jane will be able to upgrade her salon and increase stock of her shop.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
A married mother of six children, Ms. Akossiwa A. is an energetic and courageous woman. Her husband, a carpenter by trade, has difficulty contributing to the family's income. In addition to her children, Ms. A. also takes care of two girls who are her apprentices. She must divide her time between her family and her mini restaurant where she sells “foufou” (mashed yams) with various sauces, but her years of experience help her to manage the situation. Despite her limited education, she is able to manage her business well.

Her mini restaurant has become a very popular place for everyone in her town, but she is no longer able to meet such high demand. She is requesting a loan of $800 to remodel her restaurant and to buy a supply of yams and other items. This will allow her to become financially independent and to meet her family's basic needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de six (6) enfants, Madame A. Akossiwa est une femme dynamique et courageuse. Son mari, menuisier de profession contribue difficilement aux charges du ménage. En plus de ses enfants, Madame A. a en charge deux (2) filles en apprentissage. Partagée entre son mini restaurant où elle vend du foufou (ignames pilées) avec de diverses sauces et sa famille, elle possède une expérience qui lui permet de mieux contrôler la situation. Malgré son niveau d’études très bas, elle cerne correctement la gestion de ses activités.

Son mini restaurant est devenu un lieu très fréquenté par tous les habitants de sa localité, ce qui fait qu’elle n’arrive plus à être à la hauteur de la demande. Elle sollicite un soutien financier de $800 pour le réaménagement de son restaurant, s’approvisionner en ignames et autres. Ceci lui permettra d’acquérir une autonomie financière et subvenir aux besoins les plus élémentaires de la famille.

loans.use: To remodel her restaurant and buy a supply of yams

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort M. has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She cooks palm oil and kenkey (a local meal) that she sells. She is seeking a loan of US$800.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es:
Ana Delia is married with two small kids, ages 3 and 9. Her husband is a construction worker. After the birth of their first son, Ana Delia decided to help her husband with family expenses, since his salary was insufficient to provide for them all. She started a business buying and selling used clothes, and in little time began building customers. Currently she sells at open markets, rotating to different parts of the city throughout the week.

Ana Delia is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to buy more clothing, since the summer is one of the busiest times of the year for her business. She plans to repay the loan within three months and is counting on your support to keep her business going and grow it little by little until she is able to have a fixed store and increase her sales. Ana Delia and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ana Delia es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, uno de 3 años y el otro de 9 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil, desde que tuvo su primer hijo decidió ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ya que el salario que el gana no era suficiente, por ello, ella empezó con el negocio de la compra y venta de ropa de segunda mano, se hizo de clientes en el poco tiempo y desde entonces a continuado con este trabajo, actualmente Ana Delia vende en mercados rodantes su mercancía ya que como estos mercados no son fijos ella puede abarcar distintas zonas de la ciudad en una semana y así va rotando todos los meses.

Ana Delia está solicitando de un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para la compra de mercadería, ya que esta segura que va a vender mucho en esta época del año y en el verano, ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y espera contar con su apoyo para continuar con su negocio y crecer poco a poco hasta poder establecerse en un lugar fijo e incrementar sus ventas, ella y su familia te agradecen por tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Yaquelin

texts.en:
Yaquelin lives with her husband, who works as a chauffer, and their one year old son in a small home they own in the Llojeta area of La Paz . She works as a maid at a home in La Paz and also sells beauty products.

She is requesting this loan to clear the lot where her small, one room home sits. Once the lot is cleared, she and her husband plan to begin adding one or two additional rooms to allow the family to live in better and more sanitary conditions.

She is a new borrower and an analysis of her family's finances has determined that they have sufficient income to fulfill the loan payment requirements as well as meet the family's basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Yaquelin vive en casa propia en la Av. Máx. Fernández Nº 2646 de la zona de Llojeta central de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un hijo pequeño de 1 año y vive con su esposo que es chofer. Yaquelin es empleada domestica en una casa ubicada en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, y también comercializa productos de belleza.

El crédito que solicita es para limpiar su terreno el cual tiene una pequeña construcción de una planta; una vez que el terreno este limpio, entonces Yaquelin y su esposo tienen planeado iniciar la construcción de una o mas habitaciones que les permitan vivir en forma mas decente y en un ambiente de mayor sanidad.

Es cliente nuevo y el flujo de fondos analizado muestra ingresos suficientes como para poder acceder a un crédito y cumplir tanto con los pagos de dicho préstamo como con las necesidades de la familia.

loans.use: To clear lot for construction

loans.name: Zulfughar

texts.ru:
Zulfughar lives with his parents in Saatli, Azerbaijan. Two years ago, after finishing college, he could not find a job because of the high unemployment rate. In order to support his elderly parents, he rented a café in Saatli and started his business.

The work was going well and he even hired an employee. Business started increasing and Zulfughar started thinking about replacing some equipment. He purchased tables and chairs and now plans on purchasing a dishwashing machine. The dishwasher costs around $500 and Zulfughar turned to Normicro, a KIVA partner, with a loan request.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мр. Зулфугар живет в месте со своими родителями в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенной в Закавказье. Два года назад, после окончания института, он не мог найти себе работу из-за высокого уровня безработицы и, чтобы содержать своих престарелых родителей, он арендовал кафе в городе Саатлы и начал своё дело. Работа пошла неплохо, и даже он нанял работника. Бизнес начал подниматься и Зулфугар начал подумывать о замене недоторого оборудования. Он уже закупил столы и стулья и теперь планирует о покупке посудомоечной машины. Стоит она около 500 долларов и поэтому Зулфугар обратился к микрокредитной организации "Нормикро" - партнеру КИВА - с просьбой о предоставлении ему кредита.

loans.use: To purchase a dishwasher

loans.name: Abdul Jalil

texts.en: Abdul Jalil lives in District 8 of Kabul Afghanistan, is married, and lives there with his extended family. Abdul has a gas shop and is very hard worker with a lot of experience in his work, so he wants to expand his business. He is requesting an individual loan to expand his stock and increase his monthly income to help his family; this makes him happy to help all of his family.

loans.use: To expand the stock in his shop

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Señora Maritza is a member of the Brigada Ramirez Community Bank. She is dedicated to the business of preparing and selling food from the different regions of her country. In that way she can satisfy the needs of her big clientele. Her business is located at the Central Market in the Lamas location (entering by Jr. Junin 2nd square), Lamas province, San Martin department. She has been in this business for 10 years.

With the 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy some kitchen equipment like: one pot, a dozen dishes, and a dozen glasses. She will also buy more wolesale groceries (a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, half box of milk and a 12kg noodle packet) and small farm hens. This provisions will allow her to reduce her expenses.

Maritza considers herself a happy and charismatic person with a lot of patience to serve her clients. Her good cooking and flavoring skills are the best assets of her business. She dreams with the possibility of having a bigger place so she can serve more people

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maritza es socia del banco comunal Brigada Ramírez, se dedica a la venta de comida de diferentes regiones del país para poder satisfacer a su amplia clientela, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Central de la localidad de Lamas (ingresando por el Jr. Junín 2da. Cdra), provincia de Lamas, departamento de San Martín, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará algunos artículos de cocina para renovarla, por ejemplo una olla, una docena de platos y una docena de vasos de vidrios, además comprará víveres en cantidad (un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, media caja de leche y un paquete de fideos de 12 kg) y gallinas de chacra, lo cual le permitirá reducir sus gastos. Maritza se considera una persona alegre, carismática y con mucha paciencia para atender a sus clientes y utiliza su buena sazón como la mejor carta de presentación del negocio. Sueña con poder tener un local más grande para poder atender a más personas.

loans.use: Buying kitchen equipment (pots, plates, glasses, etc).and buying groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc) and hens.

loans.name: Marta Rosa

texts.en:
Marta R. is a forty our year old woman who is married to Jose R., an electrician. They have three sons, one who is in high school and the others who attend the nearby university. Marta works at their convenience store while her husband travels throughout the city installing electrical appliances.

Marta began this business because she realized that two incomes are necessary in their household in order to pay for their sons’ education. Their sons have the goal of becoming professionals someday and take after their parents as very hard workers. When she opened the convenience store she had a great turnout and in little time had regular clientele.

A successful business that is looking to grow, Marta is asking for a loan to help pay for some of the expenses to expand her business merchandise to include, sugar, flour, rice and pasta.

loans.use: To buy pasta, rice, flour, sugar, and refreshments.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma Flietas not only runs a hair styling salon, she also has students who study the art of hair styling with her. They later go on to open their own salons. She is a single mother and lives in the city of Ciudad del Este. One of her daughters is also a hair stylist and works with her.

Since she was a young girl, Irma has been styling hair because it is her passion. She is asking for a loan of $650 today to buy materials to keep her salon and school running. She will use the loan to buy shampoos, gels, scissors, and other styling implements.

loans.use: To buy products for her hair salon including hair dye, shampoo, and other hair styling supplies

loans.name: José Alcides

texts.es:
José Alcides Salinas is a very responsible man. Since his youth, he has raised livestock, specifically pigs on his farm. He is portrayed as a family man who is very attentive to his children. Since he has been through difficult financial situations, he has fought to provide the education his two young children (one son and one daughter) deserve.

Currently, he lacks the resources to buy more pigs. For this reason, he has sought the support of Ceprodel - to obtain a loan that would allow him to purchase pigs to raise and sell pork in the region where he lives. It is imperative to note that he has paid off three loans with Ceprodel in due time and according to stipulated conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

José Alcides Salinas es un caballero muy responsable que desde su juventud se ha dedicado a la crianza de Ganado específicamente en la crianza de credos en su casa de habitación. Se caracteriza por ser un padre de familia muy esforzado y atento con sus hijos ya que a pesar de la difícil situación económica que han atravesado ha logrado brindarle a sus dos pequeños hijos (un niño y una niña) los estudios que ellos se merecen.

Una gran necesidad que actualmente el señor Alcides atraviesa es la escasez de recursos económicos para adquirir el ganado es por eso que ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan adquirir los cerdos para alimentarlos y vender su carne en su localidad de habitación. Es necesario destacar que actualmente posee tres créditos con ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Bupe

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is Bupe M.. She is married and has four children. She also has two dependents, her sister's children, who live with her.

In 2006, Bupe established her soft drink business. Bupe has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase beer and sodas in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja is a very hard working woman who dedicates a large part of her time to embroidering in her humble home in order to contribute to the economic growth of her home. She also farms with the help of her children. Her biggest wish is to increase the quantity of her embroidered goods as this activity provides her with substantial income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Maruja, es una mujer muy trabajadora que dedica gran parte de su tiempo al bordado de fustanes en su humilde domicilio, para contribuir con el desarrollo de su hogar.También se dedica a la agricultura con ayuda de sus hijos, y su más grande deseo es incrementar la cantidad de sus bordados ya que a través de esta actividad puedo obtener ingresos económicos sustanciales.

loans.use: Infusion of  capital to acquire a greater amount of prime material.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Halima Z.. She is married and has three children aged 4, 7, and 11.Halima owns a beauty salon business. Halima requires a loan in order to expand her range of haircare products and wigs. She thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! Halima's salon is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To buy more haircare products and hair extensions to expand the range of products in her beauty salon

loans.name: Janina

texts.es:
Janina is 25 years old and has two children who are the job of her life. She is the owner of a car driven by her husband, Eliseo, which is used urban passenger transportation. Both want to give their children what they need by providing for their education, food and healthcare. Janina wants to improve the means of her employment, which is why she needs to buy parts and get her motor-car fixed as it is the only form of sustenance that she has. Janina’s plan is to save enough to be able to open a small grocery shop in her home in the future. As her house is located in a highly transited place it will ensure a better life for her family. She needs capital to be able to achieve her objective which is why she is asking for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Janina tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, los mismos que son la razón de su vida, ella es propietaria de un motocarro que es manejado por su pareja, Eliseo, en el transporte urbano de pasajeros. Ambos desean brindar a sus niños lo necesario, velar por su educación, alimentación y salud. Janina quiere mejorar su herramienta de trabajo, para ello requiere comprar repuestos y mandarlo a arreglar, ya que su motocarro es el único sustento que tienen. En lo planes de Janina está el ahorra lo suficiente para más adelante abrir una bodega para la venta de abarrotes, ya que su casa se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitable y así asegurar una mejor vida para su familia.Ella requiere de capital para lograr su objetivo. Por lo que solicita su apoyo.

loans.use: To buy parts in order to repair their motor-car with which they provide transportation for passengers.

loans.name: Heanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heanh K. is the leader of a small group in Orchar Commune, Battambang Province. She purchases fish from fishermen and stock places, and then sells them in the town market. She has been selling since 1985, and her husband sells by transporting to customers' homes. Heanh has seven children. One is a carver and one works as a car repairer, and their income helps to support the family's expenses and loan repayment.

To grow her business, Heanh need to increase the stock of fish she has to sell, but she faces the obstacle of lacking capital, so she decided to request a loan to purchase fish to stock and sell.

Her group members include Mr. Tha C., who is requesting a loan to add to his money in order to purchase car tools for a car repair business; and Mrs. Phoeurn Y., who is a requesting a loan to purchase fish to stock her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Mr. Ban M. lives in Smaonh village in Kampong Cham province, where he is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. He owns a large field which he cannot cultivate with his wife. Thus, Mr. Ban M. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in the field. Mr. Ban M. is 42 years old and the father of seven children, three of whom are employed in different jobs while the remaining four are attending school. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in the field to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, madame Y.  Yohana est mariée et a 05 personnes à charge. Etant donné que les charges de son ménage augmente au jour le jour, ses maigres revenus de vente de  produits de beauté et divers ne lui permettent plus de subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de ses enfants.

C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit  pour augmenter son pouvoir d'achat afin de maximiser son bénéfice et d’assurer une meilleure condition de vie aux membres de son ménage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yohana Y., age 43, is married and has five persons to support. Since the daily expenses of her household gets higher day by day, the meager revenue she makes from selling beauty products and various items, do not enable her anymore to provide for the basic needs of her children. This is why she's seeking a loan to increase her purchasing power, in order to maximize her profits and to insure better living conditions to the members of her household.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and various other items

loans.name: Parigul

texts.en:
Parigul A. is 53 years old. She is a widow and she has two children. 

Her business is raising cattle. Each day she herds and allows the tame cows to graze on beautiful pasture land. She has been dedicated to this business for the last ten years. 

Parigul also works as a member of a cleaning staff. 

She works very hard at both jobs so she can offer her dearest children an adequate education. She wishes to give each of them the opportunity of higher education. 

Parigul now wishes to buy calves that she can breed. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni, which will be repaid in a period of 12 months. 

Let us help this industrious mother make her dreams come true; help her see her her beloved children as professionals with a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Pashakul

texts.en:
Pashakul A. is an older man with lots of experience. He is married with 4 children. He is uneducated and he works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 7 years, working with his family during this time. He is a professional farmer and, from back when he started his business, he has always wanted to improve his business.

In the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask IMON to help with their problems. Therefore, today Pashakul is applying to Kiva hoping for your help. He is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) for the term of 8 months to buy some seed and fertilizer for his land. He is grateful for this loan process.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout S., 25, lives in Kompong Tom Province. She raises pigs near her house as well as being a rice trader, purchasing rice to store and re-sell to make a profit. She can earn an average of US$ 3 per day and has been running her businesses since 2007.

Hout S. is married and is a good mother to her young daughter while her husband is a carving-wood seller. To grow her business and earn additional revenue, S. needs to borrow money to purchase rice to store and then sell for a profit. The loan will help her increase her income to cover a little more of the family's living expenses. (She and her lovely child are pictured.)

loans.use: to purchase rice to store and re-sell

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassina O. a 35 ans, marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Wayerma II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur O. a mené plusieurs activités sans succès. Il  opta finalement de s’initier et s’installer dans le domaine du commerce dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers (Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucre, savon, etc) il y a maintenant trois (03) ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité par sa clienèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant six (06) mois avec qui  il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Monsieur O. vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédits à une clientèle composée des voisins.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 3 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 2 carton du thé, 1 sac du sucre, 5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquet de Chewing Gum, 30 paquets d’allumettes, 5 cartons de savon, etc. Il sapprovisionne auprès des commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Lassina O. is 35 years old, married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in Wayerma II, the main city in Sikasso (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mail).Mr. O. has attempted several business, without success. He finally established himself, three years ago, in commerce, by setting up a shop, in front of his house, where he buys and sells a variety of articles, namely cigarettes, candies, matches, chewing gum, powered milk, tea, soap, etc. He is widely sought out by his clients for the quality of his products. To meet the needs of his ever increasing clientele, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwasa microbank six months ago, and he is now requesting his first individual loan. Mr. O. sells his merchandise for cash or credit to a clientele made up mostly of neighbors. With his first loan he would like to buy 3 cases of a variety of cigarettes, 2 cartons of tea, 1sack of sugar, 5 packages of candies, 10 packages of chewing gum, 30 packages of matches, 5 cartons of soap, etc. He buys from wholesalers in the neighborhood before selling at retail. With this loan, he expects to earn a profit of 70,000 FCFA which he will use mainly to increase his business operating funds, contribute to family expenses and make loan payments.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of articles for resale ( cigarettes, candies, matches, chewing gum, powered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc )

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Badenya sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et  5 enfants. Une seule femme vit dans une  famille polygame et les autres dans des familles nucléaires au quartier Sanoubougou I de la ville de Sikasso, une préfecture de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
 Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat – vente de la friperie, des tissus, de fruits et  la restauration.
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur premier prêt (prêt solidaire)
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, une balle de friperie, 2 rouleaux de tissus, des oranges et quelques condiments pour la restauration.
 Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso, dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants, à Bamako et à Bobo Dioulasso  au BURKINA FASO.
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Sikasso et dans les foires hebdomadaires de la localité en gros et en détail; et souvent à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 14.170 FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie  investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six women in the Badenya group are all married and average 39 years of age and 5 children. One woman lives in a polygamous family, while the others live in nuclear families in the Sanoubougou I neighborhood in Sikasso, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali.

They run diverse businesses, among others : buying and reselling second-hand clothing, fabrics or fruits, and food serving. To meet customer demand, they work with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, a Kiva's partner. They are seeking their first group loan (solidarity loan). With this loan, they intend to buy one bale of second-hand clothing, two rolls of fabric, oranges, and condiments for food preparation.

They get their supplies at the Sikasso market, at the weekly fairs held in the surrounding villages, in Bamako, and in Bobo Dioulasso in Burkina Faso. The goods are sold, retail and wholesale, at the Sikasso market and at the weekly fair in Sikasso. They sell for cash or on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They intend to turn a monthly profit of XOF 14'170 (ca US$ 30) each, to be used partly for the family expenses, and partly to invest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell second-hand clothing, fabrics, fruits and condiments

loans.name: Isheitu

texts.en:
Isheitu S. started her trading business fifteen years ago at Bekwai, a suburb of Obuasi where she lives. Isheitu prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality smoked fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She also sells fresh vegetables like carrots, green peppers, etc. in the community market. She is now 45 years old and married with five children, who are currently in school. Her husband is a security man for a cocoa company in Kumasi. She has been struggling with a lack of funds to develop her business. 

She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of assorted fishes and vegetables to increase sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance. She also hope to use the GHS700 loan to restock her inventory. Isheitu belongs to a village bank called Jordan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables like pepper, tomatoes, smoked fish, etc.

loans.name: Mavlon

texts.ru: Хасанов Мавлон  кредитуется   с начало открытия Микроинвест. Он и его жена торговали небольшим ассортиментом. Теперь они торгуют большим ассортиментом, что позволило  Мавлону  расширить свой бизнес и магазин.  Его жена ездит за товаром со своими подругами.  Они ездят на такси, а товар отправляют общим грузом в контейнере, где встречает  Мавлон.  После наступления кризиса, он вынужден снизить цену на некоторый вид товара.  Но весной очень хороший спрос на мужскую одежду. Поэтому у Мавлона сейчас сезон продаж мужской одежды.
texts.en:
Mavlon H. has been a client since MicroInvest opened its doors. He and his wife sold a limited range of good, but now they trade in a board assortment that has permitted Mavlon to expand his business and store. His wife and her friends keep the store stocked. They go by taxi and send back a container of items for Mavlon to meet. At the onset of the financial crisis, he was forced to reduce the price of some goods, but in the spring the demand for men's clothing is high so now is the time to sell menswear.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. is 49 years old and a resident of Zone 10, Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. She is married and blessed with three children. Two of her children are employed and the youngest is in college. Her husband works as painter in their arts and sign business, which they named AD Ventures Arts and Sign.

Due to financial needs, Marilou is applying for a loan of Php 7000 from KIVA partner HSPFI. She will use the loan to purchase additional materials for the business. It will help them generate more income and meet the demands and needs of their customers. If granted, this will be Marilou's second loan. She has always dreamed of putting up another branch in their hometown.

loans.use: To purhcase materials for her arts and sign business.

location.town: Zone 10, Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Nor

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: MAMADOU S. EST NE LE 13 MAI 1988 A THIES .IL EST CELIBATAIRE ET HABITE AU QUARTIER MEDINA FALL DE THIES.IL GERE UNE CANTINE AU MARCHE CENTRAL ET Y VEND DES ACCESSOIRES DE PORTABLES.AVEC CE PRET ,il veut renforcer sa boutique en s'approvisionnant à dakar .
texts.en:
Mamadou S. was born on May 13, 1988 in THIES. He is unmarried and lives in the Medina Fall district of THIES. He runs a stall at the central market. There, he sells mobile phone accessories. With this loan, he wants to bolster his shop by acquiring supplies in Dakar.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy accesspores for cell phones

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.en:
Maria Eloisa L. is from the village of Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is thirty-three years old and married with one school-age child. To make a living, Maria Eloisa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Maria Eloisa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria Eloisa joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maria Eloisa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Maria Eloisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support her family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Рустам  Курбонкулов 1969 года рождения, он женат у него 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Он имеет магазин в кишлаке недалеко от своего дома. В магазине он торгует продуктами и хозяйственными товарами.Также он занимается бизнесом животноводства. для этого он нанял чабана содержания скота. У него 6 коров и 8 овец.  Бизнес начинал 2 года назад с покупки одной 2 овец. Теперь его  отара по не многу растет и он доволен бизнесом.
texts.en:
Born in 1969, Rustam K. is married and has 3 children. He has a secondary education. Rustam owns a store in a village not far from his house. He sells food products and household goods there. Rustam is also involved in the animal husbandry business. He hired a shepherd to take care of his livestock. Rustam owns 6 cows and 8 sheep. He started his business 2 years ago with a purchase of only one sheep. His herd has since gradually grown, and he is pleased with his business.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and a goat

loans.name: Faaee

texts.en:
Faaee S., 57, is married with eight children.  She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public two days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).  

SPBD loans are Faaee’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of her loan will be used only on the business.

loans.use: Purchase weed killer, chemicals, knives, a sharpener and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en:
Noraida T. is a 62-year old transport operator managing a fleet of three motorized tricycles plying the route of Baseco-Delpan-Divisoria in Port Area, Manila.  She lives with her husband Mama, 65 and their 3 adult children.  They belong to the Islam faith.

She started with her business in 2005 with just one motorized tricycle.  The demand for transportation in their community picked up with the establishment of Habitat for Humanity Community Housing. In the same year she purchased her first motorized tricycle and then had to purchase a second one.  She joined the CCT Credit Cooperative in 2004, at that time she was only managing two pedicabs (a manually operated tricycle with no engine).  She disposed off these manual tricycles in 2005.

Just recently, she bought her third motorcycle.  Her son is now test-driving this with a sidecar is mounted to it.  She has just finished paying off her CCT loan of Php 10,000.00 which she used to pay for the down payment for her third motorcycle.  She took a new loan in the amount of Php 12,000.00 to purchase and refurbish a second-hand side-car to be mounted on her newly purchased motorcycle.

Noraida is very proud of having been part of the CCT Credit Cooperative.  She is even delighted to see her neighbors taking rounds in driving her motorized tricycles for a living.  She dreams of owning a taxicab someday. 

CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase and repair of a second-hand sidecar for motrized tricycle operation

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 58 years old. She and her family lives in San Lenorado, Aglipay, Quirino, Isabela. She is married to Benjamin who is a farmer. The couple is blessed with four children: two of them are already married while Emilyn - 35 years old is a graduate of a computer secretarial course and the youngest, Noven Rose - 22 years old, is a 2nd year college student. Jesusa is hoping that her youngest daughter will finish college in order to have a better job in the future. 

Jesusa wants to borrow from Kiva lenders PHP 5,000 that she will use for her glutinous rice and coconut-grinding business. Aside from grinding, alongside her grinding machine she sells rice cakes made from glutinous rice. She hopes her business will grow into a bigger one.

loans.use: To use as additional capital

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn R. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia  City. She is 37 years old. Rosalyn is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Rosalyn provides dressmaking services to local community members. Rosalyn has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn is requesting a loan of 5,,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to further expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 60 years old. He is married and has six children, three sons and three daughters. Some of his children are still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Richard lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He runs a drug store in his community. He sells all kinds of drugs – tablets, syrups, etc. His shop is by the roadside. Richard wants a loan to buy drugs in bulk to expand his business. He has been in business for four years.

loans.use: To procure drugs in bulk

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a food vendor in her village. She is 39 years old and married to Lary. Gloria is blessed with three children: John Ryan and John Paul are both 14, and Marielle is 12. All are high school students at the moment. She wants to be able to support her children in their studies until they graduate from college.

A desire to improve her food vending business has encouraged Gloria to ask for additional business capital from KIVA lenders. She hopes to borrow PHP 5, 000, and to make her business productive with the financial support of lenders.

loans.use: to improve her food vending business

loans.name: Sarbai

texts.en: Sarbai M. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest two children are University students, and the youngest two attend a local secondary school. M. owns and operates a clothing store at his town's local market. He sells a variety of clothes imported from China and Kazakstan. M. started his business in 2003 after working for 3 years selling animal skins. He has had much success in his new trade and has used his earnings to build a store and hire two salespersons. Today, his working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (~3500 USD).  For the future, M. hopes to continue to grow his business and says, "All I want is to be able to buy a car after all of my children graduate." He is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (~2800 USD) loan to import more clothes from China to sell in his store.

loans.use: To import more clothes from China to sell in his store

loans.name: Habeba Group

texts.en:
This is Habeba group. This group has three members, Habeba, Arezo and Havzen. They all live in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Habeba is the group leader. She is 40 years old and lives in a family of five members. She wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. She is a hard-working woman who supports her family through her business income.

Arezo, the second member of this group, has a shared business with her husband. She cleans fruits and vegetables and packages them, and her husband sells them from his cart in the market. This is the only business through which they support a family of 4 members.

Havzen has a tailoring business. She works in order to pay all the expenses of her family.

They have all requested a group loan of 42,000 Afghani to expand their businesses and compete the requirements. They would like to say "lots of thanks!" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fatou Diop's Group

texts.fr: Fatou Diop N. est une femme de 65 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 12 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" depuis un an et demi. Son crédit lui permet à chaque cycle d'acheter au moins un bœuf, de l'emboucher et de le revendre. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices avec lesquels elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou Diop N. is a 65-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 12 children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" for 1½ years.  For each cycle, her loan is allowing her to buy at least one steer to fatten and to resell.  This business brings in profits with which she supports her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her business fattening cattle

loans.name: Daysi Lilian

texts.es: Daysi Lilian F. D. R. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a sus dos hijas menores D. edad. Ella posee un comedor, en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos. Daysi solícita un préstamo ya que desea invertir en el para poder obtener mayores ganancias, ya que ella es la única que vela por el bienestar D. sus hijas, y su mayor deseo es brindarles una vida llena D. todo lo necesario para vivir D. manera adecuada.
texts.en:
40-year old Daysi Lilian F. D. R. and her two young daughters live in La Libertad department. Daysi owns a small restaurant where she serves breakfasts and lunches. She is asking for a loan to invest in her restaurant so that she can earn more money--she is sole support for her children. Her greatest wish is to proviD. them with the necessities for a good life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food ingredients

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 28-year-old single man. He has owned a barber shop since 2004. He helps his parents in the household with his income.

Today, Khaled is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additional merchandise in order to satisfy his clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
M. Mamadou D. sollicite un crédit de 200,000 FCFA pour profiter de la chute de prix des mouton après la grande fête de Tabaski.  La Tabaski (Eid aux pays arabes) est la fête du sacrifice et marque la fin du Hadji, le pèlerinage á la Mecque.  Chaque personne majeure et qui a les moyens doit sacrifier un mouton pour marquer la fête, et les marches du Sénégal sont inondé avec les moutons.  Mais, après le fête, il y aura beaucoup de bons moutons lesquels les vendeurs voudraient rapidement vendre.  
M. D. est le secrétaire du Greffe, le tribunal de premier justice, à Bambey, environs 100km de Dakar.  UIMCEC y a ouvrit une caisse en Juillet 2009 pour mieux servir les clients ruraux.  L'achat et la vente de moutons est une activité secondaire pour M. D., mais quelque chose très important pour lui.  Son père est un éleveur très connu, et il a enseigné a son fils le métier.  Avec les bénéfices de son “opération Tabaski”, M. D. voudrait aider son père pour s'approvisionner plus des moutons et satisfaire son clientèle à meme-temps.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D. is requesting a 200,000 XOF loan to take advantage of the drop in the price of sheep following the Tabaski celebrations. Tabaski (the Eid in Arab countries) is the festival of sacrifice to mark the end of the Hajj, the pilgrimage to Mecca. Every person over the age of majority who has the means must sacrifice a sheep to observe the festival, and the markets in Senegal are inundated with sheep. Once the festival is over, the sheep vendors are looking for a quick sale.
Mr. D. is the secretary of the Greffe, the court of first instance in Bambey, some 100km from Dakar. UIMCEC opened up a branch there in July 2009 to better serve rural clients. Buying and selling sheep may only provide a supplemental income to Mr. D., but it is still very important to him. His father is a well-known sheep farmer, who taught him the profession. With the profits from “Operation Tabaski”, M. D. would like to supply his father with more sheep while also satisfying his own customers’ demands.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Apitaila

texts.en:
Apitaila  S. is 31 and married with 3 children (ages 1 - 10).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Apitaila  has many years of experience in this business.  Apitaila  needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 155 tala or US $65 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Apitaila  joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Apitaila 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Apitaila  S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2.1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria has experienced some tough times in her farming. She is 56 years old, married and has four children. She plants rice crops to earn a living. Despite it being tedious, she still finds ways to enjoy farming. She farms so she can provide for her family’s daily needs. 

Candelaria would like to apply for a loan of PHP 6,000. She will use this loan to buy farm supplies to fund her farm.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Esperanza En Ti 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza en Ti (Hope in You), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child.

Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza, a Kiva partner, and is excited about the opportunity to grow her business with capital at low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling clothing by purchasing a dozen pairs of panties, a dozen pairs of women's pants, a half dozen pairs of women's shoes and a half dozen blouses in the main market and then selling them at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in the education of her child, whom she wants to see in the university, as well as in her long-term dream of saving enough to purchase a home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Blouses, women's shoes, panties, women's pants

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie raises pigs for a living. He is 37 years old and married. He also sells dried fish and uses his motorcycle to transport people around his community. He wants to prosper in his business in order to keep up with the growing needs of his household. He requested a loan of 5000 PHP, which he would use for purchasing pig feed and piglets. He also hopes to increase his supply of dried fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Zurahan Karmyshakova's Group

texts.ru:
Зурахан 60 лет. Она уже на пенсии вместе со своим пенсионером. Вместе с ней также проживают сын и невестка. Все они занимаются сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. Сейчас они заняты подготовкой к весенней посевной, подготавливают землю для посева картофеля. Кредит нужен для закупа семян и удобрений, а также оплаты работы наемных крестьян. 

Айысте 47 лет, она замужем. Она мать 3 детей:2 сына и дочь. Дочь замужем, а сыновья с отцом работают строителем. У них земельный надел где выращивают овощи. Кроме этого ее дочь занимается реализацией произведенного молока и молочных продуктов. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 500 кг азота- удобрений. 

Уркия, 33, замужем. Ее супруг работает водителем в России. У нее 5 детей: старшему 14, а младшему 1 годик. Она занимается выращиванием овощей и фруктов. У нее есть парник, где посажены лук и помидор. кредит нужен для весенних полевых работ. 

Парида, 41. У нее 4 детей. Супруг работает таксистом в столице Кыргызстана- Бишкеке. Она как и другие члены группы занимается полеводством, в данное время готовит землю к посеву картофеля. Кредит запрашивается для закупа семян картофеля. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zurahan is 60. She is already retired together with her husband. Their son and his wife also live with them. They all do farming mainly working in the fields and animal husbandry. Currently they are busy with preparation for spring sowing and getting the land ready for sowing of potatoes. They need the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for work of hired help. Ayista is 47, she is married. She is a mother of three children: two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is married and the sons work in construction with their father. They have a plot of land where they grow vegetables. Additionally her daughter sells produced milk and milk products. The loan is needed to buy 500 kilograms of nitrogen fertilizer. Ukriya is 33, she is married. Her husband works as a driver in Russia. He has five children: her oldest one is fourteen, and her youngest child ins one years old. She grows fruits and vegetables. She has a greenhouse where she planted onions and tomatoes. She needs the loan for spring planting season. Parida is 41 years old. She has four children. Her husband works as a taxi driver in the capital of Kyrgystan, Bishkek. She also works in the fields as other group members and at this time she is preparing the soil for sowing of potatoes. She is asking for a loan to buy potato seeds.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Felicita Veronica

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente tiene 25 años de impartir clase y esta ubicada en el colegio Miguel Ángel Ortez. 
Esta señora vive en la comunidad pueblo Redondo de las 4 esquina 100 vrs al este. 
Ella ha logrado construir su cas con créditos obtenido pero con su salario ha logrado darle la preparación academica.
texts.en:
This client has been teaching for 25 years. She teaches at the Miguel Ángel Ortez School. She lives in the Pueblo Redondo community, which is 100 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) east of the four corners. With the loans she has received she has built her house. She used her salary for education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the house and repair the roof

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar Giménez P. es de la ciudad  de Guayaybi, es soltero, vive con sus padres, tiene 27 años de edad.
     Se dedica a la venta de articulos de mercerias en general como ropas (remeras, pantalones, jeans, medias), calzados deportivos, remedios naturales, masas dulces preparados por la madre. La venta de los mismos el lo relaiza de forma ambulante recorriendo en una motocicleta que posee, el recorrido lo realiza en gran parte del 2º Departemente de San Pedro. 
El señor Cesar además de esta actividad es director propietario de una agrupación musical denominado “Los Madrigales del Ritmo” con 7 integrantes, realizan sus actuaciones por distintos lugares del 2º Departamento.
      Su sueño es contar con mas instrumentos musicales que le hace falta para asi poder brindar mejor show en cada actuación que realiza, por ello solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Cesar Giménez P. is from the city of Guayaybi, is single, lives with his parents, and is 27 years old.

He works in the sales of general merchandise such as clothing (tee shirts, pants, jeans, socks), tennis shoes, natural remedies, and sweet pastries prepared by his mother). He sells in different locations, riding around on his motorcycle. The route that he takes is in a large section of the 2nd Department of San Pedro.

Cesar also is the director of a musical group called “Los Madrigales del Ritmo” with 7 members, performing in many locations in the 2nd Department.

His dream is to have more musical instruments that he currently lacks in order to put on a better show in each concert that he does. For this reason, he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase musical instruments

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Peligro 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Miosty is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Unidas de Peligro (Dangerous Women United), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a simple, rented structure with a long-term partner and their two children.

Miosty is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanz  after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cellphones by purchasing cellphones, chargers and batteries to sell. She will use the profits to invest her dream of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Cell phones, chargers and batteries

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es:
