Luz es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el anexo La Esperanza del caserío Lagartera, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población ubicada en zonas rurales dispersas entre sí y que tienen como actividad económica pricipal a la agricultura, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la venta de pescado y verduras en el mercado de la ciudad de Mórrope, esta actividad la realiza los fines de semana, que es cuando llegan bastantes comerciantes al mercado, ya que en estos dias los pobladores de los caseríos y anexos llegan a la ciudad a adquirir los productos que utilizarán durante la semana. Ella compra el pescado en la ciudad de Mórrope y las verduras a los mismos agricultores de la zona donde vive.

Las ganancias que percibe de su negocio le sirven para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares, su esposo trabaja como comerciante de ganado. Adicionalmente ella cría aves de corral y cuyes, los cuales vende a los negociantes que frecuentan el lugar.

Luz desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas productos de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luz es una mujer trabajadora y hogareña, ella vela siempre por el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es llegar a terminar de construir su casa y radicar allí. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Luz is 31, and lives with her husband and their two children in the Esperanza neighborhood of Lagartera a village in the Mórrope District. The District is a rural area where people live far apart and work in agriculture. This is in Lambeque Province, about an hour and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclaya. For the last three years she has been selling fish and vegetables in the market in the city of Mórrope. She works there on weekends when many merchants come to the center. On these days the people from the villages and their outskirts go to the city to buy the items that they use during the week. She buys the fish in Mórrope and the vegetables from the farmers in the area where she lives. The income that she gets from these sales help her husband with the household expenses. Her husband sells cattle. She also raises poultry and guinea pigs that she sells to the salespeople who come to the area. Luz wants to expand her business by buying more items so that she can increase her sales and raise her earnings. That is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 new sols. Luz is a hardworking and homeloving woman. She is always looking out for the good of her family. Her biggest goal is to finally finish building her house and to live there. In the past she has worked with our institution and has shown punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables to expand her sales in the market.

loans.name: Genie Fe

texts.en:
Genie Fe C. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has two infant children. Genie Fe owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Genie Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Genie Fe is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy M. is from the village of Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Levy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 37 años es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Yuliana de 37 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. Desde muy joven Manuel aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es la actividad que siempre ha estado presente en su vida, actualmente posee tierras donde cultiva papa, maíz y alverja, productos que después de la cosecha son comercializados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de la plaga. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 37 years old and a happy, hard working father. He lives in a home of his own, along with his wife, 37 year old Yuliana, and his two children, whom he loves very much and to whom he wants to provide a better education. Manuel learned to work with the land when he was very young and agriculture has always been a part of his life. Presently he has land where he raises potatoes, corn, and peas. After harvesting his products, he sells them in the main market in the city of Tarma. What he enjoys most about his work is working the land, as this is the activity that helps feed his family. He’s been doing this for 17 years and what he finds most difficult is protecting his crops from disease. Eventually he would like to buy more land so that he can increase production. This will be his third loan through MFP. He has always been on time with his payments and expects to continue to be. He is very united with the other members of his communal group. He will use the 1,000 PEN ($375) to buy more fertilizer to apply to his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Marcelo Ronny

texts.es:
Marcelo de 35 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), el tiene una carnicería desde hace años cuando uno de sus amigos le aconsejo que podía tener mucho mas dinero y pasar mas tiempo con su familia. 

Cuando su mama le ayudo con el dinero para invertir en carnes el comenzó a trabaja en un puesto vendiendo carnes de vaca, pollos etc. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido implementar mas carnes y ha podido pasar mas tiempo con su familia. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, huesos, pollo, chanchos para su negocio, en el futuro quiere ampliar el loca y incrementar productos.
texts.en:
Marcelo, 35, lives in Guayaquil’s Las Orquídeas area (an urban zone so called because when it was discovered it had lots of orchids). He has had a butcher shop for several years since a friend suggested it to him as a way of earning much more money and having more time to spend with his family. When his mother helped him with funds to invest in the butcher shop he started to work in a stand selling beef, chickens, etc. Gradually, his efforts have led to his being able to add more meats and he has been able to spend more time with his family. He works from 8am until 7pm every day. He will use the loan to buy meats, bones, chickens and pigs for his business. In the future, he’d like to enlarge the location and increase his stock items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For meats and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement and cinderblocks.

loans.name: Jeannie

texts.en:
Jeannie O., 36, and her husband Moner, 34, have two children and work hard to cover daily expenses and schooling costs. For the past eight years Jeannie has been operating a fish-selling stand, an arcade with a billiards table, and retailing gasoline for vehicles.

Jeannie is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan to help purchase additional seafood for her store. She is also planning to use part of this loan to purchase a volume of gasoline and diesel for her to retail. She hopes that the additional inventory will attract new customers and help her expand her business.

Jeannie has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for several loan cycles and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.* She hopes that the income from her business will allow her to send her children through school.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with four children all whom attend school. She has been operating her business of selling charcoal and firewood to her neighbors from her home for the last two years. With the loan, she wants to purchase five sacks of charcoal and a bundle of firewood.

The major challenge in her business is high transport costs. She hopes to purchase enough stock and satisfy her customers to maximize her profit.

Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get financial support to boost her business.

Flora owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of charcoal and a bundle of firewood.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem C., 30, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. is a construction foreman, earning an income of about USD 14 per day. His wife grows mushrooms for an income of USD 2.16 per day. 

The family has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 7 on electricity supply every month. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more construction supplements to improve his business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy construction supplements.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 36 años, es una mujer hábil y trabajadora, convive con Crisanto, de 42 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Ella es una mujer con fuerza y mucho optimismo, hace ya 7 años que se dedica a la agricultura, ahí siembra maíz y papa, con la ayuda incondicional de su hija mayor Leonela; juntas viajan después de cada cosecha a diferentes lugares del país, Tarma, Oroya y Chanchamayo (selva central del país), donde comercializan su cosecha a buen precio. Pero no solo a esa actividad se dedica María, hace ya 2 años que deleita a propios y extraños con las ricos platos que prepara diariamente en su restaurante. Sin embargo lo que más desea es instalar una tienda de comestibles en su ciudad. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho reunirse y compartir momentos agradables con su banco comunal. Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará fertilizantes para el cultivo de papa que tiene.
texts.en: María, who is 36 years old, is a skilled and hard working woman. She lives with Crisanto, who is 42 years old, and together they have 3 children. They live in a rented house located in Chiras. She is a strong and optimistic woman and for the past 7 years has worked in agriculture, planting corn and potatoes with the faithful help of her oldest daughter, Leonela. Together they travel after every harvest to different places in the country, Tarma, Oroya and Chanchamayo (central forest of the country) where they market their harvest at a good price. But this isn't the only activity María dedicates herself to. For the past 2 years she has delighted her family and others with the delicious plates that she prepares daily in her restaurant. However, what she wants most is to install a grocery store in her city. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she likes to meet with and share pleasant times with her communal bank. With this loan that she will obtain she will buy fertilizers to cultivate the potatoes she has.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Madrona

texts.en:
Madrona Q. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 58 years old. Madrona is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Madrona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and packaged food. She also buys and sells vegetables, such as squash. Madrona has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Madrona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madrona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Madrona is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Madrona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Alice J

texts.en:
Alice J. K. is 41 yrs old and is married to a teacher, Ezekiel K..  She is a mother of five: Maureen (17 years), Dorothy (14), Robert (12), Naomi (10), and Harriet (3).

Alice subsidizes her husband's income in supporting her family. She has been milling maize for the last year. Her business gives her an average profit of Kshs 10000. 

This will be Alice's third loan with KADET, as she has  successfully repaid her first and second loans.  Alice intends to use Kshs 20000 to purchase maize and millet stock for milling and use the remaining Kshs 50000 to complete her rental houses.

Alice anticipates using profits from the business to pay back the loan and develop her family's land. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her milling business to cover the whole Baringo district and give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: To purchase maize for milling business and complete rental houses

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter is university student and her youngest daughter attends a high school. Three years ago, she divorced from her previous husband, who is the father of her two daughters. Her current husband is a carpenter and they have been living together since 2009. 

Altantuya and her husband run a furniture making business. Among the products that they produce are picture frames, kitchen furniture, tables and chairs. They purchase their materials and the supplies that are needed for production from Tsaiz market, one of the main raw material markets in the city. Her husband is responsible for the production with help of one assistant. 

She started her business in 2000 and has since gained significant experience. They hire a car, which is costly, to transport their products to the Narantuul market where they sell them. Because of the expense, she would like to purchase a car for their business. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car in order to transport their products.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita O. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 42 years old. Angelita is married and has 7 children. Her eldest child is 24 years old while the youngest is only aged 1. Angelita is a fish vendor. She directly buys assorted fish from the fishermen where she can get it at a lower price. She then goes around their neighborhood to sell the fish. Angelita said she needs the loan to buy fish supplies, styrofoam and a scale.

Angelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell and other materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of fish and other materials

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Marilu; ella tiene 35 años. La socia es casada, La socia se dedica a la artesanía ella tiene una tienda de artesanía, la socia trabaja elaborando aretes en alpaca, ella también realiza chompas de alpaca bebe, la socia elabora al por mayor sus trabajos y los distribuye en los mercados artesanales de Chinchero y Pisaq,  La soca es licenciada en Turismo ella trabaja en todo tipo de artesanía porque es su primera pasión la socia desea implementar su mercado y comprar materiales para realizar otro lote de sus trabajos, también desea estudiar ingles, ella continuará sus estudios de ingles. La socia solicita e préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales y mercadería para la venta. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marilu, 35, is a member of the “QORICHUSPA” communal bank located in Huanchac, Cusco department, Cusco province.

She is married and is a craftsperson.  She has a crafts store.  She makes alpaca earrings.  She also makes baby alpaca sweaters.  She makes her work at wholesale and sells in the various artisanal markets in Chinchero and Pisaq.  She also graduated with a degree in Tourism.  

She works with all kinds of crafts because they are her first passion and she wants to establish her market and buy materials to make another lot of her works.  She also wants to study English so will continue with her English studies.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of materials and merchandise to sell.

She is happy with the granted loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy materials and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris, currently in a business brewing alcohol, is requesting a loan to start another business such as wholesale trade.  Doris, who is 28 years old, married to a farmer and has three children, two of whom attend school, is hoping to buy a plot of land for her business in the future.

loans.use: To start another business such as wholesale trade.

loans.name: Silvia Sofía

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Sofía M. I. trabaja como Supervisor Contable General en una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados, desde hace 5 años.

Es casada de 46 años de edad, con dos personas a su cargo de donde uno de ellos está en edad escolar, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua en el Anexo de Batahola Sur desde hace 12 años.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle este crédito ya que lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como; Piedrín, Piedra Cantera. Así como la compra de productos de la AVON como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje y otros.
texts.en:
Silvia Sofía M. I. has worked as a general accountant supervisor for an aqueduct and sewerage company for the past five years. 

She is 46 years of age and has two children, one of whom is school aged. She has lived in Batahola Sur, a suburb of Managua in the Managua municipality, for 12 years.

She is grateful to CEPRODEL for granting her this loan. She will use it to purchase building materials such as gravel and slate, as well as Avon products including perfumes, creams, make-up and other products.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials and Avon products

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel M. de 54 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 hijos mayores: Manuel de 29 años que trabaja en ENACAL quien tiene su familia y vive a parte, y su otra hija de nombre Imara de 28 años que vive con él y trabaja en el Pollo Tip Top ella tambien asume sus gastos y obligaciones de pago,  es madre soltera de 2 niños que don Manuel le ayuda brindandole un hogar donde estar y con ciertos gastos basicos; Don Manuel labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde  hace  veintiun años actualmente se desempeña como Fiscal de Proyectos.  

Agradece a Kiva por el beneficio obtenido con el financiamiento anterior, ya que gracias a esto pudo levantar el porche de su casa. Requiere otro Financiamiento para continuar mejorando la vivienda como es repellar la pared de entrente y darle algunos toques finales al porche.  

Su mayor sueño es dejarles algo a sus nietos y brindarles una buena educacion para que sean ejemplo de personalidades.
texts.en:
Manuel M., age 54, is married and has 2 grown children. The first is Manuel, age 29, who works for ENACAL, has a family of his own, and does not live with Manuel. The other is a daughter named Imara, age 28, who lives with Manuel and works in Pollo Tip Top. She helps with the household costs. She is a single mother of two children, and Manuel helps her by offering her a home to live in and covering certain basic costs. Manuel has worked for the Municipal Town Hall of Juigalpa for 21 years, and currently works as a financial official.

He thanks Kiva for the benefits he obtained from his previous loan, since thanks to that loan he was able to install a porch on his home. He needs another loan to continue improving his home, through for example plastering the front wall and putting some finishing touches on the porch.

His greatest dream is to leave something to his grandchildren and offer them a good education so that they will be good people.

loans.use: home improvements, and plastering the front wall

loans.name: Eykel Ramon

texts.es: El Señor Eykel Ramón tiene 26 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Tiene más de 2 años en este negocio. La buena administración de su negocio ha hecho que siga adelante con este medio de vida, que es elemental para mantener a su familia. Por iniciativa propia fue el empezó este negocio y con ciertos productos como es pantalones, camisa, faldas, trajes entre otros y así tiene una gran variedad de público. El solicitante requiere del crédito para comprar una gran variedad de pacas ya que tiene ciertos pedidos de sus clientes. Presenta buenas referencias tanto en lo labor como personal además tiene experiencia en este medio de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Eykel Ramón is 26 years old. He sells used clothing. He has worked in this business for more than 2 years. The good administration of his business has enabled him to get ahead with this way of making a living, and it is elemental for supporting his family. He started this business on his own iniative with certain products, such as pants, shirts, skirts, suits among other things. He always has a good variety of customers. The applicant requires the loan to buy various packs of clothing, since he has had some orders from customers. He has good work and persona references and experience making a living in this manner.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in business selling food items. She is 31 years old, married to an electrician, with two children and both of them go to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more food items, for example, sweet potatoes to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more food items, for example, sweet potatoes

loans.name: Juan Eduardo

texts.es:
Juan V. es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 22 años y  está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de “Ingeniería Comercial”, en la facultad de Ciencias Económicas y Administrativas dependiente de la Universidad Nacional de Concepción (U.N.C.).
Juan actualmente está trabajando en la Universidad Nacional de Concepción, desempeñándose como Auxiliar Administrativo.
El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
Juan Eduardo agradece la posibilidad de solicitar el préstamo ya que esto le ayudaría en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podría contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro serán de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en: Juan V. is from the city of Concepción.  He is 22 years old and is in his third year of a degree in 'Commercial Engineering' in the faculty of Administrative and Economic Sciences at the Universidad Nacional de Concepción (U.N.C.).  Juan is currently working at the Universidad Nacional de Concepción as an administrative assistant.  He is requesting this loan so that he can make his monthly tuition payment to his faculty and also buy some books that he needs for his studies.  Juan is grateful that he is being given the chance to request a loan since it will help him in his studies and, at the same time, it will provide him with a credit history which will be very important for him in the future when he comes to carry out his projects.

loans.use: to pay his monthly tuition and to buy study materials

loans.name: The Three Sisters Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Three Sisters” Group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have requested a loan of 1,000,000 SLL for each in the group in order to further improve their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Marie F.. Marie is 38; she was born in Makeni City, where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a nurse, and two of her children are attending primary school while the other two are in secondary school. For 11 years now, Marie has been selling shoes, body creams, toothpaste, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy shoes, body creams, toothpaste, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel P. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Anabel is married and has five school-aged children. Anabel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling canned goods, junk food, breads, shampoo, soap, & biscuits in the local community. Anabel has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Anabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 5000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. 

This loan will be her second from HSPFI. Anabel is requesting 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, breads, & beverages. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, breads, & beverages

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina T. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Merlina is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells shampoo, soap, canned goods, beverages, snack food & baby diapers. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack food. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack food

loans.name: Lindi Limber

texts.es:
Lindi de 48 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Esta casado y su esposa trabaja vendiendo frutas y cocos junto al negocio del papa. Y ellos tienen 7 hijos ya todos mayores de edad. Tiene un taller de soldadura.

Comenzó desde joven como ayudante de un taller y aprendió a soldar y a sus 22 años puso su propio taller. Labora desde las 8H00 am a 7H00 pm o mas dependiendo de las obras que hace. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar una maquina enrolladora y va a ayudar en el negocio de su esposa y así incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y ofrecer mas trabajos con empleados que aprenda este arte.
texts.en:
Lindi, 48 years of age, lives in a peri-urban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area known for its mountainous roads.  He is married, and his wife works selling fruits and coconuts next to his business.  They have 7 grown children.  He has a soldering workshop.

He started very young as an apprentice in a workshop where he learned how to solder and, at 22 years of age, he started his own business.  He works from 8 am to 7 pm or so, depending on the work that he has.  With the help of this loan, he wants to buy a winding machine and help his wife’s business in order to augment his income.  In the future, he would like to grow his business with employees who learn his trade.

loans.use: buy a winding machine and help his wife's business.

loans.name: Nelly Maribel

texts.es:
Nelly Maribel tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera vive con lo padres y un  hijo de 4 años, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Nelly se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y en pocas cantidades siembra frejol, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y frejol, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terreno para sembrar.

Le gusta trabajar y le gustaria ternimar los estudios.
texts.en: Nelly Maribel is 24 years old, single and lives with her parents and her 4-year-old son in the parish of San Pablo, canton of San Miguel. The members of the V.R.C. Union y Esperanza community bank is located in San Pablo, about 30 minutes from the San Miguel office. The members make a living in agriculture, planting corn and potatoes, and selling legumes and other items. Nelly also makes a living in agriculture, planting corn and a small quantity of beans. This job has been developing for a long time. She makes her purchases in San Miguel and sells her products at the trade fairs in San Pablo and San Miguel. She is requesting the loan to purchase corn and bean seeds to increase her production and income. She has faced challenges such as a lack of workers and variations in climate, which at times can damage her crops. Her dream is to purchase land to sow. She enjoys working and would like to finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds.

loans.name: Orzikul

texts.ru: Орзикул проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ему 51 год. Он женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование у него среднее. Он более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. На сегодняшний день у него имеется 20 га земли, где на 15 га земли он посеял хлопок, на 3 га пшеницу, а на 2 га земли он выращивает арбуз. По хозяйству ему помогают его дети. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Orzikul lives in the J.Rumy district. He is 51 years old. He is married, with five children. He has received secondary education. He has been working as a farmer for over 15 years. At present he has a land plot of  20 hectares [about 50 acres]: of that, 15 ha is used for growing cotton, 3 ha for wheat, and 2 ha for watermelons. His children help him in this work. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers in order to plant and obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 39 years old, married, and has a six-year-old child. He sells charcoal to local residents in the middle of the Makadara estate. He has been doing this for the last 15 years. Stephen intends to use this loan to buy more charcoal so that he can cater to the growing demands of the economy. 

Stephen hopes to use the profits from his business to pay for his child's education. In the future, he hopes to venture into the business of selling kerosene.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal so that he can cater to the growing demands of the economy

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: La señora Laura es una mujer muy emprendedora que se dedica la venta por catalogo y joyería de plata que ofrece de casa en casa, familiares y amigos a pagos accesibles, por lo que en este momento desea comprar mayor mercancía para su propia venta para tener mayor ganancia. Lo que hace Laura es comprar con el monto solicitado para productos de los catálogos que le ofrece la misma empresa mas económico y luego lo vende al precio normal  pero recibiendo una mejor ganancia para ella. De esta manera es como recibe ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Laura is a very enterprising woman who sells silver jewelry via catalogue door to door to family members and friends with comfortable payment plans.  Because of this at present she wants to buy larger amounts of merchandise to sell and have higher profits.

What Laura does is buy with the requested amount products from the catalogue that the same firm offers at more economical prices and then she resells them at the regular price thereby earning better profits for herself.   This is how she earns income to help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mrs. Ou and her husband are local rice cultivators in Baray district.  Beside of farming business, Mrs. Ou also sells fresh fish which she gets from her husband's work as a fisherman.  Together, she and her husband earn about $7.50 per day. 

As the rainy season is coming, she would like to prepare to plant her rice crop but lacks money for seeds and fertilizer.  She would like to request a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and seed for planting.  She hopes that by planting and fertilizing her crop with finance from a Kiva loan, she will be able to increase her farming output over last year.  She will use her income to support her two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer, seed for planting.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elsie has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell.

Elsie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motorbike parts for repairing the motorbikes of customers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 50 years old, married, and has four children.  

To earn a living, he runs a retail shop selling household goods. He has been in the business for over ten years. He also does farming for more income generation.  

Moses hopes to expand his business into wholesale within five years.

He has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy plastic plates, buckets and basins.

loans.use: To buy plastic plates, basins and buckets.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Felicitas has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Felicitas  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Felicitas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur is 41 years old and lives with her sons and husband in a house in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia.  One son is a college student and the other son is a high school student. Her husband used to sell plastic bags at the local market. But now he is running a cellphone repair service and spare parts shop. Gantumur has two professions, tailoring and nursing. She used to work as a nurse from 1990 to 1994. From 2000, she started to run a tailoring business. Now she has many regular clients and has expanded her business successfully. Her turnover capital is 1,000,000 MNT. Her daily sales are 30,000 MNT. She keeps good control of her cash flow and expenses. When her income exceeds over 30,000 MNT, she saves the extra income in her savings account. Her sons take care of their family matters so that she and her husband can pay more attention to their businesses. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "When I and my husband come home after long work hours, my sons already cook the dinner and clean the home. I feel good about this. 

This year, we are not able to pay the full tuition fee of my son. If I could pay that fee, I would have nothing to worry about." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to pay for her son's tuition fee and increase the turnover capital of her husband's
business.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en:
Honeylyn is from Manla, Sapangdalaga Misamis Occidental. She lives with her husband and is blessed with three children. Honeylyn runs a fish-selling business. Her husband is a fisherman and she sells his catch to the community. She earns 4,500 PHP each month. Honeylynn also operates a general store at home to earn additional income for her family. 

Honeylyn is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to buy an additional pump boat. She wishes to expand her business and save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a boat

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata is 42 years old.  She is married and has six children. She owns a business selling softdrinks like Fanta. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 9 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her.

Liberata has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more drinks such as Fanta, juice, milk, etc. to sell. With any profit, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business, and she will be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: buy more beverages to resell

loans.name: Lorena Leticia

texts.es: Lorena Leticia de 37 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus hijos. Lorena se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de lácteos. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a esta actividad y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo ha logrado mantenerlo activo por mucho tiempo, el cual es muy importante para ella y su familia ya que es uno de sus principales fuentes de ingresos.  Ella es una mujer ejemplar la cual hace todo lo que esté en sus manos para llevar el pan de cada día a su familia. Es muy conocida en la zona y muchas personas la prefieren por tener siempre los mejores quesos en la zona. Además los precios están al alcance de todos. Su sueño es dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, razón por la cual no se cansa de trabajar ya que para ella su familia lo es todo. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de una mesa adecuada para la elaboración de los quesos ya que por el momento no cuenta con un lugar que le permita agilizar la producción. También necesita el crédito para comprar los  materiales necesarios (recipientes, moldes, pastillas, mantas, etc.), para la elaboración de queso, crema, requesón, etc. Todo esto con el fin de mejorar el servicio que da a los clientes ya que de esta manera  podrá mantener su negocio activo por mucho más tiempo y podrá seguir luchando por su sueño. Confía en Dios que tendrá buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Lorena Leticia, 37, lives in her own home with her family group, comprised of her husband and her children.  Lorena works selling dairy products.  She has been doing this work for a long time and thanks to God and to her hard work she has managed to keep it productive for a long time.  This is very important to her and her family since it is one of their main sources of income.  Lorena is an exemplary woman who does everything in her power to feed her family [give her family their daily bread] .

She is very well known in the area and many people prefer her because she always has the best cheese in the area.  Besides, the prices are accessible to everyone.

Her dream is to give her family a better quality of life, the reason she doesn't stop working, since her family is everything to her.

This has motivated her to request this loan from Integral to invest in her business by buying an appropriate table for making cheese, since at the moment she doesn't have a place that allows her to speed up production.  She also needs the loan to buy the necessary materials (containers, molds, rennet tablets, pieces of cloth, etc.) to make cheese, cream, cottage cheese, etc.

The goal of all this is to improve her customer service, since this way she will be able to keep her business productive for much longer and she will be able to continue fighting for her dream.  She trusts in God that she will have good results.

loans.use: to buy a table, containers, molds, rennet tablets, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Eligia

texts.en:
Eligia is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Eligia has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school uniforms and dresses. She has had this business for 35 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy cloths and materials needed for the tailoring shop.
Eligia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Eligia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cloths and materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett Del Socorro de 46 años, tiene un taller de costura, desde hace 14 años Janett es una persona responsable dedicada a su trabajo.  Este negocio lo inicio desde Joven ayudando  a su mama en sus momentos libres y solicita este crédito para la compra de tela, hilo, zíper, botones y tijera para la fabricación de uniformes y ropa. el sueño que  quiere realizar es ampliar su negocio para satisfacer sus cliente.
texts.en:
Janett Del Socorro is 46 years old and has a sewing workshop, which she has had for the last 14 years.  Janett is a responsible person who is dedicated to her work.  She started in this line of business when she was young by helping her mom in her free time.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, and scissors for making uniforms and clothing.

Her dream is to grow her business to satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and scissors.

loans.name: Seeta

texts.en:
Seeta is a 39-year-old single lady, the oldest among her sisters and one brother. She lives with her parents.

Seeta started a small tailoring business seven years ago by opening a small workshop with one sewing machine, Seeta is specialized in making curtains. Now she wants to add another service, making bedsheets and covers, so she applied for a loan to buy  the material and tools that she needs to start her new service.

loans.use: to buy  the material and tools that she needs to start making bed covers and sheets.

loans.name: Frelinda

texts.en:
Frelinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Frelinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Frelinda has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Frelinda would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Yelognisse 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YELOGNISSE 1 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Thérèse, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Thérèse est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Luc. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Thérèse vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a près de dix ans que Thérèse mène comme activité la vente de bouteilles et des bidons dans son quartier. Thérèse s'approvisionne dans un quartier du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Thérèse sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe YELOGNISSE 1.
texts.en:
The YELOGNISSE 1 group is formed of three people who live in the same area. The group representative, named Thérèse, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the third time the group is seeking the financial assistance of ALIDé in order to increase the scale of their business. Thérèse is 46 years old and is married to a carpenter named Luc.
They have five dependent children, some of whom are in school. Thérèse lives together with her husband and children, and she and her husband together cover the various household expenses. For almost ten years, Thérèse has conducted the sale of bottles and containers in her neighbourhood. Thérèse buys her stock in an area of Benin. With the goal of better satisfying her customers and growing her income, Thérèse is seeking this third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the YELOGNISSE 1 group.

loans.use: to buy bottles and containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is married with 3 children. She has received some schooling till the end of upper primary. Currently, Amina sells yam and smoked fish in Ve GoloKwati (near Hohoe) and its surrounding communities. She has been involved in this industry for about 4 years now when she realized that her husband’s occupation wouldn’t be enough to solve the family’s current raising budget. Her husband is a peasant farmer. Amina’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Amina will use the loan to increase her existing yam and smoked fish capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Amina plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: Amina will use the loan to increase her existing yam and smoked fish capacity

loans.name: Mawudekon Nonlome Group

texts.fr: MAWUDEKON NONLOME est un groupement de onze personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, Rufine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un certain Richard. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux à leur charge. Rufine a très peu fréquenté l’école. Rufine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Rufine vend des tissus et des chaussures par le système de distribution. Rufine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la cinquième fois que Rufine et les autres membres du groupe MAWUDEKON NONLOME sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mawudekon Nonlome Group is made up of 11 members who all live in the same district. The group representative, Rufine (the woman with her hand raised in the photo), is 49 years old and is married to a man named Richard. The couple have four children, all of whom have received an education, but with only two of them in their care. Rufine did not often frequent school. She lives together with her children and her husband, with whom she completes the different household tasks. For almost 15 years, Rufine has sold fabrics and shoes as a retailer. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. This is the fifth time Rufine and the other members of the Mawudekon Nonlome Group have sought financial aid from Alidé in order to strengthen their working capital and their businesses in order to better meet their customers' demands. The previous loans were all paid back in full. 

.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and shoes

loans.name: Mujeres De Chixcoteyac Group

texts.en:
In the rural area of Santa María Chiquimula, Totonicapán in Western Guatemala, the “Mujeres de Chixcoteyac” trust bank is located, a group of 11 women, working with determination to overcome the challenges that threaten to deter them.

María, the trust bank secretary, is a woman entrepreneur dedicated to her tailoring business, creating casual clothing such as pants and blouses, and traditional aprons, used by many women in the area, as well as her sales of cosmetics and perfume by catalogue. With high demand for her product, María needs a loan with which she can invest in a sewing machine to increase her efficiency and complete more orders. 

The eleven women of “Mujeres de Chixcoteyac” are thankful to have access to microloans that enable them to follow through with their dreams, strengthening their businesses and families. With increased profits, these mothers are able to provide a good life to their children with education, health, and hope for a bright future. Thank you, Kiva, for being a part of this process! 

In her own words, María states, “Friendship Bridge is a good institution because it supports the growth of our small businesses, with low-interest loans and easily-accessible credit.The monthly workshops, with topics such as saving and investment, help us make the most of our loans.”

loans.use: to invest in a sewing machine to increase her sales.

loans.name: Bondeko Group

texts.fr: Initiée par ses amies et parents, Béatrice a commencé à vendre les divers articles il y a maintenant 25 ans. Elle reconnaît que cette activité l'aide à nourrir, scolariser les enfants et construire sa maison. Le plus grand défi pour elle est le manque quelquefois des articles commandés par ses clients suite à l'insuffisance du capital. Elle a comme vision d'ouvrir une boutique uniquement d'habillement et une autre pour les produits divers afin de pouvoir assurer un avenir meilleur à sa progéniture. Béatrice est au centre de la photo et est entourée des autres membres du groupe.

loans.use: Renforcement du capital et ajout de nouveaux produits divers demandés par les clients

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.en: Maria G. is originally from Azuay but has lived in Guayaquil, Ecuador for more than 30 years. She has owned this store for 23 years with the help of her husband and only son. Her husband is in charge of buying merchandise for the store, but he can only buy as much as the store sells in the short term. Therefore, the store has very little in stock and cannot buy at larger quantities with cheaper prices. She has made efforts to seek loans from banks but has been rejected and she cannot pay the 20% monthly interest rates that local informal lenders offer. With the $500 loan she will be able to take advantage of better deals from her wholesale providers and also diversify her products.

loans.use: Improve Inventory

loans.name: Adzoa

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Mrs. Adzoa A. is a married mother of four children. Early on, she began trading tapioca, beans, and cooking oil. She is responsible for her children’s education and also supports her young brothers with the small profit she earns from her business. She has already benefited from two loans which were successfully repaid owing to her dynamism and the way she applies herself to her work. She is currently seeking a $750 loan to increase her tapioca, bean, and cooking oil stocks. This loan will improve her household conditions and positively contribute to the educational development of her young brothers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1970, Madame A. Adzoa est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Très tôt, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de tapioca, du haricot et d’huile. Elle s’occupe de l’éducation de ses enfants et soutient ses frères qui ne sont pas encore majeurs avec le peu de profit qu’elle tire de son activité. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien soldés à cause de son dynamisme et son application au travail. Actuellement, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour augmenter son stock en tapioca, haricot, et huile. Ce prêt aura pour impact l’amélioration des conditions d’existence dans le foyer et la bonne évolution de ses jeunes frères.

loans.use: Stocking tapioca, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She sells cassava and plantain. She is seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva to help her expand her sales.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca is 50 years old and is married with one child. Her husband is a construction worker and she makes typical foods such as ‘empanadas’ (fried, filled tortillas) and tacos, and she sells them close to where she lives. She is part of the group ‘Gladiola 8’ in which the other members are: Candelaria Gomez S., who sells food products from catalogues, and Martha Gomez Giron, who sells juices, soft drinks and sandwiches in the market. With the money they hope to find a permanent place to sell their products

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

REBECA TIENE 50 AÑOS , CASADA UN HIJO , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO ALBAÑIL EN LA CONSTRUCCION Y ELLA SE DEDICA A PREPARAR ALIMENTOS TIPICOS TALES COMO EMPANADAS , TACOS Y LOS VENDE EN UNA COLONIA QUE ESTA LOCALIZADA EN LA PARTE ALTA DEL CERRO DE LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE .FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO GLADIOLA 8 QUE ESTA INTEGRADO POR : CANDELARIA GOMEZ S. (VENDE PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS POR CATALOGOS ) MARTHA GOMEZ GIRON ( VENDE JUGOS , REFRESCOS , SANDWICHS EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD ).. ESPERAN CON EL CREDITO INSTALARSE CON PEQUEÑOS LOCALES DONDE PUEDAN VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS .

loans.use: To sell food/VENTA DE ALIMENTOS

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is married and has three children ages 19, 23 and 25. Her husband is a mechanic and owns his own shop but often struggles to make ends meet and find enough work to support his family. For this reason, Esther began helping a neighbor sell jewelry and, eighth years ago, she decided to begin her own business. Her love of sales and the desire to better the quality of life for her family have been her incentive to make an effort every day.

Fortunately, Esther has gained a loyal following and wishes to continue with the success she has had until now. She is requesting a loan of $1100 that she will use for the purchase of additional merchandise to increase the variety available to her customers and the level of service. She promises to pay off the loan in 6 months. Become an integral part of her success and support Esther. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther es casada y tiene tres hijos de 19, 23 y 25 años de edad. Su esposo tiene un taller mecánico a veces pasa por malos tiempos donde no tiene nada de trabajo y no recibe ningún ingreso para a su familia, por esta razón Esther comenzó a ayudarle a una vecina con la venta de joyería y poco después decidió independizarse y comenzar su negocio hace ocho años. Su gusto por las ventas y su deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la incentivan a esforzarse más cada día.

Afortunadamente Esther ha logrado tener muchos clientes y desea que su negocio continúe creciendo como hasta ahora y para darle un muevo impulso ahora esta solicitando un crédito de $ 1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante de sus logros y decídete a apoyar a Esther, muchas gracias.

loans.use:
Merchandise Purchase

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
N. Comfort is a mother of 2 children all below the age of 15 years.  She has gone through a lot of challenges since she divorced her husband ranging from emotional stress to lack of money to provide for herself and her family.  To provide for her family, she did an apprentice training in tailoring so she can start to sew and sell dresses.  

With a loan of $100 she plans to buy a sewing machine and some food items that are commonly eaten in the area that she will sell in front of her workshop.  Through this, she will raise money to provide food and other basic needs for her children.  She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of  a sewing machine, beans, corn, magi cubes and salt

loans.name: Vladislav

texts.en:
Vladislav is a talented entrepreneur with a successful business selling men’s sports apparel at a busy market in Energodar, Ukraine near the city of Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. Vladislav started his business about six years ago out of a desire to earn a living and meet people’s clothing needs. He sells clothes that are both popular and affordable, which helps to ensure a strong demand for his products. Vladislav is a serious business-owner who wants his business to be the best it can be while continuing to grow and be profitable. Vladislav is married and has a seventeen-year-old son. One of his goals for the future is to remodel his apartment and improve living standards for his family.

Vladislav has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase new inventory. The change of seasons makes this a busy time of year for business-owners like Vladislav. This loan will help him keep a good supply of inventory on hand so he can meet customer demand and make a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Amparo De Jesus

texts.es:
Amparo de Jesus G. is a very hard-working lady and her economic activity is the sale of fruit salads in the market at the main bus station in Leon, Nicaragua. Every day, to begin her work, Mrs. G. prepares bags of fruit to sell at her stand.

Mrs. G. has had her business for 10 years, which she started with savings she put together from her own efforts. Her business began on the corner where Iniser insurance company is, with a bench and a basket, selling candies in the open air. Later she started having a greater selection to sell, with soft drinks and fruit among other things; she was located on the same corner and put out her products in various baskets on a large wood table.

It is very important to note that Mrs. G. is a single mother who cares for two children who need her financial support, since they are in primary school and need to continue with their studies.

In order to maintain their economic situation, Mrs. G. has been working with Ceprodel for 2 years, and they have offered her financial help to grow her business by granting her 18 loans. Because of these loans, Mrs. G. has been able to get ahead to the point that she has been able to renovate her house while at the same time meet the needs of her children through her fruit-selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Amparo de Jesús Gonzáles es una dama muy trabajadora siendo su actividad económica la venta de ensaladas de frutas en el mercado de la Terminal de León en Nicaragua. Todos los días, al iniciar su labor la sra. Gonzáles prepara las bolsas de frutas para posteriormente venderlas en su localidad.

Actualmente la sra. Gonzáles tiene 10 años de tener su negocio e inició con el ahorro que había realizado propiamente con mucho esfuerzo. Su negocio comenzó en la esquina de la aseguradora Iniser con una banca y un canasto a la intemperie vendiendo caramelos, luego comenzó a surtir mas su venta invirtiendo en un poco la venta de gaseosas, frutas entre otros y actualmente se ubica en la misma esquina y sus productos los tiene en varios canastos todos sobre una mesa grande de madera.

Es de mucha importancia señalar que la sra. Gonzáles es madre soltera que tiene a su cargo a dos hijos el cual necesita apoyarlos financieramente ya que están estudiando en la primaria y además necesitan continuar con sus estudios.

Para poder sustentar su situación económica, la Sra. Gonzáles lleva 2 años de trabajar con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado ayuda financiera para crecer en su negocio otorgándole 18 créditos a lo largo de su labor. A raíz de haber realizado estos préstamos, la sra. Gonzáles ha podido salir adelante desde el punto de que ha podido remodelar su casita y a la vez suplir para la necesidad de sus hijos a los que tiene que mantener por medio de su negocio de venta de frutas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo has a sewing workshop at home where he makes leather jackets. He has three children and one is in university. This is the fifth time that he has requested a loan. His record in our institution qualifies him as client “1”, meaning good repayment of his loans. This loan will be use to buy raw materials (leather, lining, brooches and thread). His loan records and work allow him to gain access to this loan since he has experience in sewing and he has sufficient income to cover both the loan and his personal needs and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardo tiene un taller de costura en su domicilio donde elabora chamarras de cuero tiene tres hijos y una esta en la universidad. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima ( cuero, forro, broches e hilo). Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el rubro de costura y tiene ingresos suficientes para cubrir tanto el préstamo como sus necesidades personales y las de su familia.

loans.use: Buy leather, lining, brooches and thread to make leather jackets.

loans.name: Marlon Javier

texts.es:
Marlon A. is originally from the city of León, Nicaragua, specifically from the El Sauce district where he is currently dedicated to transporting customers in his own rickshaw (a bicycle with spots for two passengers in the back).

His business consists of pedaling around the city streets looking for clients, whom he picks up and takes to where they want to go, always within the city limits. His wife and kids are proud to have such a hard working husband/father and love him very much and want the best for him.

Marlon has improved his business thanks to loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel, which have allowed him to invest in repairing his pedicab and also making improvements to give it a touch of elegance to provide his clients an excellent service.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Marlon A. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de León específicamente del municipio El Sauce donde se dedica al negocio de transportación de personas teniendo su propia tricicleta (bicicleta con espacio para dos personas en la parte delantera).

El negocio consiste en ambular por las calles del pueblo y al ser solicitado por los clientes, estos le proporcionan la dirección y el se encarga retrasladarlos hacia su lugar de destino siempre a lo interno del pueblo. Su esposa e hijos se sienten satisfechos de tener un padre tan trabajador es por esta razón que lo quieren mucho y anhelan lo mejora para él.

Marlon ha mejorado la situación del negocio debido a que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado por créditos que le han permitido invertir en su bicicleta reparándola y dándole un mejor toque de elegancia para brindar un excelente servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Improvements for rickshaw

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Tân, 55 years old, farms a rice paddy and raises livestock. Her husband and children are government cadres. Work occupies her time when no one home. At the time she first joined the TYM Fund, she took out a loan to invest in her livestock. After four years and many more loans, she accumulates a nice sum of money from livestock selling. She used the funds to open a grocery store. Her store is popular and the business is prospered. The average monthly income is 200-22-USD. She is applying for a loan of 450USD for investing more to her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chồng con đều là cán bộ làm tại cơ quan nhà nước, chị Phạm Thị Tân, 55 tuổi, ở nhà làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Có công việc giúp chị cảm thấy vui hơn những lúc nhà vắng người. Khi bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ chị vay vốn chỉ để hỗ trợ thêm cho chăn nuôi tăng thu nhập. Sau 4 năm những đồng tiền lãi thu được từ tiền bán lợn cũng được kha khá. Bên cạnh vốn tự có, chị Tân bàn với gia đình vay thêm vốn đầu tư mở cửa hàng bán tạp hóa. Sang đến năm nay, thấy công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi chị Tân tiếp tục xin vay 450USD lấy thêm hàng bán. Có duyên bán hàng cộng với giá cả phải chăng nên cửa hàng của chị luôn đông khách và phát triển tốt. Thu nhập hiện tại của hai vợ chồng chị Tân là 200-220USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Olipa

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Olipa M.. She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 22.

In 2003, Olipa established her wholesale food business. Olipa requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of beans and fish in bulk and to open a small bar in front of her house. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beans and fish in bulk, as well as open a small bar out the front of her house.

loans.name: Theong

texts.en: Theong L. is a rice farmer in Kampong Cham. She carries on the traditional subsistence farming existence that her people have lived in for thousands of years. She herself has farmed since 1979, the year the Khmer Rouge regime lost power. She earns 1 US$ per day, sometimes less. Her husband earns similar wages as a yam farmer and part time fisherman. He is much newer to farming than she is, only having been involved since the year 2000. The two of them have had six children together and seen four of these children grow up and be married! Two of their children moved to Phnom Penh where they knew they could earn better wages than in Kampong Cham. One is working construction while the other is in a local garment factory. Both send some funds home to help support the family. Theong L.’s loan funds will go towards expanding her husband’s yam farming operation. They will buy an additional plot of farmland as well as yam seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farmland and yam seed.

loans.name: Maria José

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria is 39 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación. She's married and has a small child who attends school. Her husband is a security guard and supports the family with daily expenses.

Mrs. Maria sells tortillas and has five years experinece. She got this business going with her own money. With the loan requested she hopes to purchase more corn and store it. This way she will always have corn in reserve.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria tiene 39 años de edad, habita en el bario Villa Reconciliación, es casada y tiene un hijo menor de edad que está estudiando, su esposo trabaja como vigilante y aporta a los gastos de la familia. La Sra. Maria vende tortilla y tiene cinco años de experiencia, ella inició con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que le otorguen es para capital de trabajo en la compra de maíz y tener almacenado el producto para que no falte sus venta a sus clientes. A futuro es captar clientes en los restaurantes y otros, mejorar el nivel de vida y educar a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.fr:
Born in 1986 in Attitogon, Innocent A. is a energetic young man. Single at present, he has worked since quitting school. He’s in the business of selling shoes.

Innocent purchases the shoes in Lome and returns to sell them to local consumers who wish to buy them. With the upcoming peak season in mind, he is seizing this opportunity to request a loan to increase his inventory.

With the proceeds from the sale, he will repay the loan and improve his standard of living and business.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1986 à Attitogon, Monsieur A. Innocent est un jeune homme très dynamique. Aujourd’hui célibataire, il vit de son commerce après avoir cessé ses études précocement. La vente des chaussures est son activité.

Il achète les chaussures de Lomé et revient les vendre aux consommateurs locaux qui les désirent. A la pointe des fêtes qui s’annoncent, il compte saisir de cette opportunité pour solliciter ce crédit afin d’augmenter ses marchandises.

Après vente, les revenus lui serviront à rembourser le crédit et à améliorer ses conditions de vie et d’activités.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of shoes

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Шодиева Нигина жительница города Яван. Возраст 35 лет, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей растительного масла (хлопковое и льняное). Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже пять лет. Ее дело приносит доход , но кроме того она очень помогает населению. Так как этот продукт является основным продуктом питания  нашего населения. Поэтому ее оборотной суммы не хватает для того , чтобы обеспечить всех . По этой причине она решила получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Nigina S. lives in Yavan City. She is 35, married, and has two children. She sells vegetable oil (cotton oil and flax oil), and has been doing so for five years. Her business brings her income, but is also needed for the local population as this oil is one of the basic ingredients for the local diet. Her turnover totals are not sufficient in order for her to satisfy demand for her products, so she has decided to take out a loan to increase her turnover. She will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann H., aged 37, is married and lives with two of her children in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She makes around US$3 a day from selling fish. Her husband has a business catching fish from the river for his wife to sell. Their two their children are both students. Vann is asking a loan from Kiva of US$1,000 to help increase the number of fish she sells at the market.

(CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor as well as small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.)

loans.use: To help increase the number of fish she sells at the market.

loans.name: Xiomara De Jesus

texts.es: la Sra. Xiomara tiene tres hijos, de 16,18 y 20 años de edad, los cuales los tres estudian, tiene 40 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte,  es madre soltera pues le ha tocado esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos con los estudios, logro poner una pulpería desde hace seis años con dinero propio, luego comenzó a prestar en Afodenic y este solicitud que esta haciendo es la sétima pues desea comprar inventario para la pulpería, surtir de productos de consumo, también desea  surtir de cosmético y productos escolares ya que se venden bastante, y de esta manera captaría mas clientes pues, ha sido de gran beneficios los préstamo ya que ha podido salir adelante con su negocio. A largo plazo es mejorar la infraestructura del negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida para poder dar los estudios a sus tres hijos ya que seria un orgullo y sastifacion de madre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara has three children who are 16, 18 and 20-years old, who are all studying in school. She is 40-years old and lives in the North Laureles neighborhood of the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. As a single mother she has struggled much to push her children to study. She has successfully run her store for the past six-years with her own funds and now has started requesting from Afodenic. And with this seventh request, she would like to purchase an inventory of supplies: supplies for consumer products, cosmetics, school supplies at a fair price, so as to attract more clients. These loans have been a great benefit as Mrs. Xiomara has been able to move her business forward. Her long term goals are to improve the infrastructure of the business and to have better living conditions for her three children to study as it would give her much pride and satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and baisc grains for her shop

loans.name: Neyo

texts.fr: Née le 14 février 1958 à Agbanakin, Madame D. Neyo est une veuve ayant 5 personnes à charge.
