L’achat, le fumage et la vente de silure noire qu’elle a entrepris depuis plus de 32 ans lui permettait de subvenir aux besoins de son ménage. Mais aujourd’hui, avec le phénomène de vie chère, elle joint difficilement les deux bouts. Elle se propose d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat afin de mieux rentabiliser son activité pour faire face aux multiples besoins de sa famille. Ne disposant pas de fonds propres, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui servira de fonds de roulement indispensable à la stabilité et à la sécurisation de son revenu.
texts.en:
Born on February 14, 1958 in Agbanakin, Ms. Neyo D. is a widow who is responsible for five people. Buying, smoking, and selling black catfish has been an enterprise of hers for 32 years. It used to allow her to support her household needs. But today, with the unusual high cost of living, she has difficulty making both ends meet. She has the idea to increase her buying power to make her business more profitable. This would in turn enable her to cope with multiple family needs. Lacking the working capital, she is requesting a loan as the operating funds necessary for stabilizing and securing her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To smoke and sell fish

loans.name: Rubina Ashiq Maish Group

texts.en:
My name is Rubina and I have lived in Lahore Pakistan for the past 25 years. My husband name is A. M., who has owned a scrap business for the past 18 years. I have five children: three sons and two daughters. I make embroidered dresses and sell each dress for $2. I complete approximately 10 embroidered dresses per month and earn $20. I successfully repaid my four loans which I borrowed from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). I am now requesting my fifth loan to buy iron and plastic bottles for my husband’s scrap business.

I am a group leader with a few more women in my locality. Rabia baji is requesting a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. Asia baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Parveen baji is requesting a loan to repair their cycles for her rented cycle business. Shabana baji is requesting a loan to buy glass for her glass selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's business.

loans.name: Fada Mohammad

texts.en:
Fada M. is 32 years old and lives in distract 12, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two children. Fada works as a carpenter and has a small shop. He requires a small loan for his shop to increase his inventory and make his business larger

He requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani over a term of 12 months and wants to expand and progress in his business. He needs to increase his shops stock of wood to have material available to meet his customers needs.

He is happy that this process of making small loans is available in Afghanistan and wants to thank kiva and all the lenders around world.

loans.use: To purchase wood for carpentry shop

loans.name: G.s Reyna Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de Nombre G.S Reyna esta conformado por 2 personas con los siguientes nombres Doña Reyna Isabel S. O. y Luis Alberto M. su edad es de 78 años y su amiga Doña Reyna tiene la edad de 44 años, el estado civil de Doña Reyna es soltera y tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 22 años de edad que trabaja por cuenta propia su hija de 20 años de edad y cursa el 5 año de secundaria y un niño de 18 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria ya que estudia por la noche en el caso de su amigo Don Luis su estado civil es casado y tiene 5 hijos su hijo mayor de 40 años cursa el 2 año de secundaria y trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 38 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria su otro hijo de 32 años cursa el 5 año de secundaria su otra hija de 26 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 26 año cursa el 4 año de secundaria todos están trabajando y estudiando ya que no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar y ahora quieren hacerlo, su esposa labora como ama de casa,  los propósitos de Don Luis son de mejorar su vivienda para su familia  en sus deseos esta el comprar una camioneta para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes y vender mas leña su deseos son de mejorar su propiedad en cuanto a la construcción los propósitos de Doña Reyna son de mantener activo su negocio para que este le siga generando mas ingresos para su familia que lo necesita sus sueños son de  ampliar el negocio con tres trabajadoras que le ayuden y así ofrecerles mas productos a sus clientes en sus deseos esta el ser la propietaria del negocio mas productivo de la comunidad para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

La actividad económica de ambos es diferente Don Luis se dedica a la venta de leña y Doña Reyna es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación y el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 14 años, en cambio la ubicación del negocio de Don Luis es de manera ambulante y el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años el inicia este negocio con otro tipo de negocio ya que al principio el contaba con 8 cerdos y mas tarde los vendió y  reunió el dinero para la  compra de un carretón y su caballo mas tarde uno de sus hijos le facilito el dinero que fue con el que inicio el negocio de leña cuando obtuvo las ganancias reunió el dinero nuevamente  de sus ganancias y le pago a su hijo y este negocio le gusto ya que le dejaba ingresos para su familia y además sus clientes le compraban lo suficiente en cambio su amiga Reyna inicio con dinero propio por lo que gano laborando como domestica y el negocio de la tortilla le gusto y así fue que decido mantener este negocio y las ganancias las ocupo para la inversión de su negocio  y es así como llega establecer su negocio en su casa de habitación el financiamiento que solicita Doña Reyna es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de leña, maíz y cal por lo que el precio del maíz esta muy elevado en el caso de Don Luis el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y esta destinado para la compra de una motosierra ya que esta herramienta le facilitara el trabajo y también necesita darle mejoras a su carretón y las medicinas para su caballo que son necesarias para su negocio y necesita darle el medicamento.
texts.en:
The G.S. Reyna group consists of two members: Reyna Isabel S. and Luis Alberto M.. Luis is 78, and his friend Reyna is 44. Reyna is single and has 3 children: her oldest, 22, works for himself; her daughter, 20, is in her 5th year of high school; and her son, 18, is in the 5th grade of elementary school and works nights. Luis is married and has 5 children: his oldest, 40, is in his 2nd year of high school, and works for himself; his son, 38, is in his 3rd year of high school; another son, 32, is in his 5th year of high school; his daughter, 26, is in her 3rd year of high school; and his youngest son, 26, is in his 4th year of high school. All of Luis's children both work and study; they didn't have the opportunity to go to school before and now they want to. His wife is a homemaker. Luis's plans include improving his house for his family. He would like to buy a pickup truck so he can better serve his customers and sell more firewood. He would also like to upgrade his construction equipment. Rosa's goal is to keep her business active so she can continue to generate more income for her family. She would like to expand her business by hiring three women to help her out. She also wants to offer more products to her customers. Rosa wants to run a business that is more useful to her community so she can meet her customers' needs. Luis and Reyna are in different lines of work. Luis makes his living selling firewood, while Reyna makes and sells tortillas. She works from her home and has been in business for 14 years. Luis travels around, and has been in business for 15 years. He had started out in a different business: he had 8 pigs, which he later sold, and used the money to buy a horse and wagon. Later, one of his sons gave him the money to start his firewood business, and he paid his son back with his earnings. He liked this business since it gave him income for his family and his customers bought plenty from him. Reyna, on the other hand, started with her own money, which she earned working as a domestic. She liked her tortilla business and she decided to stay with it. She invested her earnings into her business, enabling her to start doing business from her home. Reyna is seeking a loan to use as working capital, as she has to buy firewood, corn, and lime, and the price of corn is very high. Luis is seeking a loan for working capital. He plans to use the money to buy a power saw, to make his work easier. He also needs to make improvements to his wagon and buy medicine for his horse. The horse and wagon are necessary for his business, and he has to give his horse medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Istemeli

texts.en: Istemeli A. is a 35-year-old farmer who breeds calves in the small village of Imishli City. Istemeli is married and has one son. He has been involved in this business since his childhood, thanks to his father who passed to him the best experience in looking after animals. Istemeli has a car, which he uses to take local people from one village to another. Cattle breeding is the main financial source for his family. Istemeli would like to expand his business and purchase two more calves.

loans.use: Purchase two calves.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady C., 35 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Kabendou depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des arachides, les faire décortiquer pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut  renforcer son captal. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Khady C., age 35, is married and has six children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group Kabendou for three years. Her work consists in buying peanuts and shelling them to make peanut butter to sell. She wants to boost her capital. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To produce and sell peanut butter

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru:
Зебинисо Азизова 1958 года рождения, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Имеет высшее образование. Торгует продуктами питания, а точнее конфетами, на рынке "ПАМИР". Товар ей привозит знакомый и поставщики , она считает, что выгодней так и удобней. С Микроинвест начала сотрудничать в 2007 году. Она  одна зарабатывает и помогает семье как может. Дети взрослые , но они живут отдельно и у них свой отдельный бюджет. 
Поэтому она благодарит Микроинвест и за поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en:
Zebiniso A. was born in 1958, is married and has 2 children. She has a college education. Zebiniso sells food products, specifically candy and the “PAMIR” market. Her acquaintance and suppliers bring her the products to sell, which she thinks is more profitable and more convenient. Zebiniso started working with MicroInvest in 2007. She is the only one earning money and helps her family as best as she can. Her children are grown but they live separately and have separate budgets. This is why she is grateful to MicroInvest and for KIVA’s support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Candy

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nassoro J. is a micro-entrepreneur and a Tanzanian business man. He runs a pharmacy called Pharmacy Partimo at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. He saves a lot of the people of Mbagala because there is no dispensary available. He purchases the business items from Kariakoo Wholesale Pharmacy.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To buy more items for his pharmacy

loans.name: Djita

texts.fr: Djiba D. est mariée, mère de 07 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus teint à l’indigo « Thioup ». Elle souhaiterait renforcer cette activité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Djiba D. is married and the mother of 7 children. She sells indigo-dyed cloth, locally called "Thioup". She would like to bolster this little business so as to support her family better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of dyed cloth called "Thioup"

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Mrs. Merlinda F. is a member of the co-op in good standing.  She started her membership 4 years ago, on May 12, 2005. Married and blessed with 7 children, she has two  already married and the others still in school. She is on her 8th  loan, now amounting to PHP 14,000, for financial assistance for her proposed project, rice production, which is one of their primary sources of income for their daily needs. Her loan will be used for buying fertilizers and chemicals for cultivating their rice field. Recently, they're happy to be managing and cooperating their project and they are very thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Coop for lending them money for financial assistance in cultivating their rice field.

loans.use: additional capital for her rice production

loans.name: Awa Ngom

texts.fr: Awa Ngom M., 61 ans est veuve avec 05 enfants  en charge. Son activité est le commerce. Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter du poisson séché, du poisson fumé et du yet pour renforcer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa Ngom M., 61, is a widow with 5 children for whom she is responsible. Her business is petty trading. This loan will allow her to buy dried fish, smoked fish, and "yet" (fermented dried mollusc used as a condiment) to bolster her little business and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of dried and smoked fish and "yet"

loans.name: Ivona

texts.en: Ivona T., 66, is widowed with 12 children.  She has many years of experience in the tomato, cabbage, and cucumber, etc business. She sells to the villagers/public three days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala. SPBD loans are Ivona’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All will be used to maintain business needs.

loans.use: To purchase sprayer, gromoxone, bush knives, planting metal and a spade.

loans.name: Juboo Beuge Khadim Group

texts.fr: JUBOO BEUGE KHADIM est un groupe de femmes habitant prés du village sandiara localité située à 25 km de la ville Mbour .Elles s’activent dans l’agriculture,  le petit commerce et l’embouche. Avec le début de l’hivernage elles sollicitent un prêt pour financer leurs différentes activités génératrices de revenus leur unique source de revenu pendant cette période. Les revenus tirés de cette activité leur permettent de nourrir leurs familles en attendant les récoltes.
texts.en:
JUBOO BEUGE KHADIM is a group of women living near the village of Sandiara, located 25 km from the city of Mbour. The women are active in agriculture, small-scale commerce, and the fattening of livestock. With the beginning of the off-season, they are requesting a loan to finance their different income-generating activities, which are their only sources of revenues during this period. These revenues enable them to feed their families as they waiting for the harvests.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson D. is the 45-year-old owner of a general store and lives in Modesta Village, San Mateo, Rizal.  He is married to Lilian Lila, 48, a psychologist. They have two school-aged children.

Johnson has been an entrepreneur for almost two decades. He also has a motorized tricycle. Combined, he earns a monthly income of close to P30,000.  

He joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative only in 2008, but is already enjoying many benefits from being a member. He has just finished repaying his previous loan with CCT.  Now on his fourth loan cycle, he has applied for a P9,000 loan, which he will use to purchase additional items to sell, including rice.


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell at his general store

loans.name: Wildor David

texts.es:
El señor Wildor David A. T. tiene 27 años y al ser el hermano menor de 4 hermanos es el único que aun vive con sus padres. Los cuales se dedican a la venta de comida en un mercado de la zona. No tiene hijos pues asegura que primero quiere hacerse de casa y un buen trabaja para no hacer sufrir de problemas de dinero y no hacerle faltar nada a su esposa e hijos. El señor Wildor vive en la zona Oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde tiene 1 automóvil que usa como taxi para ganar dinero y por las noches estudia Mecánica Automotriz en un instituto de enseñanza superior.


El préstamo será destinado para pagar el saldo que le falta por la compra del vehículo que tiene. El señor Wildor espera poder sacar otro préstamo para instalar en su movilidad un equipo de gas y así gastar menos en combustible y mejorar sus ingresos netos.
texts.en:
Mr. Wildor David A. T. is 27 years old, and as he is the youngest brother of four siblings, he is the only one who still lives with his parents. They sell food in a market in the area. He doesn’t have children as, first, he wants to get himself a house and a good job in order to not suffer from money problems and not deprive his wife and children of anything. Mr. Wildor lives in the Western area of the city of Cochamamba, where he has one car which is used as a taxi in order to earn money, and in the night, he studies auto mechanics in an institute of higher education. The loan will be used to pay the balance that he owes for the purchase of the vehicle that he has. Mr. Wildor hopes to be able to take out another loan in order to install in his vehicle gas equipment and as such spend less on fuel and improve his net income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment for vehicle purchase

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: A. Ablavi est une femme âgée de 40 ans mariée et mère de 3 enfants.Elle habite à lomé,la capitale du TOGO. Ablavi est une commerçante dévouée. Elle a une boutique d’alimentation générale. Avec une partie de son crédit elle voudrait s'approvisionner en produits d'alimentation générale comme le riz,le lait,le sucre,les tomates,les savons détergents, les sardines etc...en gros et ensuite avec le reste de son crédit elle voudrait bien acheter un moulin qui écrasera les épices. Avec les bénéfices qu’elle obtiendra, elle pourra subvenir aux besoins de ses trois enfants.
texts.en:
A. Ablavi est une femme âgée de 40 ans mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Ablavi est une commerçante dévouée. Elle à une boutique d’alimentation générale. Avec une partie de son crédit elle veut acheter les produits pour sa boutique et ensuite avec le reste de son crédit elle voudrait bien acheter un moulin qui écrasera les épices. Avec les bénéfices qu’elle obtiendra, elle voudrait bien acheter un autre moulin qui écrasera les céréales.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de produits d'alimentation générale et achat de moulin.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Evelyn is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Irma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling general clothing in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,785 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Irma from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette S. lives in the village of Brgy. Ayungon, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She is 52 and has two adult children, ages 26 and 28. Her older son graduated from college with a degree in Mass Communication and already has his own family. Her younger son is a trained radio technician. He has not yet found work in his field of study, so he currently earns his living by driving one of two tricycles (a motorcycle with a sidecar for passengers) owned by Suzette.

Despite being separated from her husband, Suzette strives hard to meet her familial obligations, trying to be both mother and father to her sons. Without the additional support of another breadwinner in the family, Suzette has been doing her utmost to continue pursuing her dreams for her children, because she truly believes that her dream will come true. She holds on and trusts that she can succeed through hard work, perseverance, and full faith in the Almighty.

Her progress out of poverty started in 2003 when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and borrowed PHP 3,000 to start a food vending business. She started out as a sort of one-man band: she both cooked the food and sold it to people in her neighborhood. She began buying bananas in bulk and selling them to her neighbors in retail. Her business activities also helped her adjust to her new single status, and she became more independent and empowered because she knew she had the capacity to provide for her young family.

As her business continued to improve, she was able to buy a motorized water pump for her house, which in turn allowed her to raise pigs in her backyard without offending her neighbors with the usual foul odor that occurs when a pig-raising business is not maintained well. From her subsequent loans, she was able to buy tricycles for her sons to drive, allowing them to help earn a living for their families. She was also able to buy the rights to a piece of land. Her combined net income from all her business activities eventually amounted to PHP 3,500 per month.

Because of her good credit performance in her group, her center, and NWTF-PD (Negro Women for Tomorrow Foundation - Project Dungannon), she was able to secure the amount of Php 19,500 for her thirteenth cycle loan, which she used for her business. The loan was paid in timely weekly installments and was fully paid within its set term.

For her fourteenth cycle, she is borrowing Php 25,000 to be used for her business, as well as to pay for motorcycle maintenance, because when the machines are in good condition they are able to generate more income. The profits earned from this loan will be used for the needs of her family.

Suzette is shown in the picture posing with the two tricycles that are in need of maintenance work.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, the Negro Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To be used for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Lilian Wangu

texts.en: Lilian is married to Joseph and they have no children yet. She was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and has no previous credit history. Lilian has been in the business of selling new clothes for two years. With the loan she is acquiring, she intends to add to her stock of new clothes since demand is high because it is the high festive season (school holidays and Christmas holiday). Lilian operates her business out of a stall in an open market where there are many customers. With the extra profits, Lilian plans to open another stall and her hope is to sell clothes wholesale. Lilian believes she is very determined and hardworking. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell at her stall in the market

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa R., 56 years old, manages a sari-sari store in Norala, South Cotabato. She started her store with a small amount of capital in 2000. With great effort to make her business productive, she now has a piggery and poultry business. Nimfa is the mother of six children. With her business, she has been able to send her children to school. Now she’s requesting a loan of 21,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to expand her piggery and poultry business.

loans.use: To buy groceries, pigs and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase restaurant supplies.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice sells sarongs in Agbor, Delta State, Nigeria. She is very happy with her business because she has the opportunity to interact with different people. She is also happy because the festive season is here and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

Eunice is 32 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a carpenter.

She hopes for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos Ernesto P. S. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La P., vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de edad, así mismo vive junto a sus dos padres. Carlos posee una venta de carne de res frente  al Mercado Central, ubicado en la capital del país (San Salvador). El solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder contar con el capital necesario para poder surtir su negocio con una gran variedad de carnes, así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad de carne, la cual la podrá obtener gracias al préstamo, debido a que debe comprarla al contado y necesita tener el dinero para hacerlo. Carlo Ernesto es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien no quiere faltar nunca con el alimento y otras necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos Ernesto P. S., who is 43 years old, lives in La P. with his wife, two young children, and his parents. Carlos owns a business selling beef in front of the central Market in the nation's capital, San Salvador. He is asking for a loan because he needs capital in order to supply his business with a wide variety of meats and would like to be able to purchase larger quantities of meat. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to do so since he must buy in cash and needs the money to do this. Carlos Ernesto is responsible and a very hard worker who does not ever want to lack food or other household necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Meat

loans.name: Tauinaola

texts.en:
Tauinaola G. is 45 and married with 4 children (ages 8 - 21).  She owns a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Tauinaola has many years of experience in this business.  Tauinaola needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 220 tala or US $92 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Tauinaola joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tauinaola's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tauinaola G. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.99 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Janobiddin

texts.en:
Since Janobiddin was very young he has been part of an agriculture business. He has gained a lot of experience in this business as he has always helped out a lot with the cultivation of crops in his home community of Isfara, Tajikistan. Now he is the father of three adult children. Nowadays Janobiddin has managed to improve his family’s economic situation thanks to the help brought to him by IMON International through a loan that he has used directly for his agricultural business. On this occasion Janobiddin is seeking IMON International’s help so that he can benefit from improved technical assistance in his farming - so that, when harvest time comes around, he can improve his economic situation. Please support this father so his effort is worthwhile. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: La Bendicion 3,4,5 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group La Bendicion (The blessing), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, a poor agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their nine children.

Ana is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having fully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used clothing by purchasing large packages of used clothing imported to the DR from organizations such as The Salvation Army in the United States. She will then sell the clothing in her community, using the profits to provide for the daily needs of her large family and to pay the transportation costs for her children to go to school. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Used Clothing to sell

loans.name: Women Empowerment Group

texts.en:
Mary B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Empowerment. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, whose ages range from 13 to 35.  Her youngest child is in the 6th grade, and the oldest attended university, but dropped out.  Mary herself never went to school due to poverty. Besides her own children, Mary also cares for a niece and nephew.

Mary's business is the sale of general goods, such as soap and candles, and food items, such as seasonings and pepper, onions, and rice.  She has been in business for more than 30 years, and today she sells from a market stall at the Chicken Soup Factory Market in Gardnersville, near Liberia's capital of Monrovia. During the Liberian civil war, Mary and her family fled the country for neighboring Guinea. When she returned to Liberia, she started her general goods business with about 30,000 Liberian dollars in seed money. With her 20,000 Liberian dollar share of this 75,000 Liberian dollar group loan, Mary plans to buy more inventory for her shop.

In the future, Mary hopes to grow her business and open a store that sells general goods. She wants to be able to provide for all her children, and to help them get a good education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is the one holding the sign. Watta D. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy general goods such as soap and candles, and food items such as seasoning and pepper, onions, and rice.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline O. lives in Taboc Sur Oroquieta City. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. For the last 10 years, she has made a living by fishing. She earns about 4,200 PHP a month from her work.

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has applied for a loan, her first, for 25,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is 40 years-old and lives with his wife and three children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger.  His three children, aged between 10 and 16, attend a local secondary school. They have been living together in their current home for eight years. 

At present, Narangerel operates a meat trading business with his wife in his home town. He sells a variety of meat to his many customers. Narangerel has been operating his business since 2006, and has built his business to a consistent level. Narangerel plans to supply meat to Ulaanbaatar city, the capital city of Mongolia, which will bring more profit and sales revenue to his business. He is a very hardworking person and his business is very important for him. He says,  “I always try to sell healthy and high quality meat to my customers.” He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~ 1800 USD) loan to purchase more meat for his business.

loans.use: Tp purchase meat.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Centurión D. B. es viuda, con casa propia,  tiene 62 años D. edad.

     Es propietaria D. una despensa con 31 años D. funcionamiento, buena ubicación, con clientela formada, aparte tiene 3 salones que alquila.

     Sueña en cargar mas D. mercaderias su negocio para poder aumentar sus ingresos porque esta muy bien ubicado, ademas por que el fondo D. su negocio lo ha invertido en algunos gastos particulares y no ha podido recargar, y por ello solicita el crédito para la compra D. los articulos que faltan en su negocio; como panificados, lacteos, y todos los productos D. la canasta básica.
texts.en:
Lucia Centurión D. B. is a widow. She has her own house, and she is 62 years old. She has had a grocery store for 31 years. It is well located, and she has regular customers. She also has three salons that she rents. She dreams of carrying more merchandise for her business. She wants to be able to increase her income because she is well located. Also, she has invested funds from her business in some private expenses, and she has not been able to replenish. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy some articles that her business needs like baked goods, dairy products, and all of the basic needs products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baked goods, dairy products, noodles, rice, drinks, sugar, and others

loans.name: Sopheap Pang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P. is 57 years old and she lives in Preak Raing village in Kandal province. She has been selected by the members to be the leader of this group loan which consists of four people. Each member will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Mrs Sopheap P. is a grocery seller and is able to earn a small income to support her family. For this business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities.

Mrs. Mrs Sopheap P. is widow with two children who are both seamstresses in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Luz Angélica

texts.es:
Luz tiene 27 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos D. 7 y 3 años D. edad en el sector El Pescador del distrito D. San José, un distrito pesquero D. L. provincia D. Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace cinco años aproximadamente a L. venta D. choclos cocidos y humitas (plato típico D. origen andino hecho a base D. una masa D. maíz cocido, aliñado, envuelto en hojas D. mazorca y finalmente tostado en las mismas hojas), esta actividad L. realiza todos los dias en los exteriores del mercado del distrito D. San José y le sirve para agenciarse D. ingresos que utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es albañil, a solventar los gastos familiares.

Adicionalmente Luz venD. carbón en su puesto, elL. también utiliza este combustible para preparar los alimentos que venD. a sus clientes, actualmente desea adquirir ollas y una pequeña cocina para mejorar su negocio, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Luz es una madre D. familia bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación para que puedan estudiar una carrera superior en el futuro. En L. zona donD. vive elL. es considerada por sus vecinos como una mujer honesta y colaboradora.
texts.en:
Luz is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 7 And 3 in the El Pescador sector of the San José district. This is a small district in the Lambayeque province, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past five years she has been selling boiled corn and "humitas" (a typical dish of Andean origin maD. from corn flour dough which is dressed, wrapped in corn husks and toasted). She does this every day on the outskirts of the San José district market. She uses this income to help her husband, who works as a mason, with the family expenses. Luz also sells charcoal from a stall and also uses this fuel to prepare her dishes. She wants to acquire pots and a small stove in order to improve her business, so she is asking for her first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa. Luz is a very hard working mother, committed to her family. Her greatest desire is to be able to proviD. her children with a good education so that they can establish careers in the future. Her neighbors consider her to be a very honest and hard working person.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo C. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old, is married, and has nine adult children. Rodrigo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rodrigo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Dama Esha Jefwa

texts.en:
Dama M. is a 51-year-old married mother of four children.  Dama runs a café in Junju in Kilifi, Kenya. She has been in the business for one year. 

Dama was introduced to KADET by a neighbor who is an existing KADET client.  This marks Dama’s first loan from KADET and with this money she hopes to purchase stock of beans, maize and sugar to be used in her cafeteria. Her clients are the residents of Junju.

Dama hopes to improve her living standards from her business.

loans.use: purchase stock of beans, maize and sugar

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
La señora Blanca L. tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion en la Colonia Flor del Campo, realiza sus ventas de Lunes a Domingo de 5:00 Pm hasta las 10.00 Pm,  cuenta con clientes fijos
quienes le gusta mucho los Tacos que hace, asi mismo vende yuca, tajaditas de platano fritas y
pastelitos.
Siempre le ha gustado dedicarse a la venta de comida, Blanca utilizara el prestamo para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las golosinas, ya que hace dos meses su hija estuvo muy enferma y tuvieron que operarla, por lo que tuvo que hacer varios gastos y necesita reponerse de lo sucedido.
Gracias a dios su hija ya esta recuperada, Blanca es madre viuda, ya que su esposo fallecio hace algunos años y  se quedo criando los dos niños sola. En la zona es muy conocida por el buen gusto que le da a la comida.
texts.en:
Blanca L. is 44 years old and works preparing and selling sweets. She has been doing this for many years. She has her business in her house in the Flor del Campo neighborhood, and she makes her sales from 5:00pm until 10:00pm Monday through Friday. She has regular customers who really like the tacos she makes. She also sells yuca, plantain chips and cakes. She has always liked selling food. Blanca will use the loan to buy more materials to make the sweets, since two months ago her daughter was very sick and they had to operate on her. For this reason she had to spend extra, and now she needs to recover from what happened. By the grace of God, her daughter is now recovered. Blanca is a widowed mother, since her husband passed away several years ago and she was left raising both her children alone. She is well-known in the area for the good flavor she gives her food.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, corn flour, condiments, oil, chicken, disposable plates, plantains, potatoes, lard, juice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Her husband’s support of her farming business is Paquita’s inspiration to keep working through the challenges of poverty and growing her business despite that. The farming business has brought pleasure to Paquita’s family. Because of its profits, she has been able to support the family’s needs. Being a good mother, Paquita has always wanted to support her children in whatever career they would follow to better their own lives. 

Aside from Paquita’s farming business financed by the loan she received from ASHI, she also has a hog raising business which is her way of saving her profits to support the needs of her family, especially for her grandchildren’s education until college. For that, Paquita is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to purchase fertilizers,“palay” (unhusked rice), and support her hog raising business. This will make their business grow and make more profit, which will enable her to support her ambitions in life.

Paquita has been an ASHI member since 1998. Her family is very glad that she has an opportunity to improve their quality of living through the income of the farming business she has established with the support of the loans she has requested.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer and rice seed; maintaining hog raising business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pigs to raise

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is an active member of Vision Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been farming for nine years and employs six casual labourers. His main products are maize and nappier grass which he sells locally. He also supplies ballast and owns a quarry. His major challenge is lack of fertilizer and manure for his nappier grass. John is 35 years old and married with five school-aged children.

John has requested this loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this loan, he will be able to provide his family with enough milk for consumption. The extra income from the sale of milk will be used to pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in future his ballast business will improve and that he will have acquired other dairy cows that will increase his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 55 years old. Gloria is married and has six children. Her eldest is 34 and the youngest is 24. Gloria owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria sells fruits, vegetables and dried fish.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Lina de 35 años y sus 3 pequeños hijos, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde muy joven aprendió las técnicas para la construcción de viviendas; y en la actualidad se desempeña como obrero en diferentes trabajos, y lo contratan por temporadas. Le gusta mucho su labor pues obtiene ganancias que le permiten ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Él esta muy orgulloso pues su pareja lo ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ya que  trabaja como tejedora de bolsos y accesorios en una asociación de damas de su zona. Juntos buscan que trabajar a diario sin descuidar la educación de sus pequeños hijos. Como Pedro es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado terminar de construir su vivienda, e instalar un negocio en ese lugar, pues quiere dejar bien asegurado el futuro de sus hijos. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Pedro tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de algunas herramientas que necesita para su labor como obrero; además quiere ayudar a su pareja en la compra de materiales que necesita para seguir tejiendo, de esta manera espera continuar trabajando.
texts.en: Pedro is 60 years old and lives in his own house with his spouse, 35, and their 3 children. Together they work every day to get ahead. When he was very young, he learned the techniques to build houses. At present, he works as a laborer at different jobs. He is hired seasonally. What he likes the most about his job is getting income which allows him to offer a good quality of life to his family. He is very proud and his spouse helps him with the household expenses. She works weaving bags and accessories in a women's association in the area. Together they look for work every day while still raising their small children. Since Pedro is an enterprising man he has planned for the future finishing his house and setting up a business there. He wants to insure the future of his children. This is the first loan that he has had with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time since he doesn't want to look bad to the people who made this money possible, which will allow him to continue working and seeking progress. Pedro plans on investing the loan he has applied for in purchasing some tools that he needs for his work as a laborer. In addition, he wants to help his spouse purchase materials she needs to keep weaving, and in this way she hopes to keep working.

loans.use: To purchase tools to continue his work as a laborer.

loans.name: Kyosimbaonanya Kikajjo-Kampala Group

texts.en: Maureen K. is 42 years old, has four children and leads a loan group called Kyosimbaonanya Kikajjo. For the last four years, she has made a living by running a small grocery store in the town of Namasuba. She started this business by investing a small amount of money she earned by farming, and today earns 100,000 shillings a month from the store and a small maize mill that she operates. Maureen has applied for this loan because she would like to expand her shop by buying more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items to sell from a small store

loans.name: Dembe Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en: Despite her single marital status, 50-year-old N. Margret has not wavered from principles she says have made her the respectable woman that she is. Being uncompromisingly diligent and standing strong in the face of financial adversity have been winning hallmarks in the execution of her fish sales business. She has been in business for the last five years, and her business is situated in Nasuti-Mukono. She earns 150,000 shillings in profits. With this loan she says she is going to purchase more fish for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Alhamdulilai Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Alhamdulilai II” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, also a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 2,500,000 SLL to be shared equally among themselves. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Musa T. is the leader of this group. The forty-five-year-old is married to a businesswoman, and they have two children. Musa has been selling groundnuts for twenty years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy bags of groundnuts to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Elham

texts.ar:
الهام في عمر 38 سنة متزوجة ولها ولدان زينة تحب عائلتها كثيرا وهي كل اهتمامها تعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية 
بالاضافة الى حبها للخياطة الهام تعمل من اكثر من  12 سنة تريد تطوير نفسها وعملها وعائلتها من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة تريد شراء 
بضاعة جديدة للمحل شوكولا وغيره بمناسبة العيد لها مهارة عالية في عملها فهي متطورة وطموحا عملها مميز بالدقة والنشاط تحب ان تساعد عائلتها 
على تحسين وضعهم المادي فهي من يهتم بعائلتها واولادها
texts.en: Elham is a 38-year-old wife and mother of two who loves her family very much and wants to help them advance. For the past twelve years, she has been working at a convenience store and as a sewing professional to help provide for her family. Elham is very skilled in her work, which she applies great meticulousness and energy to. Elham now would like to seek a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase chocolate products and other foodstuffs to stock up for the holiday celebrations.

loans.use: Purchase foodstuffs for convenient store.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el sector Sialupe Huamantanga del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría aves de corral cerca a su domicilio y las alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estas se desarrollan completamente se encarga de ofrecerlas en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general.

Lucila desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más alimento para mejorar la crianza de sus pavos. Con esta acción ella planea percibir mayores ingresos por la venta de sus animales, sobretodo durante esta temporada en la cual la demanda suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucila, 45, is married living with her family in Sialupe Huamantanga in Lambayeque region, a rural zone located over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works in farming related activities, especially raising small farm animals for sale.  She raises barnyard fowl in a corral near her house that she feeds on grains and natural grasses.  When they develop completely she sells them to merchants in the area and to the general public.

Lucila wants to expand the business buying more feed to improve turkey raising.  With this action she plans to receive higher income from the sale of her animals, especially during this season when demand tends to increase.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan she plans to use to reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy more feed to improve her turkey raising.

loans.name: Señor De La Agonia-Taray Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor D. la Agonía” ya tiene 4 años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días y la mayoría D. las socias viven en la comunidad D. Taray que está ubicada a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.   

Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. artesanía, venta y compra D. ganado, venta D. chicha, crianza D. cuyes, venta D. artículos D. ferretería,  venta D. verduras, y venta D. abarrotes. 

Fernanda, tiene 43 años y tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal D. Fernanda es la venta D. comida. Ya son varios años que abrió un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donD. sirve almuerzo. Utilizo sus ahorros para implementar el restaurante, donD. aproximadamente atienD. a más 20 D. clientes todos los días. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Fernanda que espera recibir D. S/. 1,500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas pero le gustaría emplear el dinero  D. este préstamo para comprar más gaseosas, arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más.   

La socia margarita no está en la fotografía por que tiene permiso D. la junta directiva del banco comunal y no esta presente en el desembolso.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Senor D. la Agonia" has already had 4 years together and it is maD. up of hard working, enterprising women who are on a constant lookout for opportunities to get ahead. And with daily effort they look to proviD. a better future for their kids. The community bank meetings take place every thirty days. The majority of the members live in the community of Taray, located about 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.

The business activities of some of the members are, for example: craft sales, buying and selling livestock, the sale of chicha drink, raising and selling guinea pigs, hardware store, produce sales, and general store. 

Fernanda is 43 years old and she has three children. Fernanda has a restaurant. It has been many years since she first opened the small restaurant from where she sells breakfasts. She used her own savings to set up the restaurant. She serves approximately 20 clients every day. 

Fernanda requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 nuevos soles. Her restaurant is only modestly equipped with only the most basic inventory and she would like to use the loan to purchase more soft drinks, rice, sugar, and various other types of inventory.

Margarita is a member who is not shown in the photograph and the community bank is in unanimous agreement to exempt her from participating in this loan.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, rice, sugar, and other inventory.

loans.name: Beatriz's Group

texts.en:
Beatriz A.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs. She is 50 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Caraniogan. Beatriz has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2007, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. 

Beatriz is the leader of a four member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Beatriz A.'s Group".

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Flores De Libertad Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “FLORES DE LIBERTAD” iniciará su  segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de verduras, tienda de barrio surtida, taller mecánico, venta de comida, venta de fruta, venta de ropa.

La señora Juana, presidenta de la asociacion comunal, indica que forma parte de  “Flores de Libertad”  medio año.  Actualmente vive con su pareja y ambos cuidan de sus hijos.  Su negocio es la compra - venta de ropa nueva.  La señora Juana indica que antes de ser cliente de Pro Mujer era ama de casa y negociaba con ropa usada,  sufria por que el dinero no le alcanzaba, ahora que ella se ha capitalizado con un crédito de Pro Mujer, cambió de negocio y vende ropa nueva, tiene un ingreso que le permite aportar a la familia, se siente más contenta.  Por su parte el esposo, quien se encontraba en sala, dice que le gusta que su esposa este en el grupo por que ya esta dejando de ser timida.

El crédito que ha solicitado la senora Juana le permitirá comprar mas ropa y surtir la mercaderia que esta vendiendo. 

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta compartir con el grupo.
texts.en:
The “FLORES DE LIBERTAD” (Flowers of Freedom) communal association will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members.  Their businesses are varied: vegetable sales, stocked neighborhood store, machine shop, food sales, fruit sales and clothing sales.

Juana, President of the communal association, indicates that she’s been part of “Flores de Libertad” for half a year.  She lives with her spouse and both care for their children.  Her business is new clothing sales.  Juana states that before being a Pro Mujer client she was a housewife and traded with used clothing.  She suffered because money was never enough.  Now that she has capitalized with a loan from Pro Mujer she has changed business and now sells new clothes.  She has income that makes it possible for her to contribute to the family and she feels happier.  For his part her husband, who was present in the room, states that he likes that his wife is in this group because she is starting to be less timid.

The loan which Juana has requested will allow her to buy more clothing and replace the merchandise she sells.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she states that she likes sharing with the group.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia Del Carmen tiene 50 años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos. Tiene más de 4 años en este negocio. Inicio como una forma de ingreso para su hogar tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad a su cargo. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija, entre amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que acuden a su vivienda, pero la mayoría de veces ella tiene que salir de manera ambulante a ofrecer sus productos. Para el  futuro desea establecer su negocio en el mercado, en donde transitan muchos clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de polvos, lápiz labial, tratamientos y pintura de uñas. Esta es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy emocionada.
texts.en:
Sonia Del Carmen is 50 years old.  Her business is selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for more 4 years.  She started her business as a way of making income for her household.  She has 2 grown-up children in her care.

Sonia currently has regular customers amongst her friends in the neighborhood, locals and neighbors who come to her home.  However, most of the time she goes out door to door to offer her products for sale.  In the future, she would like to set up her business in the market where there are a lot of customers.  She is requesting this loan to buy powders, lip sticks, treatments and nail polish.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan and she feels very excited.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is currently in the business of selling books. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children -- all of whom go to school. Christine borrowed a loan to stock more books to sell.  She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock books to sell

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María Antonieta; la socia tiene 37 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia es docente del nivel primario y trabaja en un colegio nacional de lunes a viernes ,la socia a la vez tiene otro pequeño ingreso que es venta de zapatillas y zapatos de marca como adidas,nike,puma entre otros la socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Tacna para comprar su mercadería y así poder venderlos a sus clientes esta actividad lo realiza de vez en cuando de preferencia cuando está de vacaciones.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: María Antonieta is a member of the community bank ” MOSOQ RUNA” in Cusco.  She is 37, married and has three children.  María Antonieta works as a primary school teacher in a public school on weekdays.  She also has a small business selling shoes, including popular brands such as Adidas, Nike, Puma and others.  María Antonieta occasionally travels to the city of Tacna when she has time off, to buy merchandise for resale to her customer base.  She seeks a loan in order to buy inventory of shoes for her business, and is committed to prompt repayment of the credit.

loans.use: to buy inventory of shoes for her store

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is married, with four boys, all of whom attend school. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a freezer for storing fish for sale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Salma decided to work with Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for storing fish for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is married and mother of two children. Her husband is employed and offers support in the family’s upkeep. Josephine runs a bread depot in Mariakani and she has been in this business for 11 years. The business is a success.

This is Josephine’s second time borrowing from KADET and she plans to purchase thirty crates of bread for her shop for re-selling. The income and profits she hopes to make will be directed into servicing the loan and to purchasing more stock of bread. 

Josephine hopes to become a very successful businesslady in Mariakani

loans.use: purchase thirty crates of bread.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren A. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and only daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a house that they bought on mortgage. His daughter studies in secondary school and his wife, Oyungerel, 34, helps in her husband’s business. 

Baasansuren is an artist. He makes different things like bags, purses, hats, paintings and souvenirs from colored sheep wool. He has been doing this for eight years. He makes items to order and also sells them in souvenir shops. His products are in good demand during tourist seasons. 

He is asking for a loan to buy sheep wool and paints to make beautiful souvenirs to sell.

loans.use: To buy sheep wool and paints to use in his souvenir-making business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Adjoa sells different types of underwear in Abura. She will use this loan to purchase more underwear to expand her business. With the new profits generated from this loan, Adjoa plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María del Rosario es una clienta de 26 años de edad, ella es madre soltera de un niño y vive en casa de sus padres en una pequeña comunidad rural del distrito Las Lomas de Piura.

María del Rosario cuenta con una tienda (instalada en su propio domicilio) de productos de primera necesidad, en la que vende abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas y productos de higiene personal. Su tienda es una de las más surtidas en la zona y es por ello que cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes. 

María del Rosario solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería e incrementar los inventarios y así poder atender en menor tiempo a sus clientes. Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo económicamente y mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeño hijo, ofreciéndole mayores comodidades.

María del Rosario es cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad. Su primer crédito fue KIVA y lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
26-year old Rosario is a single mother of a son. She lives with her parents in a small rural community in the district of Las Lomas de Piura.

Rosario runs a shop out of her home selling basics such as groceries, candy, drinks and personal hygiene products. Her store is one of the best-stocked in the area so she has a large number of customers.

She is seeking a loan of S/. 2000 from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise and increase her stock so that she can serve her customers in less time. The loan will allow her to continue to grow economically and improve the standard of living of her small son. She will be able to provide him with a more comfortable life. 

Rosario is a regular client of Edpyme Alternativa. Her first loan was with Kiva and she repaid it punctually.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Hoeurn (pictured here) is 33 years old and her husband, Vuth, is 39 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1997 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. 
 
Hoeurn sells vegetable. She buys papaya, eggplant and yam and transports them to sell in the market located at another site along the Mekong River. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for a loan of $400 to build new walls of her house because they are old and broken.

loans.use: To build new walls for her house.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.

Ali has owned a factory since 2009, where he manufactures blocks. He has good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $1200 loan to buy a block-pressing machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a block-pressing machine.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente nacido en Chuquisaca casado con la Sra. Martha, ella es ama de casa, tienen dos hijos, hace 10 años que llegaron aquí a Santa Cruz para buscar mejor vida, en la cual lo encontraron adquiriendo una parcela para trabajar en agricultura, su actividad mayormente es la siembra de  hortalizas y verduras como ser: zanahoria, camote, acelga, repollo y todo lo que el hace producir lo comercializa personalmente al consumidor, el destino del créditos es para la siembra de camote y para el preparado de la tierra, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Vicente was born in Chuquisaca.  He is married to Señora Martha.  She is a housewife.  They have two children.  Ten years ago they arrived here in Santa Cruz in search of a better life.  They have acquired a plot of agricultural land to work.  His primary activity is sowing vegetables and root crops such as carrots, sweet potatoes, chard, and cabbage.  Everything that he produces he markets personally to the consumer.  The purpose of the loan is for the sowing of sweet potatoes and to prepare the land.  He is a very hard worker and grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to sow sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Responsibility for the family is the big responsibility of Yam who is the head of his family. Yam rides a motorbike in Siem Reap. Every day he wakes up early in the morning to find customers so he can support his family. He can earn only $4 per day to give to his wife. Talking about his wife, she doesn’t stay at home; she has a job which involves counting money. With her patience and good characteristics, it is an easier job than others. Yam wishes to borrow an amount of $600 with the aim of repairing his old house.

loans.use: to repair his old house.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny (in the photo), 64, is a widow.  She lives along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She has two sons and one daughter. Both of her sons are married and live outside the family home and the daughter is a garment worker.

Ny sells cakes in her village.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help her son’s business by purchasing additional raw seafood (squid scallop and shrimp) for sale.

loans.use: To help her son’s business by purchasing additional raw seafood (squid scallop and shrimp) for sale.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya and is married with 4 children all in school. He has been in farming for 8 years and currently employs 2 farmhands who help him in producing maize, beans and milk. He also operates a motorcycle business for additional income.

Philip has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will help him pay school fees for his children and remains optimistic that he will be able to buy pure breed cows for better income in future.

He sees animal diseases as the impediment in farming owing to high costs for their management.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora María del Rosario es originaria del municipio de Telica y actualmente se desempeña en la dirección de un colegio del municipio velando por el aprendizaje de los alumnos ya que para ella la educación es lo primordial para el desarrollo.

Su nucleo familiar se compone por 4 personas las cuales son: ella, su esposo y 2 hijos que estudian carreras universitarias en el departamento de León, Ha tenido 9 créditos que le han sido de gran importancia ya que le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida. El crédito que solicita actualmente es para obtener algunos electrodomésticos para su hogar y en especial un mini componente (un reproductor musical con diversas funciones tales como sintonizar las distintas radios de Nicaragua, grabación de voz, acceso a usb, cd y dvd)  para uso familiar de manera que puedan aprovecharlo y así contribuir al desarrollo de su amada familia en el municipio de Telica.
texts.en:
Maria de Rosario is a native of the Telica jurisdiction. She currently works as director of a local school that is known for ensuring that students learn, which for Maria is a very important part of their development.


Her family is composed of 4 people: her husband, their 2 children, who are studying at the University in León, and herself. She has been granted 9 loans, and they have been really helpful for her as they have helped her improving her standard of living. The loan that she is asking for currently is to obtain some appliances for her home, in particularly a "mini-component" (a musical device with various functions that will allows one to synthesize various Nicaraguan radio stations, record voices, and offers access to USB data, CDs and DVDs) for the family to use, and thus contirbute to the development of her beloved family in the town of Telica.

loans.use: to purchase appliances and electrical equipment.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary (pictured above) is 29 years old, and her husband, Khemryn, is 41 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about twenty kilometers away. They have two children: one son and one daughter. One child is in school and the other one is still young. 

Theary is a garment worker, but she has stopped for a while because she is pregnant. Her husband sells rice; he buys rice from Phnom Penh market and sells them to his villagers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide capital for her husband to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.use: to provide capital for her husband to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en:
Sanyu is a 22-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school.  She has a business selling clothes in Dar es Salaam in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years.
