Amelita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Amelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Amelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sheyla María

texts.es: La señorita Sheyla María G. B. se dedica a la venta de calzado conjuntamente con su abuela, sus principales clientes son personal del poder judicial, Ministerio de Educación, vecinos.La solicitante es soltera no tiene carga familiar, vive con su madre y abuelita en pasaje el eden Acomayo Ica ,sueña con ampliar su negocio tener su casa propia por este mótivo solicita el préstamo, se propone otorgarle  el crédito por contar con buenas referencias acrediticias y personales.
texts.en:
Sheyla María G. B. works selling shoes with her grandmother. Their main customers are staff from the judicial branch, the Ministry of Education, and neighbors. She is single and does not have any dependents. She lives with her mother and grandmother on the street El Eden in Acomayo, an area of Ica. She dreams of expanding her business and having her own house, which is why she is requesting this loan. She qualifies to receive the loan for having good credit references and personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Khursheed Abdul Razaq's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed lives in the small Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She is very good at embroidery and takes orders from local people to provide them with finished products to earn an income for the family. She started this business three years ago and now handles a good number of customers.
Khursheed's husband is A. R.. He owns and operates a book-selling business. He has a small shop in the market from where he sells religious and course books and comics. He has been in this business for the past five years. Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy religious and course books and comics to increase his trade. Khursheed hopes that her husband will successfully improve his business by using the loan money. She plans to buy an embroidery machine for her embroidery business with the profit from her husband’s business.
Note: Khursheed is the lady in the picture who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy books for her husband's book-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides so she can care for her mango and lime crops

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: O. Fatima est mariée à MOSSOURO Moussibaou et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement, deux des enfants sont à la charge du couple. Depuis près de vingt huit ans, Fatima s’est installée au quartier Suru-Léré à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin), où elle vit avec sa famille. Fatima assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Fatima a très peu fréquenté l’école. Depuis environs quinze ans, Fatima prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce aux tomates, et aussi de la bouillie de maïs) à Kowégbo à Cotonou ; ce qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille et de satisfaire ses propres besoins. Fatima achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Fatima désire augmenter le volume de son activité et accroître sa clientèle et donc son revenu ; raison pour laquelle Fatima sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en: Fatima O. is married to Moussibaou Mossouro and has four children, all in school. Only two of the children are in the care of the couple. For close to twenty-eight years, Fatima has lived in the Suru-Léré area of Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin), along with her family. Fatima provides for the family with her husband. She has had very little schooling. For about fifteen years, Fatima has prepared and sold food (rice accompanied by tomato sauce, and maize 'bouillie' - a type of porridge) at Kowégbo in Cotonou; this has allowed her to feed her family and meet her own needs. Fatima buys her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having obtained five loans that were all repaid properly. Fatima wants to raise the volume of her business and increase her clientele and thus her income; this is why she is seeking another loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 45 year old businesslady. She has been in business for the last 16 years in a busy environment. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, unga (flour), bananas, tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables like cabbage and sukumawiki (kales), among other products. 

She is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to add stocks of cooking fat, unga (flour), bananas, tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables like cabbage and sukumawiki (kales). 

She is married and is a mother to six children, who are adults (over 18 years of age).  Two of her children are in college. She hopes to build a home with a proper water supply as well as purchase and develop a plot of land in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To buy grocery products for resale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene C. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 31 years old. Arlene is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods, and detergents in the local community. She is also engaging in buying and selling ready to wear clothing. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Ek Bo Group

texts.en:
Nineteen members are forming a group loA.. They are located in Veal Kandal village, Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Ek B., 54 years old, as the group bank president. Each member of this group will use his/her portion of the loA. for a different purpose. 
 
Mrs. Ek B. and her husband, Mr. Hang Sophy, are farming laborers, where they earn a little income to support their family. They have four children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory and one of whom is a student.  They work hard, but they still earn less income thA. is needed to support the family. Thus, she is requesting a loA. to buy rice for food intake.

loans.use: To buy rice for food intake

loans.name: Vilma Gloria Esmeralda

texts.es: Vilma Gloria Esmeralda C. de 50 años de edad, es una madre de familia muy responsable, la cual se esfuerza a diario por darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos. Ella es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad, junto a quienes reside en Armenia en el departamento de Usulután. Vilma posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, así mismo cuenta con un molino, los cuales están en su casa de habitación. Vilma solicita un préstamo a Integral con el gran deseo de poder mejorar su economía familiar, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda incrementar los productos de la tienda, y así mismo incluir otros nuevos, con los que tenga la capacidad de atender más pedidos por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vilma Gloria Esmeralda C. is 50 years old.  She is a very responsible mother who works hard every day to give all of the best to her children.  She is a single mother, and she has two minor age children.  They live together in Armenia in the Usulután department.

Vilma has a store selling perishable products and basic needs items.  She also has a mill.  Both her store and her mill are in her house.

Vilma is requesting a loan from Integral with the great desire to be able to improve her family finances.  The reason she is requesting a loan is to be able to increase the products in her store.  She will also include new products, which will give her the ability to take care of more orders from her customers.

loans.use: To buy perishable products and to pay for maintenance on the grinder

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 49 years old and married with four children between 8 and 25. She is well known in the business of selling different styles of clothes. This is her second successful year in this business, which she operates from 8 am until 8 pm every day.

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding to her inventory of men's and women's clothing.  With additional styles for sale, she hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to continue taking care of her family and keep reinvesting in her business and make better progress.

loans.use: To add a variety of styles such in men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Jesus Johana

texts.es:
Johana tiene 36 años D. edad, es conviviente, y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito D. la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo D. frutas.

Se dedica a la crianza D. ganado caprino y aves D. corral, en los lugares alrededor D. su casa.  Ella los engorda hasta que alcancen un nivel D. desarrollo adecuado para venderlos posteriormente. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economía diaria.

Teresa siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente ella desea comprar mayor cantidad D. alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Johana is 36-years-old. She lives with her husband three children in the TambogranD. district in the Piura province in the region of the same name. This area is characterized by fruit cultivation. 

She raises goats and poultry in the area around her house. She feeds and raises them until they're ready to be sold. This business allows her to help support her family in the daily expenses. 

Teresa always pushes herself to get her family ahead. Currently she wants to buy a large quantity of balanced feed for her animals. For this purpose she has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles ($375 USD) to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito D. calleria y departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 55 años D. edad y 4 hijos.  Su esposo es profesor jubilado.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. pescado seco y lo hace por el rio Ucayali, para poder ver más rápido su ganancia los venD. directamente a los almacenes que hay aquí en Pucallpa.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos comprará: 1 saco D. pescado liza seco, 1 saco D. pescado maparate seco, 1 saco D. pacotana seco, 1 saco D. pescado boca chico.
La señora Betty tiene que viajar en lancha vaR. días para poder comprar su pescado seco, pasando toda clase D. incomodidades, pero dice que el trabajo es así y que todo tiene un sacrificio, su esposo es el que se queda cuidando su casa mientras ella se encuentra D. viaje.
texts.en:
Sra. Betty is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of 2000) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 55 years old and has four children. Her husband is a retired teacher.

Betty has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for three years. She buys and sells dried fish that comes from the Ucayali River. To earn a quicker profit, she sells directly to the stores located here in Pucallpa.

This new loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy one sack of dried striped mullet, one sack of dried Amazonian catfish, one sack of dried “pacotana” (a local species of fish), and one sack of dried “bocachico” (another variety of fish native to South America).

Sra. Betty has to travel several days by boat in order to buy dried fish, which can be uncomfortable. However, she says the work is what it is and everything requires sacrifice. Her husband looks after the home while she travels.

loans.use: Purchase different types of dried fish

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Ella pudo estudiar la secundaria completa. 
Su actividad consiste en la crianza de pollos, actividad que es compartida por tota la familia y también se dedica a la artesanía, principalmente tejido de mantones y bordados. Está trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace doce años, el primer monto solicitado de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dicho dinero le sirvió para comprar telas y lanas para elaboración del bordado.
Ahora solicitara nuevo monto de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá  para comprar unas 30 docenas de pollitos y su respectivo alimento.
Su sueño es comprarse un lote en la ciudad de Tacna y seguir trabajando con su negocio.Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el trabajo en equipo.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Communal Bank “María Asunción Galindo” which is located in the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito-Juli, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Isabel was able to complete her high school education.

She raises chickens and engages in this business with the rest of her family. Isabel also makes handicrafts, primarily woven shawls and embroideries. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for twelve years. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase yarn and wool for making her embroideries.

Now she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN. The money will be invested in the purchase of 30 dozen chicks and poultry feed. Her dreams include buying a plot of land in the city of Tacna and continuing to work in her business. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank is being able to work as a team.

loans.use: Purchase 30 dozen chicks & poultry feed

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas” tiene  más de 2 años de formación y trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 2 señoras que emprenderán nuevos negocios sólo después de obtener el crédito.
La sra. Estela M. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, panificados, bebidas, etc. para poder mantenerse ella misma y a su familia; desde hace mucho tiempo desea poder aumentar la cantidad de productos ofertados en su puesto de venta, por eso solicita el crédito para poder realizarlo.
Todas las integrantes anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan más de lo necesario para facilitarles los recursos para su desarrollo y formación integral.
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas” (Women Working Together) has been in existence for more than two years and continues to work with Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of its members engage in productive businesses, but the group also includes two women who will start their own ventures after they obtain their loans.  

Sra. Estela M. sells fruits and vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other products in order to support herself and her family.  For some time she has wanted to expand her vending post, so she is requesting a loan to accomplish this goal.  

All of the members hope for a better future for their children.  For this reason, they double their efforts to secure what they need to grow and develop.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Dolores María

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. Este cantón es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
 
La señora Dolores es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace más de 15 años,  le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado con los créditos. Tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos y uno falleció, todos son  mayores de edad pero dos de ellos que son casados  aun viven con ella, tiene dos nietos y uno que esta  por venir. Su esposo es  comerciante.

Se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, toldos y semijoyas. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, nos dice que la mayoría de sus ventas son bajo  pedido. Trabaja todos los días, sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Nos cuenta que lleva diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, toldos y semijoyas ya que tiene algunos pedidos. Su sueño es crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother for a Better Future) meets every fifteen days in the May 24th Canton in the Manabí Province. This canton is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, and the variety of plant life. The people are friendly and hardworking. Most of them engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Sra. Dolores became a founding member of the Communal Bank more than fifteen years ago. She has always enjoyed the assistance she receives through the loans. Dolores is 56 years old, married, and has four children, but one of them is deceased. All of her surviving children are grown, but two of them are married and still live with her. Dolores has two grandchildren and another one on the way. Her husband is a merchant.

She has a business selling bedding, tarps, and costume jewelry. Dolores sells door-to-door and also from her home. She says that most of her sales are made through orders. Dolores works every day, offering her products on credit and collecting payment every eight days. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil every fifteen days or on a monthly basis based on what is needed. She indicates that she has been in business for ten years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy bedding, tarps, and costume jewelry since she has a few outstanding orders. Her dream is to grow with her business.

loans.use: To purchase bedding, tarps, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Edix Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Edix, tiene 52 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera tiene solamente una hija, ella se dedica a una tienda, la cual inicio por el apoyo de una amiga, en el negocio ofrece productos de consumo necesarios en el hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, pastas, ya que estos son demandados por los clientes, y este préstamo le beneficiara en mantener el inventario con mercadería suficiente para vender, fortaleciéndose y brindando un buen servicio a la clientela.
Las aspiraciones de doña Edix, es aumentar sus ventas, atender a más clientes y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su hija.
texts.en:
Edix, 52, lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel Department.  She’s a single mother; she has just one daughter.  She has a grocery store that she started thanks to help from a girl friend.  She stocks basic, daily use household items.

She needs a loan to buy such things as: rice, beans, corn, sugar and noodles since these are what customers demand the most and this loan will help her keep sufficient inventory on hand to sell, strengthening herself and offering good customer service.

Edix’s hopes are to increase sales, tend to more customers and improve her and her daughter’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar and noodles.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: L. is currently in the business of selling tea. She is a 23-year-old widow with 2 children; both of them go to school. L. borrowed a loan to stock more tea to sell. With the extra profits from her business, she hopes to pay for her children's schooling in the future.

loans.use: purchase more tea to sell

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with five family members of whom two work.

In 2006 Safaa opened his own boutique where he sells cosmetics and accessories. He has four years' experience, and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1200 loan to renovate his shop and to buy more merchandise. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Xiomara Elena

texts.es:
Xiomara de 46 años de edad casada y con 5 hijos en las edades de 13 a 26 años, reside con su familia en el barrio Las Américas, comunidad que mediante  procesos de sociogestión,   ha logrado adecuar parques y la unidad entre vecinos, que allí habitan,  con el liderazgo de su madre, muchos de ellos son parte de la basta clientela,  que tiene Xiomara en su negocio de confeccionar prendas de vestir como camisas, pantalones y ropa femenina en general.
Desde muy pequeña Xiomara jugaba con sus amigas y ella era la modista de su muñecas, desde ahí mostró su inclinación por este arte, en el que hoy tiene 20 años de experiencia en el oficio y 17 como emprendedora de su negocio,  ubicado en un local de su propiedad. De este negocio  Xiomara se siente orgullosa de su desempeño, adicionándole que es  la actividad que más le gusta y con la que ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar, principalmente en lo relacionado con el estudio de sus hijos; en sus operaciones cuenta con una máquina sencilla, una fileteadora y una descubridora, además de herramientas para lograr un buen desempeño, aunque su sueño es tener su infraestructura de negocios con tecnología de punta,  para ofrecer muchos empleos a gente que lo necesitara. 
Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará  rollos de telas e insumos para la fabricación de vestidos femeninos que tiene encargados y requiere dar respuesta oportuna a  sus clientes; esta  inversión será exitosa porque entregará a nuevos y recomendados clientes lo producido y con esta negociación aumentará su cartera de cuentas por cobrar, logrando también impactar sus utilidades. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su vivienda y en este sentido  se esfuerza diariamente por trabajar de manera persistente para lograrlo; mientras esto ocurre Xiomara  continua generando una rentabilidad no menor del 40%  que planea sostener, para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Xiomara, 46, is married and has 5 children whose ages range from 13 to 26 years.  She lives with her family in the Las Américas neighborhood, a community that is undergoing community organization; under her mother’s leadership the neighbors that live there have united and managed to equip parks.  Many of them are part of the vast clientele that Xiomara has in her dressmaking business.  She makes shirts, pants and women’s clothes in general.

Ever since she was a little girl, Xiomara would play with her friends and she was the dolls’ dressmaker.  Since then she showed her inclination towards this art.  Today, she has 20 years experience in the occupation and 17 running her business located in a site she owns.  

Xiomara is very proud of her development adding that it’s the activity which she most enjoys and with which she’s managed her home especially with respect to her children’s schooling.  

In her operation she has a simple sewing machine, an overlock machine and an interlock machine as well as additional tools to produce quality items although her dream is to have in her business’ infrastructure the most technologically advanced machines to offer employment to people who need it.

Her Kiva loan is the first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy three bolts of fabric and supplies to make women’s dresses she has on order and has to have ready on time for her customers.  This investment will be successful because she will deliver completed orders to new and recommended customers which will lead to an increase in her accounts receivable portfolio which, in turn, impacts her profits.

Her goal for later on is to modify her home so she strives daily with this in mind and works persistently in order to reach it.  While this happens, though, Xiomara continues generating a profit margin of no less than 40% that she plans to sustain so that her business continues growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Amigas Solidarias De Miguel Grau Group

texts.es:
La señora Nilda es Presidenta de la Alcancia Comunal "AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU" elegida por su dones de lider, es una persona muy trabajadora e imparcial.
La señora Nilda posee una bodega muy bien surtida en la cual se dedica todos los dias de la semana, con ayuda de su mayor hija, anteriormente tambien trabajaba 2 dias de la semana como empleada de hogar en una casa y tambien del cuidado del anciano que vive en ella, mientras que su mayor hija se dedicaba a vender en su bodega.
La señora Nilda se esfuerza por sus 3 hijos, a quienes quiere ver siendo profesionales en sus estudios, y darle lo que ella no tubo de pequeña para que sean personas de provecho en el futuro.
texts.en:
Nilda is the president of the "Amigas Solidarias de Miguel Grau" community bank.  She was elected for her leadership qualities.  She is a very hard-working and impartial person.

Nilda owns a very well stocked grocery store where she works every day of the week with the help of her eldest daughter.  She also used to work as a cleaner two days a week, cleaning the house of an elderly gentlemen who she cared for as well, while her daughter worked in the store.

Nilda works hard for her three children who she would like to see become professionals.  She would like to give them what she didn't have as a young girl so that they become good, hard-working people in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, groceries, food products etc.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, age 26, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice field farmer, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 per day. 

Sophea is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Via Ferrea Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres de este comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé, el mismo se formo de un grupo de vecinas y amigas de la zona. Actualmente el comité cuenta con 12 miembros, en el cual todas trabajan de forma responsable y organizadas. Se organizaron con el fin de promover el bien común entre todas las miembros.
La Sra. Myrna es tejedora de ñanduti (tejido hecho a mano para ropas, u ornamentos). Desde pequeña realiza este arte, ya que su madre se lo había trasmitido. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha logrado mantener a su familia y sus hijos. Ella sueña con algún día poder agrandar su negocio para poder seguir cómodamente con su trabajo.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los materiales necesarios para continuar con su trabajo, estos materiales consistirían en hilos de todas clases y colores, y ademas de eso todos los tipos de agujas que llegaría a necesitar. La Sra. Myrna tiene mucha fe en el credito y que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the city of Caacupé. This group consists of neighbors and friends from the area. There are currently 12 members in the group, all of whom work responsibly and in an organized manner. This group has joined together to promote the common good among all its members.

Sra. Myrna produces “ñanduti” (a handmade lace used in clothing and decorations). She learned this craft at a young age from her mother. Through her work, Myrna has been able to support her family and her children. Her dream someday is to expand her business so that she can continue to work comfortably.

She is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials to continue her business. These materials consist of different types of thread in various colors and different types of needles. Sra. Myrna has plenty of faith that this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase thread and needles.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es: José Alfredo de veintiséis años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia. El produce tejas que le vende de muy buena calidad se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las vende a precios accesibles; se levanta de desde muy temprano para producir lo propuesto en el día. José Alfredo es una persona muy carismática siempre recibe a su clientela con una sonrisa en el rostro el está convencido de que puede vencer todos los obstáculos que se le presenten es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima para la producción de teja. José Alfredo tiene la esperanza que su esfuerzo en el trabajo le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una seguridad económica para el hogar.
texts.en:
José Alfredo, 26, lives with his common-law wife and son in his own home.  He makes high quality roof tiles and has many customers because of his competitive prices.  He gets up early in the morning to produce what he has scheduled for the day.  

José Alfredo is a very charismatic person who receives his customers with a smile.  He is convinced he can overcome all of the obstacles that stand in his way, and therefore is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL so he can buy raw material for his tile production.  He has the hope that through his hard work he will be able to give his family a better lifestyle and financial stability.

loans.use: To buy clay.
